loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 45 years old and five of her children are in school.

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 27 years. Alma requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 25 years old and has one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like cup noodles, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Janice has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like cup noodles, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 28 years old and has four children. Divina is married and has two children who are in school.

Divina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Divina has been in this business for two years now and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 45 years old and has two children. Mercedes is married and has one child in school.

Mercedes is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Mercedes has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is a 48-year-old woman from the community of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with five children. With her husband, they have farmed rice for a living for the last ten years.

She is asking fpr a loan to buy fertilizer for her farm and grocery items for consumption. Cerila hopes to maximize her farming so she can save enough for her children's education and reinvest in the same business for a better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and grocery items.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 43 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Bernadith is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Bernadith has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jessa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Jessa is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Jessa has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Regina works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming root crops in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Regina is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business farming root crops.

Regina has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Apolinaria is 54 years old and five of her children are in school.

Apolinaria has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Apolinaria requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

In the future, Apolinaria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Iveth Ondina

texts.es:
La  Señora Iveth de 32 años de edad  es casada  tiene una pulpería y se dedica a la venta  abarrotería y refrescos  como ser: Jabón, manteca, arroz, frijoles, papel higiénico medicinas, cosméticos etc.  sus clientes son todas las personas vecinas y amigos que le prefieren por ser un persona muy amable.
Doña Iveth en su negocio ofrece todo lo que es producto de la canasta básica, También ejerce como maestra en un  jardín de niños, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de  arroz, café, queso, pan, agua, arroz, huevos, etc.  Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar mas sus ingresos y mejorar aun mas su vivienda.
Su sueño es tener más surtido su negocio y tener una mejor condición de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Iveth is 32 years old. She is married and has a small store where she makes a living selling groceries and refreshments such as: soap, butter, rice, beans, toilet paper, medicine, cosmetics, etc... All of her customers are neighbors and friends who prefer to shop with her because she is such a nice person. Iveth's business offers all of the basic necessities. She is also a kindergarten teacher. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, coffee, cheese, bread, water, eggs, etc... And with the earnings and the support from the loan she intends to improve her income and even do some home improvement. Her dream is to have more variety at her business and better quality of life.

loans.use: with the purchase of rice, coffee, cheese, bread, water, eggs, etc... for her business

loans.name: Cepriana

texts.en:
Cepriana is a widowed woman with one child. Cepriana is 59 years old, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cepriana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 41 years. Cepriana requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy buckets of fish to sell.

In the future, Cepriana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 45 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Felomina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Kristina Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Kristina Mae is a woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Kristina Mae is 19 years old now.

She does business buying and selling personal care products in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like lotion, face powder, etc.

Ma. Kristina Mae has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like lotion, face powder, etc.

loans.name: Ritchell

texts.en:
Ritchell is 33 years old and married with four children. With three of her children in school, Ritchell works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ritchell has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is a woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jessa is 23 years old and has one child in school.

Jessa has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jessa has been in this business for one year. In the future she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Josephine has been in this business for three years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flower seeds (iris, Peruvian lily) and to repair the greenhouse roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase refreshments, meats, chicken, condiments, rice, beans, cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 68 years old and married with five children. With all of her children in school, Salvacion works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries.

Salvacion has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Fausta Karolina

texts.es:
La señora Fausta Karolina de 35  años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus  hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de costura elabora ropa como pantalones, camisas, faldas, juego de cortinas, cameras, etc. para dama y caballero y también hace remiendos, vive en San Lorenzo Valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña Fausta Karolina es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como 3 rollos de tela de varios estilos,  una maquina nueva eléctrica industrial  porque la que tiene le está fallando,  espera con el apoyo de este préstamo poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida, es una buena clienta y sus deseos don seguir  trabajando con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -   Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Fausta Karolina is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and her children in their own home. She has spent the last 12 years working on her business as a seamstress making clothing such as pants, shirts, skirts, sets of curtains, etc. for women and men. She also mends items. She lives in San Lorenzo Valle in the south of Honduras.

Fausta Karolina is a businesswoman with a desire to success and she struggles each day to improve her quality of life. She is seeking a loan to purchase products such as three spools of various styles of thread and a new industrial sewing machine because the one she has is failing. She hopes that with the support of this loan she will be able to continue with her business and improve her earnings and quality of life. She is a good client with the desire to continue working with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business and to increase her clientele, and at the same time, to improve her future together with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015

loans.use: to purchase rolls of thread and an electric sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Verònica

texts.es:
Verónica, tiene 27 años de edad, convive con su compañero sentimental, conforman una familia con tres niños, su hijo mayor tiene 9 años de edad, su hija tiene 7 años y la su bebé que tiene 9 meses de nacida. Verónica desde muy joven se ha destacado como una mujer muy trabajadora, máxime ahora que tiene una familia, aparte de ayudarle medio tiempo a su suegra en el restaurante familiar. Su actividad productiva principal es la venta de pantalones Colombianos para dama, inicio ofreciendo estos pantalones a conocidas, ellas recomendaron a Verónica para que aumentara su cartera de clientas, así lo ha logrado hasta el momento. Es por eso que necesita este crédito, con el fin de comprar 7 docenas de pantalones, marca By groover, ya que es la nueva marca que ella ha descubierto, ya los ha utilizado, entonces es consciente de la buena calidad de pantalones que vende, por eso le siguen comprando y están esperando la nueva mercadería para poder adquirirla.
Eligió Fundación Mujer porque anteriormente ya se le ha apoyado, demuestra ser una clienta buena paga, siempre cancela anticipadamente. Su sueño es abrir una pequeña tienda en el corredor de su casa para que las clientas lleguen adquirir la mercadería a un solo punto de referencia.
texts.en:
Verónica is 27 years old. She and her partner live together, and they have three children in their family. Her oldest son is 9 years old, her daughter is 7, and their baby sister is 9 months old. Verónica has been a very hardworking woman from a young age, especially now that she has a family. Besides helping her mother-in-law part-time at the family restaurant, her main work is in Colombian ladies' pants sales. 

She began by selling these pants to women she knew, and they recommended Verónica to others so that she could expand her customer base.  This is how she has been successful so far. This is why she needs this loan in order to buy 7 dozen "By groover" brand pants, which is the new brand she has discovered. She has tried them herself, so she is aware of the good quality of the pants she sells. That is why her customers keep buying them and are waiting for new merchandise to buy. 

She chose Fundación Mujer because it has supported her in the past. She has shown herself to be a client who makes her payments, and she always pays her loans off early. Her dream is to open a small store at her house on her covered porch, so that her customers can always come to the same place to get their merchandise.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen pairs of pants

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has one child who is in school.

Editha has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Editha has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rubén Arturo

texts.es:
Rubén es un hombre de 44 años de edad, es casado con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 19 y 28 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Santo Tomas La Unión.
Rubén para sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la elaboración de pan, gracias a su esmero y dedicación por elaborar sus deliciosos panes, mucha gente lo busca con frecuencia y esto lo ha favorecido a él, pero Rubén es uno de los hombres más favorecidos porque cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a la venta de comida.
Rubén con el afán de ofrécele a su familia las mejores condiciones de vida, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para proceder a la remodelación de su cocina, pues ya se encuentra en muy mal estado por lo que es muy necesario la remodelación.
El gran sueño de Rubén es construir una casa más grande para mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Ruben is a 44 year old man. He is married with a beautiful family of three children whose ages range from 19 to 28. This humble family lives in the Santo Tomas La Unión community.

In order to support his family, Ruben has made a living in the production of bread for 10 years. Thanks to his care and dedication to producing his delicious bread, many people frequently seek him out and this has encouraged him. Ruben is one of the most fortunate men because he can count on the support of his wife who makes a living selling food.

With the desire to offer his family the best living conditions, Ruben is requesting a loan to buy materials to proceed with the remodeling of his kitchen, since it is currently in very bad condition, making the remodeling necessary. Ruben's big dream is to build a bigger house for more comfort.

loans.use: to remodel the kitchen.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.ru:
Башорат умная и  заботливая женщина в возрасте 41 лет. У нее четверо прекрасных детей и любящий муж. Она работает журналисткой в местной газете. ( Чашмаи Шахристон). Она также в свободное время занимается животноводством. Это приносит её семье дополнительный доход. 
В данный момент Башорат с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Башорат заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Bashorat is an intelligent and caring woman aged 41. She has four beautiful children and a loving husband. She is a journalist with the local newspaper, Chashmai Shahriston. She also raises livestock in her free time to earn additional income for her family. 

Bashorat and her husband want to buy a few head of cattle for fattening. This is why she applied for a loan with Arvand to buy cattle. Bashorat thanks Arvand in advance for their support, which will improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Kunheng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Kunheng is 32 years old and she is a married mother who has two dependent children, one of whom is in school, while the remaining one is too young to attend school.

The main source of this family’s income is rice-growing, which she has been involved in for 14 years. To make more income, she is working for others for a fee. The rice crops were threatened by severe drought, so it grew unhealthily. She earns about KHR 39,700 per day.

Because she is in need of working capital to save her farming business, Kunheng is now forming a group of two members to apply for a loan from VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for her.

She will spend her loan portion to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to fruitfully grow her crop. She hopes she can earn more income to upgrade the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to fruitfully grow her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sonia Aracely

texts.es:
La señora Aracely de 42  años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su esposo  en su casa  propia, se dedica desde hace 10   años al negocio de venta de rosquillas  y carne de cerdo,  sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades  y también personas  de las comunidades vecinas  que tienen muchos años de comprarle sus productos,  vive en una aldea al sur de Honduras.
Doña Aracely es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida,  está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 3 cerdos grandes, maíz, cuajada, manteca, leña, etc. porque se acerca la temporada buena de septiembre  y quiere prepararse bien,  con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende comprar los cerdos a buen precio,  al mismo tiempo espera mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
Uno de sus sueños es que su negocio crezca y tener más clientela para poder mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Aracely is 42 years old. She lives with her children and her husband in their own home. She has spent the last 10 years working on her business selling donuts and pig meat. All of her customers are her friendly neighbors and also people from the nearby communities who have spent many years purchasing her products. She lives in a village in the south of Honduras.

Aracely is a businesswoman with a desire to succeed and she struggles each day to improve her quality of life. She is seeking this loan to purchase three large pigs, corn, curds, butter, wood, etc. because she is nearing the good season of September and she wants to be well prepared. With the support of this loan she aims to purchase the pigs at a good price and at the same time she hopes to increase her earnings, and also to improve her quality of life. One of her dreams is that her business grows and she has more customers so she can improve her earnings and her quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to purchase three pigs, corn, curds, butter and wood for her business.

loans.name: Grupo Yoxaja Nuevo Group

texts.es:
Maria (la primera del lado izquierdo de la foto de blusa celeste rayado) es una mujer de 42 años de edad, soltera con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 15 y 26 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Yoxaja.
Las tierras de Guatemala tienen la bendición de contar con manos femeninas que lo trabajan, tal es el caso de Maria una mujer y madre que con el objetivo de darle a su familia lo mejor, desde hace quince años se dedica al cultivo y venta de café, ella por vivir en una de las zonas más fértiles aprovecha la bendición de la madre tierra para generar sus ingresos. Maria por la necesidad que ahora se le presenta a decidido solicitar un crédito en ADICLA por ser una de las instituciones que apoya el trabajo femenino, con este crédito ella pagara la mano de obra y compra de fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de café,  y así poder obtener una buena cosecha para este año.
El gran sueño de Maria es incrementar su cultivo para que sus ingresos mejoren.
texts.en: Maria (the first one on the left of the photo, wearing light blue striped blouse) is a 42 year old woman. She is single and has a beautiful family of three children, who are between 15 and 26 years old. This humble family lives in a community of the Yoxaja village. The lands of Guatemala are blessed with feminine hands that toil them. This is Maria's case, a woman and a mother whose goal is to give her family the best. For fifteen years, she has worked cultivating coffee. Because she lives in one of the most fertile areas, she takes advantage of Mother Earth to generate her income. Due to necessity, Maria has decided to request a loan in ADICLA because it is one of the institutions that supports the work of women. With this loan she will pay for hand labor and will buy fertilizers to maintain the coffee, and in this way to get a good harvest this year. Maria's greatest dream is to increase the crops in order to have more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for hand labor.

loans.name: Nelson Alexander

texts.es: Nelson tiene 23 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo el cual le están dando todo el cuido y cariño necesario, él es un hombre muy trabajador que se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar se dedica a la venta de medicamentos como vitaminas, aspirinas, acetaminofén, amoxicilina  y crema etc. es así como él se gana día con día sus ingresos económicos desde hace 5 años, Nelson desea mejorar su vivienda ya que las láminas y madera ya se encuentran deterioradas y por eso solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, polines y láminas para mejorar su vivienda y darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 23 years old. He lives in his own house along with his life partner and a small son, to whom they are giving all of the necessary care and affection. He is a very hardworking man who cares about bringing nourishment to his home.

He works selling medicines such as vitamins, aspirin, acetaminophen, amoxicillin, cream, etc. It is through that he has been earning his daily income for the past 5 years. Nelson wishes to improve his home, because the metal sheeting and the wood are deteriorating. For that, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: cement, sand, beams, and metal sheeting to improve his home and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, beams, and metal sheeting to improve his home and provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.name: Seng Leap's Group

texts.en:
Aged 54, Seng Leap is a farmer and a married mother of two dependent children. She resides in Kampong Cham province where she has been growing rice as the main source of family’s income for 36 years. The hardship she faces is that the crops are now growing slowly and not healthy enough to produce good yields. She could earn about 33,300 KHR a day.

She decided to lead a group which consists of three members to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This is her fourth loan, and the past loan, which enabled her to buy household supplies for her family, was paid back successfully. Seng Leap, the group leader, will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well. She hopes this loan will help her to expand her business so as to earn more income to better support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to grow her crop well.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Kevin Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Kevin
Este solidario esta formado por doña Petrona, ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de útiles escolares, cosméticos, y material para manualidades, en su librería ubicado en San Bartolomé Milpas Altas, desde ya hace varios años, ella esta solicitando el crédito para compra de cuadernos empastados y útiles en general, así como compra de regalos para la temporada navideña, su deseo es tener bien surtida su librería  y estar preparada para surtir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Kevin" Solidarity Group

This solidarity group includes Petrona. She is 44 years old, and has been working for several years selling school supplies, cosmetics, and art supplies in her bookstore located in San Bartolomé Milpas Altas. She is requesting a loan to buy bound notebooks and general school supplies, as well as gifts for the Christmas season. Her wish is to have her bookstore well-stocked and to be ready to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy bookstore merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 33 years old and a resident of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to a bus driver with whom she has three children, one of whom is in high school, while the other two are at the elementary level. Her husband's salary as a bus driver is not enough to raise a family, which led Virginia to go into the food vending business.

Virginia buys pork and beef ribs and fresh chicken from meat dealers, repacks them by the kilo, then sells and delivers them in her local community. Ribs and chicken are a better and cheaper alternative than the expensive meat portion of pork and beef. They are cooked either stewed or boiled with veggies that make them more flavorful and healthy. She already has regular customers who order her products daily and weekly.

She is now humbly seeking your financial assistance to lend her PHP 20,000 to buy several kilos of chicken, pork and beef ribs. She is hopeful for your positive response. Your help will go a long way to help with her livelihood. Her income will surely cover their daily sustenance and send her children to school.

Virginia dreams of her business to flourish so she can afford to send her children to the best schools until college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fresh pork and beef ribs and fresh chicken to sell.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en: Eneria is a married woman with four children. She is 54 years old and resides in Litapan, Ozamiz City Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Eneria owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. Eneria requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional goods to sell. Recently, Eneria joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to build a house and have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Neives

texts.en: Neives is 53 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Neives works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc. Neives has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Neives would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 56 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general  store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional household goods to sell. Sylvia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them. Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Gemma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like candies, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.en: Leonidas works hard to support her family. Leonidas is a widow and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net. Leonidas has been in this business for 12 years now. In the future, Leonidas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net.

loans.name: Eneida

texts.es: Eneida de 64 años es una microempresaria que demuestra mucho entusiasmo y energía. Hace dos años los obreros de una empresa constructora le encargaron unos almuerzos y quedaron encantados, tanto que promocionaron su sazón y gracias ello su clientela incrementó;  afirma que lo más importante en este tipo de micro negocios, es que estos deben tener algo diferente que ofrecerle a su clientela, pues muchos de los consumidores de su comida regresan por el sabor de sus almuerzos a pesar de que en el sector hay otras opciones. Para Eneida el emprendimiento son aquellas tareas que le permiten mantenerse en actividad constante y su edad no debe ser en ningún caso, el paso a una vida pasiva y sin proyección, por eso está aspirando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Maria Santo Domingo para comprar al por mayor  carnes, verduras, legumbres, e insumos estos que requiere para incrementar el número de almuerzos por día y atender la demanda de su clientela. Su sueño de prosperidad es organizar su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Eneida is 64 years old and a business owner who shows a great deal of enthusiasm and energy. Two years ago the workers at a construction company ordered some lunches from her. They were so pleased with them that they promoted her good cooking and thanks to this her clientele increased. She says that the most important thing in these types of small businesses is that they must have something different to offer to their clientele, as many of the people who eat her food come back because of how flavorful her lunches are, in spite of the fact that there are other options in the area. 

For Eneida the tasks involved in her business are those that allow her to keep herself  constantly busy, and her age must never be a step toward  a passive, limited life. For that reason she is hoping to get her first kiva loan with the Fundación Maria Santo Domingo so that she can buy at wholesale meat, vegetables and the ingredients she needs to increase the number of lunches per day and serve customer demand. Her dream for success is to set up her own restaurant.

loans.use: To buy meats, vegetables, and other ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Senhor Alberto tem 40 anos de idade, solteiro negociante e vive em casa própria casa com os seus irmãos mais novos.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de bebidas diversas, carnes para abastecer o seu bar visto que sofreu roubo e não conseguia satisfazer todos os seus clientes.
No futuro pretende iniciar a construção de uma casa num outro terreno que adquiriu com finalidade de arrendar com forma de aumentar a renda familiar.
O seu maior desafio é de adoptar novas politicas de maketing visto que o mercado esta renhido e precisa de conquistar mais clientes para crescer o seu projecto.
texts.en:
Alberto is 40 years old. He is single and a businessman who lives in a house that he owns with his younger siblings.
He will use this loan to buy an assortment of soft drinks and meats to stock his bar after he suffered a robbery and was unable to provide for all of this customers.
In the future, he would like to begin building a home in a piece of land he acquired to rent out and increase his family's income.
His biggest challenge is to come up with a maketing plan in a tough market to attract more customers and grow his project.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of soft drinks and meats to stock his bar.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy petrol as her additional business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nilda is 59 years old. Nilda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nilda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more buckets of fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Nilda has been in this business for six years. In the future, Nilda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Ayaly Joy is 21 years old and is the younger of the two children in the family. Her mother, Jocelyn, supports the family through her pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ayaly Joy is studying for her Bachelor's of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in her fourth year of this four-year course. Her mother, Jocelyn, is borrowing 8,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees for the first semester in 2015-2016. When she graduates, Ayaly Joy plans be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis comenzó con su negocio de alquiler de lavadoras en un barrio del Municipio de Malambo a finales del año 2007. La idea surgió al palpar las necesidades de sus vecinos, quienes le solicitaban prestada la lavadora de su casa y consideró colocar un alquiler sería un negocio muy próspero. Con el pasar del tiempo el negocio se fue posicionando y pudo establecer su escala de precios y adquirir un buen número de lavadoras para atender la demanda de su clientela. Luis atiende su negocio desde la 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4: p.m. todos los días, sin embargo aún existe un mercado insatisfecho por lo que está aspirando a su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, inversión que planea utilizar en la compra de dos lavadoras adicionales que le generarán una mayor utilidad y contribuirá al crecimiento de su negocio y le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis started his business renting washing machines in the municipality of Malambo at the end of the year 2007. The idea came from probing the needs of his neighbors who asked him to use the washing machine in his house. He considered that opening a rental place would be a profitable business.

With the passing of time his business became established and he established his prices and acquired a good number of machines to attend to the demand from his clients. Luis looks after his business from 7 am until 4 pm every day.

However there is still an unfilled market so he is aspiring to get his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He plans to use it to buy additional machines which will generate greater profit and contribute to the growth of his business and allow him to improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy two clothes washing machines.

loans.name: Silvia Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Silvia de 39  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de Abarrotería, en su negocio vende  arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, harina, papel higiénico, frescos, agua, jugos, pollo, lácteos, jabón, etc. También vende todo lo relacionado a lácteos y cuenta con una variedad de Útiles escolares como cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, papel, y etc. sus clientes son todos sus vecinos amistades y demás personas que transitan por la zona y que a diario la visitan en su negocio
Doña Silvia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra cemento, ladrillos, madera, etc. para terminar un puesto nuevo de para su negocio y también necesita comprar leche para obtener la cuajada y los demás derivados de misma, es una clienta nueva con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Julio del  2015.
texts.en:
Silvia is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and children in a house they own. For 15 years she has worked selling groceries. In her business she sells rice, sugar, lard, beans, flour, toilet paper, soft drinks, water, juices, chicken, dairy products, soap, etc. She also sells all types of dairy products, and has a variety of school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, markers, paper, etc. Her customers are neighbors, friends, and other people who pass through the area and visit her store daily.

Silvia in a very entrepreneurial woman, with hopes to move forward. She fights day by day to better her quality of life. She seeks this loan to purchase cement, bricks, wood, etc. to finish a new stand for her business. She also needs to buy milk to make curd and other milk derivatives.

She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma. Her dream is to have a good business with a good inventory, and at the same time to better her future with her family.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, wood, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Senhor António tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos frequentando o ensino secundário, é segurança de uma empresa privada, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, pedra, varões, para ampliar a sua casa adicionando mais um quarto, visto que agora  não é suficiente para o agregado familiar.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e mobilar de modo a garantir conforto para a família.
O seu grande desafio é de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en:
António is 36 years old. He is married with 2 children who attend high school. He is a security guard with a private company and he lives with his family in a house that he owns.
He will put this loan towards the purchase of cement, sand, stone and rods to expand his house adding a room, as he doesn't have enough space at the moment for all the members of the family.
In the future, he would like to finish building his house to provide a more comfortable place for his family.
His biggest goal is to repay this loan on time, so he can have access to more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone and rods to expand his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
A  senhora  Maria de 40 anos de idade, auxiliar de saúde e mãe de solteira de 04 filhos todos a estudar, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro.
Com o empréstimo ira comprar cimento, areia, ferro, para ampliar um quarto para seus filhos, pós atualmente tem apenas 1 quarto.
Planos para o futuro, terminar a sua obra, adquirir mais bens, para tornar o seu lar mais confortável. 
Diz que alem de estar a trabalhar tem uma pequena  machamba próximo da sua casa e que com os empréstimos anteriores comprou bens e terminar a instalação elétrica da sua casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old. She works as a health assistant and is the mother of four children who go to school. She owns the house where she lives and sends money to support her mother.

With this loan, she will buy cement, sand, and iron to enlarge her children’s room, since she only has one room now.

She plans to finish building her house in the future, and buy more goods in order to have a more comfortable house.

She says that besides her job, she owns a small plantation next to her house. Also, that with previous loans she bought household goods and finished installing electricity at home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 54 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, personal care products, etc. Esterlita has been in this business for four years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, milk, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios is 56 years old and has two children. Remedios is married and has one child in school. Remedios is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Remedios requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies. Remedios has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en: Shirly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shirly is 48 years old and has two children who are in school. Shirly has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Shirly requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business. Shirly has been in this business for two years.  In the future, Shirly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 49 years old and a married woman with two children, one of whom in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business selling sand and gravel in the Philippines. Rose Marie requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to pay for laborer's salaries, maintenance, and to buy gasoline for her trucks to sell sand and gravel.

Rose Marie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rose Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for laborer's salaries, maintenance, and to buy gasoline for her trucks to sell sand and gravel.

loans.name: Seun

texts.en: Seun is 62 years old and lives in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are dependent children. Rice farming is the primary source of her income. Seun can get more income via working for a labor fee to support her family’s living. She has been involved in her businesses for four years. These businesses earn her about 60,000 KHR per day. This is the first time Seun has gotten a Kiva loan via VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this loan will help her and her family have better health than before.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Marta

texts.pt:
Senhora Marta tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais 4 estudam frequentando o ensino secundário respectivamente, é negociante e vive em casa própria com a sua família a qual sustenta junto com o seu esposo que trabalha como segurança de uma empresa privada.
O montante do empréstimo será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, pedra para dar continuidade a construção de uma dependência e construção de muro de vedação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende abrir uma serralharia visto que o filho formou nesta área e não consegue contrato de emprego.
O seu maior desafio e de liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora  de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos nesta instituição.
texts.en:
Marta is 47 years old. She is married with 5 children, 4 of them in high school. She is a businesswoman and she lives in a house that she owns with her family that she supports with her husband who works as a security guard with a private company.
She will use this loan to buy cement, sand and stone to continue building an addition to the house and to also build a fence.
In the future she would like to open a locksmith's workshop, as her son developed skills in the profession, but hasn't been able to find work in the field.
Her biggest goal is to repay this loan on time, to she can have access to more loans later on.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stone to continue building an addition to the house and to also build a fence

loans.name: Roberto Jonathan

texts.es: Roberto tiene 22 años de edad el es un joven que demuestra su espíritu de superación actualmente habita con su madre de 55 años de edad el está muy agradecido con su madre por haberlo sacado adelante ahora es él quien  ayuda a su madre la apoya en los gastos del hogar el se dedica a la compra de reciclables como papel, hierro aluminio, botellas plásticas desde hace 4 años  y es así como el se gana la vida en su diario vivir y gracias a este negocio obtiene sus ingresos económicos, Roberto desea mejorar los cuartos de su vivienda ya que se encuentran deteriorados, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para mejorar los cuartos y tener otra mejor calidad de vida para él y su madre así estar más seguros.
texts.en:
Roberto is 22 years old, and is a young man who shows a spirit of self-improvement. Currently, he lives with his 55 year old mother. Roberto is very grateful to his mother for having helped him get ahead; now it is he who helps his mother with the household costs.

Roberto has been earing his living during the past four years selling recyclables such as paper, aluminum, and plastic bottles. This is how he earns his living daily and thanks to this business has income coming in. Robert wants to improve the rooms of their home which are in poor condition. This is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI, to buy cement and sand to fix up the rooms and have a better quality of life for himself and his mother, thus being more secure.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand to inprove their rooms and have a better quality of life for him and his mother, thus being more secure..

loans.name: Exiquila

texts.en: Exiquila works hard to support her family. Exiquila is widowed and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net and gasoline for her business. Exiquila has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Exiquila would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 63 years old and married with six children. Editha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Editha has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from coconut wine vending. Editha aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 51 years old and married with four children. Victoria works very hard to provide for them. Victoria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like candies, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Victoria has been in this business for two years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like candies, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Bella works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut vending. Bella is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Bella has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby works hard to support her family. Ruby is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Ruby requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ingredients like meat, can goods, vegetables, etc. In the future, Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ingredients like meat, canned goods, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 37 years old and married with four children. Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries. Jocelyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. Jocelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en: Ana Marie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ana Marie is 46 years old and has two children who are in school. Ana Marie has a business buying and selling salt in the Philippines. Ana Marie requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of salt to sell. Ana Marie has been in this business for four years. In the future, Ana Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of salt to sell.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en: Joey is 29 years old and married with five children. With five children in school, Joey works very hard to provide for them. Joey runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries. Joey has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, shampoo, soap, tuba, soft drinks, fabric conditioner and other groceries. In the future, Joey would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Sally requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, egg, milk, sugar, etc. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, Sally would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, soft drinks, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Winefreda

texts.en:
Winefreda is 58 years old. She is a married woman with four children.

Winefreda is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Winefreda has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Winefreda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Tem 56 anos de idade, viúva a mais de 5 anos, mãe de 4 filhos todos maiores de idade e cada um no seu lar,cuida de 3 netos que vivem com ela e que os pais dos mesmos ajudam nas despesas, vive da criação de frangos e de venda de produtos alimentares, para alem de beneficiar de uma pensão de sobrevivência equivalente ao salário mínimo nacional. Esta a repetir o credito pela terceira vez, com os anteriores investiu nos seus negócios e na aquisição de uma maquina de sorvetes que esta a operar na cidade de Maputo, bem como na construção de quartos para futuramente alugar.
Com o actual credito pretende comprar: arroz em sacos, amendoim, açúcar, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu maior desejo é poder construir capoeiras que permitam maximizar a sua criação.
A morte de pintos tem sido o seu grande desafio, uma vez sendo algo nem sempre depende de si.
texts.en:
She is 56 years old. She became a widow more than five years ago and is the mother of four adult children who live in their own homes. She takes care of three grandchildren that live with her, although their parents help with their expenses. She raises chickens and sells foodstuff for a living. She also receives a survivor’s pension equivalent to the national minimum wage.

This is her third loan. She invested the previous loans in her businesses and bought a sorbet machine that she has in the city of Maputo. She also built some rooms to rent in the future.

With this loan, she is planning to buy bags of rice, peanuts, sugar, etc. to expand her business. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy chicken pens in order to optimize her poultry business.

Chickens die, and this is a big challenge for her. However, that is something that not always depends on her.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, peanuts, sugar, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Arone

texts.pt:
O  senhor Arone de 43 anos de idade, servente, viúvo há 4 anos pai de 6 filhos  dos quais 3 a estudar 2 já maiores de idade e 1 ainda menor, sustenta ainda sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro,  ela esta com 3 filhos, vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do empréstimo  irá comprar  cimento, chapas de zinco para cobertura,varões para dar a continuidade da sua obra.
O seu como projecto para o futuro, conclusão da sua casa fazer um muro de vedação, e contrair o matrimónio . 
Diz que  ira pagar pontualmente e dependendo das necessidades irão solicitar mais empréstimo ate conseguir realizar os seus sonhos .
texts.en:
Arone is 43-years-old janitor. His wife passed away 4 years ago, and he is father to 6 children, 2 of them of age, 3 of them in school, and a small child. He also supports his mother by sending her money, she has 3 children living with her. He lives in a house that he owns.
He will use this loan to buy cement, zinc roofing sheets and rods to keep working on the construction of his home.
His project for the future is finish the works, build a fence and get remarried. 
He is determined to repay this loan on time and depending on his future needs, he wants to ask for more loans to reach his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, zinc roofing sheets and rods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 year old and from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Albert, a barangay tanod, also known as barangay peace and security officer, with whom she has one child who is still at the elementary school level. Her husband's salary is not adequate to meet their their household needs, which led Josephine to start a small general store.

Josephine has been operating her store for two years already. She sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food and household items. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store means a lot to her since it has helped a lot in making ends meet in their day-to-day needs.

She is humbly seeking your financial assistance to lend her PHP 10,000 to fill her store with rice, canned goods, coffee, powdered milk and chocolate, biscuits and toiletries. She is thankful that her earnings from her store have helped send her child to school and cover their other household needs.

Josephine's simple dream is to have big grocery store someday and be able to send her child to college. Education is highly valued in a developing economy, for it is a path to uplift their lives. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.en:
Mauricia runs an eatery. She prepares and sells meals like stewed vegetables, fish and pork soup and adobo (a Filipino dish of chicken or pork stewed in vinegar, garlic, soy sauce, bay leaves, and peppercorns). Mauricia is a 54-year-old married woman with three grown children. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in this kind of livelihood for 15 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies like pork, pork bone, soft drinks, whole chickens, and spices, as well as to purchase additional chairs and tables. These could help Mauricia cook a variety of food and cater to the needs of her respective customers. Thus, her income would improve and she would able to settle her obligations. She could set aside some savings and expand her eatery business. In the future, Mauricia dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like pork, pork bone, soft drinks, whole chickens, and spices, as well as to purchase additional chairs and tables.

loans.name: Katheryn

texts.en: As a married parent of two children, Katheryn works hard to support her family. She has a delicacies vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Katheryn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional delicacies like cookies to sell for her delicacies vending business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Katheryn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to  buy additional delicacies like cookies to sell for her business

loans.name: Edwena

texts.en: Edwena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Edwena is 30 years old and has two children who are in school. Edwena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Edwena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more buckets of fish to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Edwena has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Edwena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more buckets of fish to sell

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Liezel works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Liezel is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food vending business. Liezel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is 63 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She is separated from her husband with whom she has one child who is now working. Being a single parent is her biggest challenge, but with her faith in God and hard work she was able to raise her child well.

Josephine has been blessed with a small general store and a ready-to-wear clothes business for nine years. She values and takes care of her two businesses, for they are her main source of livelihood. She earns money by buying grocery supplies and clothes at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.

To help her expand her business, she is seeking a PHP 30,000 loan to fill her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries. She will use part of the loan to pay for ready-to-wear clothes to sell. Although there are times she has difficulty collecting her payments from some of her customers, she still maintains a positive and understanding attitude towards them.

Josephine dreams of having a big grocery store someday and that God will bless her life with abundance. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O Senhor Fernando de 43 anos de idade, operador de frio, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 01 esta no ensino secundário ,1 no ensino primário 2 já são trabalhadores  1 ainda e menor sem idade escolar,  vive na casa própria.
Com o empréstimo ira comprar um jogo de sofás para mobilar a sua casa, deixando assim o seu  lar mais confortável.
O seu plano  para o futuro e de reabilitar a sua casa, pintar, vedar com um muro e abrir uma mercearia para lhe ajudar no seu sustento. 
Diz que  tem muita falta de dinheiro,  mas luta para superar e ainda diz que com o empréstimo passado comprou um congelador , e ainda vai pedir empréstimo .
texts.en:
Fernando is 43 years old. He is a cold chamber operator, he is married with 5 children, a small child, a grade schooler, a high schooler and 2 older children who are currently working. He lives in a house that he owns.
He will use this loan to buy a sofa set to furnish his home to make his living conditions more comfortable.
His plan for the future is to remodel his home, repaint, build a fence and open a grocery store to increase his income. 
He struggles financially, but he works hard to get ahead. He used his previous loan to buy a cooling unit and he would like to be able to ask for more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sofa set to furnish his home

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Mãe de 4 filhos todos a estudarem, tem 36 anos de idade, estudou ate 9ª classe, vive maritalmente à base de negocio e criação de frangos, conta com ajuda do esposo professor e director de uma escola com um rendimento mensal duas vezes mais que o salário mínimo nacional. Esta  a repetir o credito pela segunda vez, com o primeiro conseguiu comprar uma cristaleira para sua casa e com o actual, pretende ampliar a sua casa.
Pretende comprar material de construção: cimento, areia, pedra e pagar mão de obra aos que vão executar a obra.
Ela tem sonho de construir dependências para alugar ajudando deste modo ao seu esposo a garantir o futuro e a formação de seus filhos
texts.en:
She is the mother of four children who go to school. She is 36 years old and studied up to the ninth grade. She lives in a common-law marriage and works raising chickens. Her husband, who is a teacher and the director of a school, supports her with an amount twice as much as the national minimum wage.

This is the second time she receives a loan. With the first one, she could buy a crystal cabinet for her house, and with this one, she is planning to enlarge her house. She is planning to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, and gravel, and pay for the labor needed for the construction works.

Her dream is to build some rooms to rent, and together with her husband guarantee their children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel, and pay for the labor needed to enlarge her house.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emilia is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emilia is 43 years old and has two children who are in school. Emilia has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Emilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Emilia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Emilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma works hard to support her family. Vilma is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Vilma has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.en: Eulogia is 51 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Eulogia works very hard to provide for them. Eulogia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, condiments, and other groceries. Eulogia has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Eulogia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes is 54 years old and a widow with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedes has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. Mercedes has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Mercedes would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Chinda's Group

texts.en:
Chinda is a 41-year-old widowed woman and a farmer living in a rural village of Preah Vihear province. Chinda has five children, three of whom are dependent on her and only one of them is in school. To earn a living, she works as a handicraft, which has been the primary source of her family’s income for five years. She can earn more income via growing rice, to support her family. The crops have been destroyed by flooding and droughts are the main challenges for her business.

This is Chinda’s fourth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, and she paid back her past loans successfully. The previous loans helped her to have a better house to live in. In a group of five, she is the leader. She is going to use her entire loan portion to buy a decent latrine so her family will live in hygienic conditions. She hopes that all her family members stay healthy and are prevented from getting infectious diseases.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine so her family will live in hygienic conditions.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Dúo Villas Group

texts.es:
Anabey de 32 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales son menores de edad y van al colegio. El negocio al cual se dedica es un salón de belleza,  atiende desde temprano hasta el anochecer pues lo atiende en su casa y las vecinas de su colonia la encuentran a toda hora. Anabey solicita su primer crédito para la compra de materiales de su consumo como tintes, peróxidos y acrílicos.
El sueño de Anabey es tener un local propio para su negocio y así poder atender a mas clientes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Anabey, 32 years old, is married and has 3 children who are minors and attend school. The business in which she is engaged is a beauty salon. She works from early morning until dusk since she works at home and her community neighbors get ahold of her at all times. Anabey is requesting her first loan for the purchase of materials of her consumption such as dyes, peroxides, and acrylics.

Anabey's dream is to have her own place for her business and thus be able to tend to more clients in her community.

loans.use: to buy consumer products for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en: Rodelyn is 27 years old and a mother to a nine-year-old boy. She is engaged in fishing and a sari-sari store business together with her husband. This business started seven years ago. She is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a new set of fishing nets and merchandise for her store such as canned food, cooking oil, toiletries, coffee, milk, chocolate drink and eggs. She hopes to see her son become educated someday.

loans.use: to buy a new set of fishing nets and canned food, cooking oil, toiletries, coffee, milk, chocolate drink and eggs.

loans.name: Melody Pie

texts.en: Melody Pie is 31 years old and married with two children. Melody Pie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like peanuts, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries. Melody Pie has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. Melody Pie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like peanuts, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is a 58-year-old widow with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Feliciana has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. Feliciana has been in this business for two years. In the future, Feliciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 41 years old and married. Rowena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries. Rowena has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Rowena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emely is 44 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Emely requested a PHP 29,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Emely has been in this business for two years. In the future, Emely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts, paints, etc. for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 31 years old and has one child who is in school. Vilma has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell. Vilma has been in this business for three years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Narin's Group

texts.en:
Narin is 64 years old and married. She resides with her six children, one of whom is in school in Kratie province where she is growing cassava for the main source of family’s income. She gets additional income from rice growing. She has been in these businesses for 46 years. The drop of cassava price is her main challenge and which concerns her greatly. From her business, she is able to earn about 37,800 KHR a day and can save about 21,100 KHR every single day.

Narin is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of the three-member group, she will spend her loan on purchasing rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the farmland. She hopes she can earn more income to improve her standard of living and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the farmland.

loans.name: Dyra's Group

texts.en:
Dyra, 38, is a farmer living in a remote area of Kampong Cham province. She is married and has three dependent children, two of whom are in school. The remaining one works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been growing rice as the main source of their family’s income for 20 years. Since the crops have been destroyed by pests, Dyra can earn only about 30,000 KHR per day. She can save about 17,000 KHR after deducting daily expenses.

Now, she is leading a group of three to take out a new loan, which will be her second cycle, from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the previous loan that she fully repaid, she improved the living conditions of her family. The leader of a group of three, Dyra will spend her entire loan portion on purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizers, and paying for the plowing fee to grow her crop well. She hopes to get more income from her business in order to fulfill her dream of improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizers, and to paying for the plowing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Jossefina

texts.pt:
Tem 30 anos de idade, casada maritamente, mãe de 4 filhos todos menores de idade, 2 com idade escolar e que tem acesso a escola, vive a base de negocio e conta com ajuda do esposo que é que trabalhador com um rendimento mensal mais que o dobro do salário mínimo nacional. Esta a repetir o credito pela terceira vez e com os anteriores conseguiu comprar alguns bens para sua casa e juntar material para iniciar a construção de sua casa, pois de momento vive numa de material precário.
Com o credito pretende comprar material de construção: cimento, pedra, areia,etc, para dar inicio a construção de sua casa. 
A sua maior esperança é construir uma residência condigna para sua família e mobilar.
O seu maior desafio é a falta de fundos suficientes para concretizar seus sonhos em tempo útil.
texts.en:
She is 30 years old, married and the mother of four underage children; two of them go to school. She has her own business and her husband, who works and earns more than twice the national minimum wage, helps her.

This is the third loan she receives. With the previous ones, she could buy some household goods and some materials to start building her house; she is now living in a house built with rustic materials.
