With this loan, she is planning to buy building materials such as stones, sand, etc. to start building her house. She hopes to be able to build a dignified house for her family and furnish it. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funding to make her dreams come true in a reasonable amount of time.

loans.use: to buy cement, stones, sand, etc. to start building her home.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: Marlene solicita un préstamo de cuatrocientos mil colones (₡400 000) para la compra de materiales de construcción  necesarios para realizar mejoras en las paredes y techo de su vivienda, por medio de la obtención de este dinero ella podrá mejorar la seguridad de su familia.
texts.en: Marlene is requesting a loan of 400,000 CRC in order to buy construction materials that are needed to make improvements to the walls and roof of her home.  By obtaining this loan, she will be able to improve the security of her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador de 30 años de edad que vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos una niña de 7 años y un varón de 1 año de edad. La vivienda de José es conocida por ser la tienda de su comunidad, ya que cuenta con una pequeña venta de productos básicos desde hace dos años, y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, además su compañera de vida vende platos típicos que le permite obtener mejores ingresos económicos. José cuenta con un espacio en el cual inicio la construcción de un cuarto pero no logro terminarlo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para terminar de construir un cuarto para brindar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
30-year-old José is a hardworking man. He owns the house where he lives with his life partner and two children: a 7-year-old daughter and a 1-year-old son. Locals know where José lives, because he has been selling essential products there for two years. This business has helped him to get ahead with his family. His wife sells traditional food, which represents an additional income for the family.

José started building a room but could not finish it, which is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron. He will finish building a room that will make life more comfortable for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and iron to finish building a room.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda is 37 years old and married with three children. Yolanda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Yolanda has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Yolanda aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bananas. Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell to customers. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Remy

texts.en: Remy is 31 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Remy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Remy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 43 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Flora works very hard to provide for them. Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like school supplies, home product care, and other groceries. Flora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Flora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like school supplies, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Sarun is a 45-year-old farmer living in a rural village of Preah Vihear province. She is a married mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school. To support the family, she has worked as a handicrafts person for five years. She is also growing a rice paddy to supplement her family’s income. Because the crops have not grown well due to flooding and drought, she has earned less income than previously. This is Sarun's fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid the past loans completely. Now she is leading a group of seven to get a new loan. As the leader, she is going to buy a solar light bulb to brighten her house at nighttime. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy a solar light bulb to brighten her house at night time.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: Precilla is 53 years old and married with nine children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Precilla is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Precilla has been raising pigs for seven years and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 56 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Elsie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, chips, etc. Elsie has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, soft drinks, chips, etc

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 59 years old, and she is married, with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell.

Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Acela

texts.en:
Acela is 59 years old and married.   She works very hard to provide for her family.

Acela runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy bread, snack foods, and other groceries to sell.

Acela has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, snack foods, and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Milton Rafael

texts.es: Milton de 28 años de edad el es un hombre muy trabajador que se esfuerza mucho para salir adelante el actualmente vive junto a sus padres y sus dos hermanos de 20 años y 24 años de edad el ayuda a sus padres para los gastos de hogar él se gana la vida en una empresa cercana a su vivienda lo que le permite llevar el sustento del hogar pero además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos vende pan francés por las tardes es así como el mantiene su economía. Milton desea encementar el piso de su vivienda la parte de afuera ya que se encuentran en mal estado, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento y arena para poder mejorar el piso y así no tener ningún peligro.
texts.en:
Milton, 28, is a very hard-working man who does his utmost to succeed in life. He currently lives with his parents and his two siblings, ages 20 and 24. He helps his parents with the household expenses. He earns his living at a company near his home, which allows him to help support his household, but as well, seeking a means of obtaining more income, he sells french bread in the evenings. This is how he supports himself.

Milton wishes to install a cement floor in his home, as the part outside is currently in a poor state of repair. So he is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase cement and sand for improving the floor to ensure safety.

loans.use: To purchase cement and sand to improve the floor of his home and ensure safety.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a man with five children and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He runs a sari-sari store selling home use products in their community to earn a living. He borrowed a loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and biscuits to sell. He saves a portion of his income in preparation for his children's future education.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Erika Del Socorro

texts.es: Erika es una mujer laboriosa de 36 años de edad, casada y madre de seis hijos que están a su cargo, ella es una mujer luchadora y perseverante que se dedica a la venta de tortillas y elotes desde hace cinco años, con el apoyo de su mama y su hija. Solicita por quinto ciclo el financiamiento en la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de maíz, leña y elotes. Una de sus metas es vender queso.
texts.en:
Erika is a hardworking woman. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of six children who are under her care. She is a fighter; a persistent woman who has been selling tortillas and grilled corn cobs for five years, helped by her mother and sister.

She is requesting her fifth loan from the institution because she wants to buy shelled corn, firewood and corn cobs. One of her goals is to start selling cheese.

loans.use: to buy shelled corn, firewood, and corn cobs.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en: Elly works hard to support her family. Elly is married and has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Elly has been in this business for eight years now. In the future, Elly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Maria Anabelle

texts.en: Maria Anabelle works hard to support her family. Maria Anabelle is married and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Maria Anabelle requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business. Maria Anabelle has been in this business for 11 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Maria Anabelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Asli

texts.ru:
Асли веселый и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 43 лет, женат, имеет троих детей. Асли в данный момент работает строителем на стройке, его жена работает швеёй. С детства Асли мечтал стать инженером, но так сложились обстоятельства, что он не смог получить высшего образования из-за финансовой недостаточности в семье. Но у него есть мечта дать образование своему сыну. 
Но у Асли на сегодня не имеется такой большой суммы, чтобы сразу заплатить за договор обучения сына. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, когда узнал что есть возможность получить кредит на оплату образования. Асли  желает получить кредит для оплаты обучения своего сына. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Asli, age 43, is a happy man with a positive attitude in life. He is married and he has three children. He is currently working on a construction site. His wife is a seamstress. Since his childhood his dream has always been to become an engineer, but the circumstances and his family's difficult financial situation did not allow him to get a higher education. However, he is still dreaming about giving a good education to his son.

At the moment, Asli doesn't have enough money to pay for his son's tuition fees. For this reason, and as soon as he heard about the possibility of receiving an education loan, he has turned to MDO Arvand. Asli wishes to receive a loan to pay for his son's education. He is looking very forward to a positive outcome and he thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education.

loans.name: Jilma

texts.en:
Jilma is married, with three children. She is 41 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Jilma has an abacca weaving business in the Philippines. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber to use in her business.

Jilma has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber to use in her business

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
At 33 years of age, Lim is a married mother blessed with five children, four of whom are dependent on her. Three children in school, and the fourth is too young to attend school. 

Lim is a cassava farmer in Kampong Cham province.   She and her husband have grown cassava as the main source of family’s income for 15 years. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee as supplemental income. 

Lacking of working capital is the main challenge to her business, so she formed a group of three members to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She paid back her past loan completely. The past loan helped her a lot, as she improved the standard of living for her family. 

As the group leader, she will use her loan to pay plowing fees and buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers for her farming. She hopes she can get better crop yields so as to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to pay plowing fees and buy cassava seeds and organic fertilizers for farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Don Oscar labora en su propia finca en la cual se desarrolla la actividad de ganado para producción de leche, solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de terneros que le permitirán aumentar el hato de su finca y de esta manera incrementar su producción y los ingresos generados de dicho proyecto.
texts.en: Oscar works on his own farm where he raises dairy cattle. He is requesting a loan of one million colones (₡ 1 000 000) to purchase calves, which will allow him to increase his small herd of cattle, and in this way increase his output and the income generated by his business.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Phean's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Phean is 36 years old and the married mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school. 

The main source of the family's income is growing rice, which Phean has done for 18 years. The main challenge to the business is that crops are growing slowly and sometimes unhealthily. 

She is now leading a group of five members to apply for a loan, which is the second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was repaid completely and it enabled Phean to improve her standard of living.

In this group, she is a leader, and she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide, and organic fertilizers for her farming. 

She hopes this loan will help her to earn more income so she will be able to lit up her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide, and organic fertilizers for their rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es: Angélica es una mujer emprendedora de 26 años de edad, casada y madre de un niño de cuatro años quien emprendió su negocio hace seis años con la venta de leña al por mayor, uno de sus hermanos le ayuda a cortar leña y a crear los manojos, para luego venderlos, ella solicita por cuarto ciclo el financiamiento de los socios de kiva con el objetivo de comprar un carretón de caballo y una motosierra, con el crédito anterior logro aumentar la oferta de leña.
texts.en: Angélica is an enterprising 26-year-old woman. She is married. She is the mother of a four-year-old son. She has had her business selling wholesale firewood for six years. One of her siblings helps her cut the firewood, create bunches and sell them. She is requesting a fourth loan from the Kiva members to purchase a horse-drawn wagon and a chainsaw. With the previous loan, she increased her firewood supply.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene un hijo pequeño. Angélica vive en la Ciudad de México y estudió una carrera técnica en auxiliar contable y administrativo, actualmente ella trabaja en una oficina gubernamental desempeñando ese cargo. Desde hace tres años ella inicio un negocio de venta de tenis nacional porque quería tener ingresos extras además de su trabajo habitual. Ella pretende que con las ganancias que genere su negocio pueda terminar su carrera trunca universitaria, así como establecer de manera formal su negocio en un lugar físico y formar un patrimonio para su familia. Su hija es su  principal motivación para seguir creciendo y superarse constantemente. Ella solicita un préstamo por MXN 5,000 para poder incrementar su volumen de compra y tener un margen de utilidad más amplio. Angélica es una mujer muy perseverante, que siempre pone mucho empeño en cumplir sus sueños y lo que quiere lograr. Agradece mucho a todas las personas que vayan a colaborar con ella para expandir su negocio y cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Angélica is 24 years old, married, and has a young child. She lives in Mexico City and studied for a technical degree in order to become an accounting administrative assistant. Angélica currently works for a government office in that capacity. Three years ago, she started a business in which she sells domestically-produced tennis shoes because she wanted extra income to supplement what she earned from her regular job. With her earnings, Angélica intends to finish the university degree what she was not able to complete. She would also like to formally establish her business in a physical location so that she can build up an inheritance for her family. Her daughter is her primary motivation for wanting to continue growing and making constant self-improvement.

Angélica is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 MXN so that she can increase her purchase and sales volumes. As a result, she will be able to achieve a higher profit margin. Angélica is a persevering woman who always gives her best effort toward the fulfillment of her dreams and the accomplishments she wants to achieve. She is grateful to everyone who has worked with her to expand her business and reach her goals.

loans.use: to increase her inventory so that she can earn a higher profit margin.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Это женщина Зулфия. Ей 52 года. Она жительница района Кубадиен. Зулфия замужем и имеет детей. Она вместе с семьей живет в районе Кубадиен. Муж Зулфия занимается животноводством. Зулфия тоже решила заниматься выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Она хочет вместе мужем заниматься животноводством. Зулфия уверена в себе, что сможет хорошо справляться со своей работой. Она планирует приобрести скота и для старта бизнеса. Для  купли скота у нее не хватает денег, и она обратилась за кредитом. Зулфия верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Она заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is 52. She is a resident of the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan. She is a wife and mother and lives with her family in the district of Qubadiyon. Her husband makes a living raising livestock, so Zulfiya has also decided to get involved in cattle breeding so that they can work in animal husbandry together.

Zulfiya is confident that she will be able to handle her work without any problem. She is planning to buy some livestock to start her business. However, she doesn't have enough money for this purchase, and she is taking a loan. She relies on you and on your support. She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena, who is married, works hard to support her family. 

Magdalena has a business making dried fish, in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish for making her dried fish.

Magdalena has been in this business for 16 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is a married mother of 9 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and 4 of her children are in school.

Marisa has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

Marisa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Sayramhon

texts.ru: Его зовут Сайрамхон. Ему 42 года. Онвместе с женой  и детьми проживает на районе Н.Хусрав. У него двое детей. Детям 17 и13 лет, они учатся в средней школе. Жена дехканка. Сайрамхон очень активный и трудолюбивый человек. Он на районе занимается растениеводством. Сайрамхон честно трудится на земле. Его доходы только от растениеводство. Сайрамхон в этом году вместе женой посадили кукуруз и картофель. Ему надо  обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получить богатый и качественный урожай. Сайрамхону  не хватило денег на приобретения минеральных удобрений, и он принял решения обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en:
Sayramhon is 42. He lives with his wife and his two children in the N. Khusrav district of Tajikistan. His children are 17 and 13 years old and attend secondary school. His wife works in farming. Sayramhon himself is a very dynamic and hardworking man who is involved in agriculture, in his own district. He works the land earnestly and agriculture is his only source of income.

This year, Sayramhon and his wife have planted some corn and potatoes. He still needs to enrich his soil with mineral fertilizers, so that he can get a good and plentiful harvest. However, Sayramhon doesn't have enough money to buy mineral fertilizers, which is the reason why he has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Palmos De California Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “LOS PALMOS DE CALIFORNIA” conformada por 05 socias responsables. Ella es alexsandra una de las socias de 23 años de edad. Conviviente con 1 hijo. Ella trabaja en una fábrica de zapatos desde hace más de 6 meses. Su mayor deseo es de poder terminar de construir su casa. Es por ello que solicito el crédito para la compra de ladrillos y cemento. El grupo “los palmos de california” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Alexsandra es la segunda del lado derecho.
texts.en: This is the new group called “LOS PALMOS DE CALIFORNIA”. It is made up of 05 responsible members. She is Alexsandra, one of the members. She is 23 years old, in a common law marriage and has 1 child.  She has worked in a shoe factory for more than 6 months. Her biggest wish is to be able to finish building her house. That is why she has asked for the loan to buy bricks and cement. The “Los Palmos de California” group is grateful for the people from Kiva who made this loan possible, because it will allow her to continue improving. Alexsandra is the second one from the right.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es: Diana es una mujer emprendedora de 37 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos por los que trabaja día a día para sacarlos adelante con sus esfuerzos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace diez años, solicita por sexto ciclo el financiamiento de la institución porque quiere invertir en la compra de carne, chicharrón, yuca, vegetales y gaseosa. Una de sus metas es lograr terminar su carrera universitaria, para lograr tener un mejor nivel académico.
texts.en: Diana is an enterprising 37 year old woman. She is the single mother of two children. She works day to day to get them ahead with her hard work. She has sold food for ten years. She is applying for her sixth loan cycle from the institution because she wants to invest in buying meat, cracklings,  yucca, vegetables and sodas. One of her goals is to finish her college education in order to achieve a better academic level.

loans.use: to buy pork, cracklings, yucca, vegetables and sodas.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира 38 летняя женщина. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Мохира уроженка района Кубадиен. Она там родилась и выросла. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Мохира сейчас живет с детьми. Она их воспитывает и кормит. Мохира хочет открыть свой бизнес, и иметь ежемесячный доход. Она планирует купить скота и заниматься животноводством.  Для начала бизнеса ей нужно деньги. Но их у нее нет, и она решила взять кредит и купить скота. Мохира с большими надежда обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en:
Mohira is 38.  She is married and the mother of four children.  She is was born and raised in the Qubadiyon district of Tajikistan.  At the moment, her husband is a migrant worker in Russia, so Mohira lives alone with her children, raising and feeding them on her own.

Mohira wants to start her own business, so that she can have a monthly income.  She is planning to buy some livestock and get involved in animal husbandry.  However, she doesn't have the money that she needs to start her own business.  For this reason, she has decided to take a loan and use it to buy some livestock.  She is placing her hopes in this loan and in you.

loans.use: to start a new business and buy some livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheeting, rods and pins to repair her roof and improve her daughters' quality of life.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María es una mujer laboriosa de 44 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de 18 años a quien está apoyando en sus estudios, Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos hace cinco años y solicita por tercer ciclo el financiamiento de la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de perfumes, cremas, pinturas de labio, marbellíes y sombras para ojos. Una de sus metas es incursionar en un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa. Con el crédito anterior logro comprar un mueble de computadora.
texts.en: María is a hard-working 44-year-old woman, married and the mother of an 18-year-old son who she is assisting in his education. She has been working in the sale of cosmetics for five years and she is asking for her third loan from this institution because she wants to invest in the purchase of perfumes, creams, lipsticks, eye shadow and other cosmetic items. One of her goals is to start up a new business in the sale of clothing. With her previous loan, María purchased a computer desk.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, lipsticks, eyeshadows and other cosmetics

loans.name: Raquel Maria

texts.es: Raquel es una mujer laboriosa de 30 años, casada y madre de dos niños, quien logro emprender el negocio con ayuda económica de su esposo y  ha salido adelante gracias a sus esfuerzos y a la buena administración que le ha dado, ella es propietaria de una  pulpería donde ofrece productos varios a sus clientes potenciales, ella solicita por primera vez el financiamiento en ADIM, porque desea desarrollar su negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar, avena, pan y huevo.
texts.en: Raquel is a hard-working 30 year-old woman, and the mother of two children, who has been able to start her business with economic assistance from her husband. She has been getting ahead thanks to her efforts and good administration of her business. She is the owner of a small general store that offers a variety of products to her potential clients. This is the first time that Raquel has applied for financing through ADIM because she wants to develop her business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of rice, oil, sugar, oats, bread and eggs.

loans.use: to purchase of rice, oil, sugar, oats, bread and eggs.

loans.name: Ever

texts.es:
Ever es un joven que está trabajando  y a la vez estudiando para así poder cubrir sus gastos de estudio y lograr sus objetivo que es el de terminar sus estudios universitarios.
Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y comenta que está poniendo todo de sí para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Pide este préstamo para poder  pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Ever is a young man who is studying and working at the same time in order to cover his tuition costs and achieve his objective, which is to finish his university career. He is majoring in accounting and he says that he is doing his all in order to be able to continue with his studies. He is asking for this loan to be able to pay the tuition for his major and continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay college tuition.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha who is a 28-year-old mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school lives in Kratie province where the cassava has been growing for the main source of family’s income for four years. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement income. The decline of cassava price is the main hardship for her business. Because she now lacks of working capital to support business, Sokha forms a group of three to request for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for her. As a group representative, she will use her loan to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the cassava farming. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to uplift the lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the cassava farming.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 35 años de edad, es un agricultor en pequeño, pero también es vigilante en una clínica de su municipio, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos.

Juan, tiene 8 años de experiencia de ser vigilante, también tiene una gran experiencia en trabajos de agricultura, porque es una actividad que aprendió de su padre, quien dedicó toda su vida a los trabajos de agricultura y ganadería y de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante junto a su familia. 

El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas, porque se acerca la época de siembra de granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo.

Los sueños que tiene para futuro son, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, crear un estanque y cultivar peces porque cuenta con un terreno muy adecuado para realizar esa actividad.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old. He is a small-scale farmer and he is also a security guard at a clinic in his municipality. He lives with his wife and their two children.
Juan has been a security guard for 8 years, and he also has a great deal of experience working in agriculture. He learned about farming from his father, who spent his whole life farming and ranching and was able to get his family ahead through his work.
The money from this loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides, because it almost the season to plant basic crops such as corn, millet and beans.
Juan's dreams for the future are to support his children's education and to build a pond in which to raise fish, because his land is well-suited for that industry.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides for his corn, bean and millet crops.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman  with three children who attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

 She sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment.She mentioned transportation and competition in her business.Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.She decided to join yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Plante Josue

texts.en:
Plante is a first-year student at Kepler. Due to his dedication and tremendous academic performance, he was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. Plante chose Kepler because he believes it offers the best preparation for a career in business.

Plante plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At Kepler, he hopes to build his technology skills as well as take on as many team activities as he can.

He looks forward to learning about career options while at Kepler and hopes to pursue a job that includes business, math, and the visual arts.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Vichet's Group

texts.en: Vichet’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Vichet works as tailor and he also does extra work as farm laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sreyla's Group

texts.en: Sreyla’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreyla makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pherk's Group

texts.en: Pherk’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Pherk makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Morn's Group

texts.en: Morn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Morn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sal's Group

texts.en: Sal’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sal makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en: Sam’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sam makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a first-year student at Kepler. She was raised by her uncle due to difficult family circumstances. She believes that her greatest strength is the ability to focus and work hard. Due to that and her tremendous academic performance, she was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year. 

Sharon plans to major in Health Care Management, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. At school, Sharon hopes to improve her public speaking and self-confidence. After graduating, she hopes to work in the medical field and one day pursue more studies with the possiblity of becoming a doctor.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is a first-year student at Kepler in Rwanda. She grew up in rural Rwanda and is the first member of her family to attend university. She was accepted from over 6,000 applicants this year, and chose Kepler because it offers the opportunity to gain work experience as you learn.

An outstanding student, Therese plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She also hopes to improve her public speaking skills, one of the many skills she will need to pursue her dream of being a successful entrepreneur.

Reflecting on life after university, Therese would like to give back to her family and the members of her community that helped lift her up.

loans.use: to pay for a laptop required for a US college degree.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Doña cándida es una señora trabajadora de 57 años, soltera y madre de un hijo, ella se dedica desde hace cinco años a la venta de lotería y solicita por octava vez el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de billetes de lotería, con los créditos anteriores logro terminar de pagar una refrigeradora, pero tiene una nueva meta la cual es mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Doña Cándida is a hard-working 57 year-old woman. She is unmarried and the mother of a son. She has been working for five years in lottery sales and she is requesting her eighth loan from the institution to purchase lottery tickets. With previous loans, she was able to finish paying for a refrigerator and now she has a new goal, which is to improve her housing.

loans.use: buy lottery tickets.

loans.name: Naty

texts.en:
Naty is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Naty is 28 years old and has one child in school.

Naty has a bakery business in the Philippines. Naty requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Naty has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Naty would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a married mother of four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has  no electricity but has  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children, two of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has  no electricity but has piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six  years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a married woman. She lives at her own  house that has no electricity but has  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition and transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en: Shehu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Liman Village. Shehu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Shehu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Shehu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
María es una señora soltera con 58 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, debido a que no cuenta con el apoyo de un familiar o alguien cercano, esta señora se vio en la obligación de trabajar para así lograr obtener los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus necesidades.
Trabaja vendiendo pescados desde su casa, labora todos los días entre 8 y 10 horas diarias.

María sueña con ver su casa bonita, ya que esta lleva muchos años de construida y con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando. 

Con el propósito de mejorar sus ventas, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar su utilidad, pide un auxilio económico con el cual comprara variedad de pescados y ganado bovino.

Usted puede ser parte del sueño de esta señora, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
María is an unmarried 58 year old woman who is hardworking and very humble. Because she does not have the support of a family or someone close to count on, this lady is obliged to work in order to achieve the necessary income to cover her needs.

She works selling fish from her home, working between 8 to 10 hours every day.

María dreams of seeing her house made beautiful again, as it was built many years ago and over time has deteriorated.

With the prospect of improving her sales, increasing her customers and increasing her profitability, she is asking for a loan with which to buy a variety of fish and cattle.

You can help fulfill this lady's dream. Take heart, and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish and cattle.

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en: Houy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Houy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a hard-working woman with four children. One of them is still her dependent aged 14 years old. Clarita has been farming seaweeds for 20 years. Together with her husband, they work hard for their family. She is asking a loan to buy straw for seaweeds as well as seaweed seedlings. She is optimistic for a possible increase of her income after all her inputs are made available.

She would like to improve her business so that she can make the most out of her profit. Her income will  be utilized for family daily consumption, savings and pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: to buy straw and seaweed seedlings

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 24 years old and married. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, home product care, and other groceries.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 6 years now. 

In the future, Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 56 years old and married with three children. Salome works very hard to provide for them.

Salome runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Salome has been in this business for 19 years. 

In the future, Salome would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 52 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is a mother of 6 children. Her husband has been running a general store for past 18 years.

Nasreen's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products for reselling purpose. Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 23, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For the past year she has raised and sold pigs to earn an income.


Nenita has taken out and successfully repaid three prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for an 8000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs. She is working to save money so as to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Zeenat

texts.en:
Zeenat is responsible mother of two children, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good iand t requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Zeenat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Zeenat's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Zeenat also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Zeenat is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 43 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, school supplies, and other groceries.

Arlene has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, school supplies, and other groceries

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a-68-year-old woman from Panglao, Bohol. She is married with nine adult children. At her age, she still engaged in buying and selling fish to earn a living.

She is asking a loan of PHP5000 to buy more fish to sell, ice (used to preserve the fish), and plastic bags (used in selling). Juana dreams to improve her business for her future needs like saving money to buy medicines and foods.

loans.use: to buy more fish, ice and plastic bags.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria is 36 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Ma. Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Victoria runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like eggs, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 6 years. 

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like eggs, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a 41-year-old farmer from the remote village of Kipsaiya, situated in the Rift valley province of Kenya. The living conditions in this area are tough because there is no clean water nor electrical connections. She lives with her beloved family on a small piece of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows a wide variety of crops.

For ten years Cecilia’s primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and her crops. Disease and a shortage of farm inputs are a challenge for her. Most farmers in the area lack capital to buy such farm inputs as chemicals to prevent these diseases.

Cecilia faces the problem that so many in Kenya’s low-income communities, especially rural, confront: The cost of education is becoming prohibitive for them. As a result, children are forced to drop out and start working to contribute their earnings to their families.

So Cecilia made the decision to join Juhudi Kilimo in order to access its loans that would help her improve her farm and thus her earnings, She has applied for a 10,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy seed and expand the size of her farmland. The additional income from her farm will go to paying for her children's education. She knows that a quality education will act as a strong foundation for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seed and expand the size of her farmland.

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is from Pangloa, Bohol in the Philippines. He is married with five children ranging in age from eleven down to two years old.


Marlon is a habal-habal, a term used in Bohol to refer to a motorcycle transport driver. For the past five years he has worked hard as one in order to provide for his family’s needs. He is applying for a 12,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy tires, gasoline and oil and pay for his motorcycle registration. He wants to improve his livelihood to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy tires, gasoline and oil and pay for his motorcycle registration.

loans.name: Maricarmen Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maricarmen del Pilar tiene 19 años, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería.

Maricarmen se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como patos, pavos, entre otros, desde hace más de 03 años. Cuenta con clientes fijos en la zona quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de ella. El destino del préstamo será para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como pavos, patos, gallinas, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para el engorde de estos. Con esto Maricarmen del Pilar espera ofrecer una mayor variedad de animales a sus clientes satisfaciendo sus gustos y preferencias lo que tendrá un gran impacto en su nivel de ingresos y le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maricarmen del Pilar is 19 years old. She lives in her own home in the district of Cayaltí, located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. She lives in a community dedicated to business, agriculture and livestock. Maricarmen has worked raising and selling small animals such as ducks, turkeys and others for more than 3 years. She has steady customers in the area who give her very good personal and work references.

The destiny of the loan will be to buy a larger quantity of animals such as turkeys, ducks, hens, chicken and others, as well as to buy balanced food to fatten these animals. With this, Maricarmen del Pilar hopes to offer a larger variety of animals to her customers, satisfying their likes and preferences. This will have a great impact on her income level and will allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of animals such as turkeys, ducks, hens, chickens, and others, as well as to buy balanced food to fatten these animals.

loans.name: Dúo Málaga Group

texts.es: Dúo Málaga Mario de 25 años de edad, soltero y comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana, su local está situado en el  mercado de su localidad. Mario solicita su primer crédito para la compra de una paca mas surtida para así poder ofrecerle mejor mercadería a sus clientes.  El anhela  tener varios negocios y así poder tener un estilo de vida mejor.Espera que Kiva le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado.
texts.en:
From the Dúo Málaga, Mario is 25 years old. He is single and a merchant who makes a living selling American clothing. His shop is located in the local market.

Mario is asking for his first loan to buy a stocked bundle to be able to offer better merchandise to his customers. He desires to have various businesses and be able to have a better lifestyle. He hopes that Kiva can help him with the loan.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dinora De Jesus

texts.es:
Dinora, de 23 años de edad, es una joven muy dedicada a los oficios domésticos de su casa y a su negocio de venta de comida.- Ella creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la venta de comida todos los días de semana, ella estudio hasta bachillerato, luego se dedicó a administrar su propio negocio con ayuda de su esposo y de esta manera ha podido sacar a su familia adelante.  

Dinora, tiene 4 años de experiencia en la administración de su negocio de comida, decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque cuando sus padres tenían comedor, ella les ayudaba y se daba cuenta de las buenas ganancias que este generaba, fue eso que la motivo a independizarse y colocar su propio negocio.

El dinero del crédito será utilizado para comprar productos para la cocina y para comprar dos mesas metálicas para servir comida, de esta manera estará prestando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y aumentara sus ganancias. 

Los sueños que tiene a futuro son, tener instalaciones modernas y adquirir comprar una motocicleta para prestar el servicio a domicilio y comprar un vehículo para trasportar productos del mercado al comedor.
texts.en:
Dinora is 23 years old. She is a young woman who is very dedicated to the domestic chores in her home and in her business selling food. She grew up with parents who worked selling food every day of the week. She went to school until high school and then later managed her own business with help from her husband. This is how she has been able to support her family.

Dinora has 4 years of experience managing her food business. She decided to do this business because when her parents had an eatery, she helped them and she realized the good earnings that they were getting. This was the motive to become independent and set up her own business.

The money from the loan will be used to buy kitchen products and to buy two metal tables to serve food. This way, she will be giving better service to her customers and increasing her earnings.

Her future dreams are to have modern facilities and get a motorcycle to provide at-home services. She also wants to buy a car to transport the produce from the market to the eatery.

loans.use: to buy kitchen products and to buy two metal tables to serve food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay college fees.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Patria Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal  “Virgen de Carmen de patria”, el poblado de Patria está ubicado dentro del distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco).
La socia Marleny, la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia es una persona responsable, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a la agricultura, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales menores y alimentos.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 
Una de la socias al momento de tomarse la foto se agacho ya que la socia es timida.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "Virgen de Carmen de Patria" loan group. The town of Patria is located inside the Kosñipata district in the province of Paucartambo, department of Cuzco.

Marleny continues with her business raising animals. She has been doing this business for a while and it brings her personal satisfaction. She is a responsible person, as she continues working in agriculture and that is how she supports her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy small animals and food.

The other members are thankful for the given opportunity and they promise to pay their respected dues in the allotted time.

One of the members bent her head down as the photo was taken because she is shy.

loans.use: to buy small animals and food.

loans.name: Melina

texts.es: Melina tiene 35 años, es casada, estudió trabajo social y vive en Colima, es una mujer muy trabajadora y apasionada de lo que hace, es una mujer emprendedora, su mayor pasión es la salud, el bienestar y la belleza. Además de tener un empleo los fines de semana como trabajadora social, entre semana trabaja en su propia estética, ella inició su negocio desde hace más de dos años, ha ido progresando porque antes no contaba con un lugar físico sino que iba a las casas de sus clientas, actualmente ella cuenta con un local. Su principal motivación es su familia y su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y ser reconocida como una gran estilista y cosmetóloga. Ella solicita un préstamo de MXN 10,000 para poder tener más mobiliario en su estética, como: asientos y un lava cabezas. Ella se define como emprendedora porque sirve a su comunidad y además ella es autosuficiente económicamente, situación de la cual se siente muy orgullosa. Ella estará muy agradecida con todas las personas que la ayuden a desarrollar su negocio y ofrecerle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Melina is 35 years old and married. She studied social work and lives in Colima. She is a very hardworking woman, and passionate about what she does.

Melina is an enterprising woman, and her greatest passion is health, wellbeing, and beauty. In addition to having a job on weekends as a social worker, she works in her own salon during the week. She started that business more than two years ago, and has been progressing. Before, she did not have a physical space, but rather she went to her clients' homes; now, she has a shop. Her principal motivation is her family, and her greatest dream is to make her business grow and to be known as a great stylist and cosmetologist.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 MXN to be able to have more furnishings in her salon, like seats and a shampoo basin. She defines herself as an entrepreneur because she serves her community in addition to being financially self-sufficient, a situation she feels very proud of. She will be very grateful to all the people who might help her to develop her business and to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy furnishings like seats and a shampoo basin

loans.name: Zenith

texts.en:
Zenith is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zenith is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Zenith has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years. Zenith requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Zenith would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jenevie

texts.en:
Jenevie is 38 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Jenevie works very hard to provide for them.

Jenevie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Jenevie has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sanitary pads, diapers, soft-drinks, noodles, cooking oil, etc.

In the future, Jenevie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 51 years old and has four children. Sarah is married and has one child in school.

Sarah is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Sarah requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Sarah has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sarah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Aura María

texts.es: Aura de 36 años es una habitante del municipio de Arjona en el Departamento de Bolívar y en su  venta de comidas típicas elabora deliciosos pasabocas llamados “Los Fritos” que son muy consumidos por la gente de la Región Caribe.  Con una experiencia de toda la vida en esta actividad, ya que este negocio es una tradición en su familia y su madre le cedió el puesto de comidas que funciona en su vivienda, Aura cuenta con quince en su administración y una amplia clientela que degustan de sus empanadas, arepas de huevo, buñuelos, patacones y caramañolas, todos los días al amanecer. Así mismo ofrece artículos de papelería exhibidos en una vitrina ubicada en la sala de su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas para la producción de pasabocas y nuevo surtido de papelería.  Gracias a su trabajo, su familia hoy tiene un mejor estilo de vida y sus metas a futuro de tener un almacén de variedades y una casa para sus hijos, están más cerca de hacerse realidad.
texts.en:
Aura is 36 years old and is a resident of Arjona in the department of Bolívar. She sells traditional food dishes, including delicious fried snacks called "Los Fritos" which are widely consumed in this Caribbean region. She has been making these dishes for her whole life, since this type of business is a tradition in her family, and she inherited this food stall (which is run out of her home) from her mother. Aura has been running the business independently for 15 years, and she has ample clientele which enjoy her empanadas, egg arepas, doughnuts, fried plantains and water bottles. She begins every day at dawn. She also offers stationery which she displays in a glass case located in the living room of her home. 
Aura is currently requesting a loan, which will be her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and which she will invest in ingredients for her snacks as well as a new supply of stationery.
Because of her hard work, Aura's family now has a better quality of life; and her goals for the future - to have a variety store as well as a house for her children - are closer to becoming a reality.

loans.use: to invest in materials to make snacks, as well as to restock her stationery supply.

loans.name: Marelis Isabel

texts.es: Marelis de 30 años es una microempresaria que inició su negocio como un pasatiempo divertido cuando tomo clases en una academia para aprender a elaborar accesorios para el cabello y adornar peinados,  sin embargo no duró mucho tiempo en darse cuenta que era la oportunidad de negocio que estaba esperando, al observar la acogida que tenían sus accesorios; balacas, vinchas, hebillas y moñas, entre sus amigas y conocidas. En la actualidad cuenta con cinco años de experiencia comercializando sus creaciones entre misceláneas y almacenes ubicados en Barranquilla, todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Este negocio ha permitido que su familia goce de una mejor calidad de vida y con la finalidad de ampliar su producción está aplicando a un crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas como cintas, elásticos y demás accesorios.  Su meta a futuro es tener su propio almacén y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marelis is 30 years old. She is a micro-businesswoman who started her business as a fun pastime when she took classes in an academy to learn to make hair accessories to adorn hairstyles. However, upon observing the reception her accessories (decorated elastics, headbands, barrettes, and hair bows) got among her friends and acquaintances, it didn't take long before she realized that this was the business opportunity that she was waiting for.

Currently, she has five years of experience selling her creations in variety stores and shops located in Barranquilla from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. This business has allowed her family to enjoy a better quality of life.

With the objective of increasing her production, she is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in raw materials like ribbons, elastics, and other accessories. Her goal for the future is to have her own shop and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to invest in materials like ribbons, elastics, and other accessories

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 44-year-old, married lady of Khagrabari and a mother of two daughters and one son. She studied up to grade 8 due to her family’s poor economy but she is very much eager to give her children the quality education that they deserve.

One of her daughters is in university, perusing her M.A. (Master in Arts) and the other is a student for a B.A. (Bachelor in Arts). Her only son works in a private company.

Gita is a housewife and her husband is a retired person.

Gita's younger daughter Pinki is 21 years old. She is pursuing her bachelor degree in Arts from B.T. Evening College in her second year. She needs proper guidance and reference books to score good marks on her examination.

Now Gita's son is the prime earning member in the family whose income is mostly spent on household expenses. So Gita cannot afford the whole education cost of her daughters. Sometimes she cannot even provide necessary books to them. As such, providing Pinki with private coaching is too difficult for her to bear.

To solve this problem Gita applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) for purchasing her younger daughter's necessary books, paying all college fees and enrolling her in private coaching class. Gita is hopeful that the loan will help her daughter to go one step closer to her goals.

Gita and Pinki (in the photo) express their gratitude toward their generous lenders.

loans.use: to cover all the education-related costs of her younger daughter.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata lives with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) in the remote village of Ramthenga of Falakata. She is 36 years old and studied up to grade 10. She is a housewife. Her husband is a land cultivator who is engaged with farming. 

Mamata and her husband believe that education is an important part of a person's life. People can't work properly and efficiently if they don't have education. But the income of her husband is so scanty that she can't afford much for her children's education.  

Her daughter is a student of grade 7. Her 14-year-old son, Rajib, reads in grade 10 at Ghumani High School. He is a meritorious student and studies hard, but if he could get the help of a private tutor, he could have done much better results. Next year he is going to appear for his first board examination. And he wants to score high marks in his exam so he is studying very hard. His future aim is to acquire an M.A. degree.

In order to help her son's smooth and uninterrupted education, Mamata has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase necessary educational items and pay school fees, private tuition fees, and exam fees for her son.  

Mamata and her son Rajib (in the picture) highly appreciate their lenders' support for giving them a loan which will make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to bear the educational costs of her son.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra, 45 years old, is married and a mother of four grown-up children (three daughters and one son). She is from Falakata. She is illiterate but can sign her name only. She did not get the opportunity to achieve education due to the poor financial resources of her parents. Her three daughters are married and her only son is engaged in carpentry work.

Sumitra’s husband is involved with cultivation, and she also helps her husband in his work. They cultivate different vegetables in different seasons. With seven years of experience in farm work, they have been able to get ahead despite the difficulties that have arisen along the way, including the rising cost of inputs and the instability of prices for buying and selling vegetables. 

Now the family expenses are increasing day by day, and they feel they need to further improve their agricultural activities. So they have decided to cultivate paddy (rice), which is an all-season crop, and being the staple food of the rural people, is in much demand throughout the year. So they think it will be a profitable business, which will enable her to earn more income.

Currently, Sumitra is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies, such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, etc., to start the cultivation. She has a lot of faith and hope in getting more profit from this cultivation and ensuring the financial stability in her family.

Sumitra conveys her thanks to her lenders for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies for paddy (rice) cultivation.

loans.name: Olga

texts.fr:
Olga est une jeune femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 21 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un tout petit enfant. Les deux époux exercent le même type d'activité pour soutenir et entretenir la famille. 
Olga vend des articles et marchandises générales. Elle pratique de la vente ambulante, elle rejoigne tous les jours le grand marché des villes environnants.
Elle n'a aucune difficulté à exercer l'activité car elle en a déjà l'expérience avec ses parents quand elle est encore célibataire. Elle a commencé à voler avec ses propres ailes depuis 2010. Son désir de réussir la motive à travailler dur et à avancer. C'est une femme qui a beaucoup d'énergie. Elle projette de construire sa propre maison, et pour y parvenir, elle s'efforce tous les jours d'épargner.
texts.en:
Olga is a resourceful and hard working young woman. She is 21 years old. She is married and the mother of a very young child. The two spouses do the same type of job to support and look after the family.

Olga sells various goods. She sells on foot in neighboring cities' main markets.

She has no problem with this job as she was already doing it with her parents when she was still single. She started working on her own in 2010. Her desire to succeed motivates her to work hard and advance.

She has a lot of energy. She wants to build her own house. In order to do this, she tries very hard to save every day.

loans.use: buy food and homewares.

loans.name: Rupasi

texts.en:
Rupasi is 41 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of two sons. She lives in Falakata with her family. Her husband is a farmer. She and her husband both are uneducated and can sign their names only. 

Her 27-year-old son has a higher secondary education and he works as a driver. Their younger son, 23-year-old Dipak, has completed his graduation and now he got admitted for an M.A. education in Rabindra Bharati University.

Rupasi's husband earns so little that it barely covers their living expenses. So it is quite impossible for him to afford his son's educational expenses. Her son Dipak is very much serious about his studies. Now he is pursuing his master’s degree in history. He wants to be a teacher in the future. So he wants to join a B.Ed. course after completion of his master's degree. As parents, Rupasi and her husband want their son to finish his studies smoothly. However, they don't have enough money to sustain his education.  

So Rupasi has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She wants to utilize the loan money to engage private tutors for her son, pay the college fees and also purchase necessary educational articles for her son. Dipak is a very hardworking student. He will justify his parents' trust in him.

Rupasi and Dipak (in the picture) both are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational costs.

loans.name: Alijan

texts.en:
Thirty-eight-year-old Alijan is an enterprising woman. With an aim to contribute to the family income, she started an animal husbandry business. She lives in Falakata, Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She lives there with her husband and two sons. Her husband is engaged in a meat-selling business. 

Alijan has been running a milk-selling business for the last 10 years. She sells milk to her neighbors. Out of their small income they were maintaining their family with difficulties. Now she is very much confident in running her business and wants to develop her business significantly. Alijan wants to take a loan to purchase another dairy cow for more milk to improve her business. Thus, she has asked for a business loan from Kiva's partner BJS. 

With her efforts, she might improve the income for her family. She hopes to increase her milk production and also cattle byproducts like cow dung to sell to her rural villagers for earning a higher profit. With this profit she wants to save money to secure their future.

She conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow whose milk he can sell to neighbors.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Maricris is from Solana. She is 34 years old, married and has three children. To gain income, she sells grocery items to the people in her village. She sells commodities and wanted to improve her business. That is why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more products. She will buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo. This will also help meet customer demand for good and affordable products and services.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, biscuits, soap and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Julieta dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: Sochea, 28, is married and lives in Battambang province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school while another one is under school age. To make a living, she and her husband raise cows and work for others for a fee. She has been in these businesses for two years. Lacking working capital is the main challenge she faces these days. Her business earns her about 37,500 KHR per day and she manages to save about 25,400 KHR each day. Sochea is now leading a group of two to apply for a loan, which is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy wood and corrugated zinc sheets to build a cowshed. She hopes that her business will be growing and earn her more income to upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated zinc sheets to build a cowshed to support her cow-raising business.

loans.name: Taysir

texts.en:
Taysir is a 44-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father of six children, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Taysir is a hard worker. He has run a medical lab in the refugee camp for fifteen years, and he works hard to develop it to make sure he can provide his customers with the best medical services requested.

To keep his Lab updated is very expensive, especially since it is located in a low income region, and he has to make sure that his residents can afford paying for their requested medical examinations.
