Thus, developing it is very hard without an external support. For this reason, he is applying for his fifth loan cycle from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a special updated Chemistry machine necessary for his Laboratory's need.

His previous acquired loans were invested in the same purpose; each loan helped in buying a certain medical lab requested machine. He hopes that in the future he can stay capable of providing his current services to his residents.

loans.use: To buy a special updated Chemistry machine necessary for his Laboratory's need

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Twenty-seven-year-old Glaiza sells fresh fish to the locals in the community. She is a married woman with three children ages 5, 3 and 8 months old respectively. She has been selling fish for five years now. Her husband earns a living by being a habal-habal (motorcycle) driver. She is in need of additional capital to support her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted fish, cellophane and ice. These will enables Glaiza to sell more fish and cater to the orders of her respective customers. She would be able to settle her obligations and continue to provide nutritious meals to the whole family.

In the future, Glaiza would like to expand her fish vending business to become sustainable for her to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish, cellophane and ice.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 57 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, shampoo, etc.

Norma has been in this business for six years.

In the future Norma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, toothpaste, soft drinks, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Rodgelyn

texts.en:
Rodgelyn is 49 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Rodgelyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Rodgelyn has been pig fattening for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Suy's Group

texts.en:
Suy is a 57-year-old single woman who lives in Battambang province. In order to support her living, she is growing paddy rice and working for others for a fee. She has been in these businesses for ten years. Drought is the major challenge to her. She earns about 35,800 KHR per day and can save about 7,100 KHR per day for future needs.

Suy has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for eight cycles which she paid back completely. With the past loan, she has improved the living conditions for the family. In her ninth cycle, Suy, the leader of the two-member group, will use her loan to pay the plowing and reaping fee and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer for her rice farming business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to expand her business bigger.

loans.use: to pay the plowing and reaping fee and buy rice seeds and organic fertilizer for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Maylyn

texts.en: Maylyn is the youngest among six siblings. She is currently living with her mother. Maylyn owns 2,000 square meters of fishpond and she also raises pigs to sell. With her determination to improve her businesses, she is asking for additional capital amounting to PHP 10,000 to be used in buying ten sacks of feed for her pigs. She knows that having this amount of loan will help her to improve the growth of her pigs. She is hoping for approval of her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy ten sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mubashara's Group

texts.en:
Mubashara is the age of 38 and the mother of three children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is receiving a loan for her husband’s business. His practice is to sell and purchase motorbike rims and tires. In this tenure he maintained many contacts with his worthy customers and increased demand. He wants to buy more motorbike tires and rims to grow his business but he does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy more rims and tires. Therefore, Mubashara contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and presented her humble request for a loan so her husband can buy motorbike tires and rims to resell on a daily basis.

Mubashara seems very happy after this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will takes an active part to support her.

loans.use: to buy motorbike rims and tires for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Sayfullo

texts.en: Sayfullo is a clever young man. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1996. He is single and lives with parents in a village. He is a second-year university student. He has been interested in history since his childhood. Recently he has studied history and law. He is an active, confident, communicative and responsible person. He is well known among friends and students. Sayfullo appealed to IMON asking for financial support to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be funded by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs.

loans.name: Edison

texts.es:
Edison está cursando el 3er año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, su meta es terminar su y luego estudiar otra carrera para tener más conocimientos y a la vez ascender en su trabajo.
Es una persona que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios y está luchando para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Edison is completing the third year of his Business Administration degree. His goal is to finish college and afterwards obtain another degree in order to have more knowledge and advance his career.

He wants to improve his quality of life through his studies and is striving to be able to achieve this.

He is requesting this loan to pay his university fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Ramira Eulalia

texts.es:
Ramira, de 29 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, ella solo estudio hasta tercer grado, porque su familia era de escasos recursos económicos. 

Ramira, se dedica a cuidar, a comprar y a vender ganado; estas actividades las aprendió de su abuela, quien dedicó toda su vida a la crianza de animales domésticos, esto le sirvió para conseguir los recursos necesarios y poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.

Ramira, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar materiales para reparar las instalaciones donde tiene su ganado, porque en el invierno los animales se mojan y también quiere comprar alimento para ganado.

Los sueños de Ramira son, establecer una granja de cerdos y construir instalaciones más adecuadas para el cuido de los cerdos y del ganado, además quiere comprar un camión para el traslado de los animales.
texts.en:
Ramira is 29 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children who attend a community school. She only studied up to the third grade because her family had scarce economic resources.

Ramira works caring for, purchasing, and selling livestock. She learned this business from her grandmother who dedicated her life to breeding domestic animals. This helped her obtain the necessary income to provide for her family's basic necessities.

Ramira needs this loan to buy materials to repair the facilities where she keeps her livestock because during winter her animals get wet. She also wants to buy fodder for her livestock.

Ramira's dream is to establish a pig farm and build more adequate facilities to care for her pigs and livestock. Also, she wants to buy a truck to move animals.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the facilities where she keeps her livestock and to buy fodder for livestock.

loans.name: Señor De Torrechayoc - Tutiruyoc Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE TORRECHAYOC-TUTIRUYOC,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de de La Convención ,distrito de Echarate y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Maribel continua dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de animales y alimentos.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community Bank "Señor de Torrechayoc-Tutiruyoc". The bank is located in the La Convención province of the Echarate district, in the department of Cusco.

Maribel, one of the members, continues working in agriculture. This member is a responsible and hard working person. Her business is doing well, which brings her personal satisfaction. At the same time, she continues dedicating herself to raising small animals. She wants to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.

This member is requesting a loan to purchase animals and fodder.

This member is thankful for the loan provided and agrees to adhere to the established repayment schedule.

Other members are dedicated to agriculture and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy animals and fodder.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Vizcochoni Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE VIZCOCHONI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Colquepata, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es conviviente y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ganaderia, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ganados. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un ganado.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Virgen del Carmen de Vizcochon" communalñ bank, located in the Colquepata district of the Paucartambo province in Cusco department.

One member is Justina, who has a live-in partner. Justina is 28 years old and has two children. She works at her cattle-raising business. She fattens up and raises the cattle, then sells them at different markets. Justina works from 8am until 6pm. Through this work she wants to get ahead. Justina's dream is to expand her cattle business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy cattle.

The other members of this group make a living selling cereals, clothes, and groceries, and with a restaurant.e abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

Justina is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this loan, and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Angela es de la ciudad de Pilar, está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y a la vez que estudia también está trabajando en su propio comercio de venta de ropas.
Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere ser una licenciada para ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar los gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Angela is from Pilar city, and is studying accounting. At the same time as studying she runs her own business selling clothes.
She is a very tenacious person who wants to have a degree to keep improving her living conditions and to help her family.
She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her degree costs, and in that way pay off the debt which she owes.

loans.use: to pay her degree costs.

loans.name: Rosa Aracely

texts.es:
La señora  Rosa de 41  años de edad, vive con su esposo tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 19 años a la venta de frescos naturales, mariscos, sándwich, taquitos, etc.
Doña Rosa también vende detergentes en su casa y de forma ambulante, es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cemento y madera para mejorar un muro de su casa y otra parte la utilizara en su negocio con la compra de pan, mora, piña, nance, etc.  Con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su casa y su calidad de vida, uno de sus sueños es tener un buen negocio y mejorar el techo de su casa que lo tiene malo.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2015.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two children who are dependent on her. She lives in a community in San Lorenzo in in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and for the past 19 years has been working selling fruit drinks, seafood, sandwiches, tacos, etc.
Rosa also sells detergents from her home and door-to-door, and she is a hard-working woman who wants to get ahead. She is asking for this loan to buy cement and wood to improve a wall in her house, and the other part will be used in her business to buy bread, blackberries, pineapples, 'nance' fruit, etc. With the support of the loan she intends to improve her business and by doing so her home and her quality of life. One of her dreams is to have a good business and to fix the roof of her house which is in a bad state.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2015.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, bread, blackberries, pineapples, 'nance' fruit, etc. for her house and business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy up to date materials to meet her customer demand.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz comenta que siempre ha teniendo el apoyo familiar, es responsable, honesta, proviene de una familia humilde y trabajadora. Su inspiración son sus hijos que le animan a luchar ya que quiere darles una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de psicología y comenta que su meta es llegar a culminar con éxito su carrera.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz says that she has always had support from her family, she is responsible, honest, and comes from a humble and hard-working family. Her inspiration is her children who motivate her to fight because she wants to give them a decent life without them lacking anything.
She is studying for a degree in psychology and says that her goal is to successfully reach the end of her studies.
She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her university fees and thereby continue with her

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
In the Kapsowar area of Kenya it is normal to have a chicken farm, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely. Caroline is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Kapsowar. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 5 years. 

To earn a decent living she keeps dairy cows and sheep and she sells different varieties of farm produce and engages in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as she likes to call them. Only recently, she has started to see how she could be making more money from poultry farming. 

To Caroline, raising hens is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs, but she figures the quantity she produces won't make economic sense. For this, she needs to purchase more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. 

Caroline is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her poultry farm are already committed to pay for her children's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Blanca Hilda

texts.es:
Blanca, de 38 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a vender comida rápida como tacos y hot-dog en un cafetín, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad, ella estudio hasta noveno grado. 


Blanca, tiene 8 años de vender comida rápida en su cafetín que está ubicado en el parque de su municipio, ella aprendió el manejo de este negocio gracias a su abuela, quien dedicó toda su vida a realizar esta actividad y fue quien le inculco buenas ideas y principios para poder salir adelante y satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar salchichas, salsas, pan y una plancha para hacer pupusas, porque la que tiene está deteriorada, otra parte del dinero será utilizada para comprar productos agrícolas, porque su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y necesita los insumos para sembrar. 

Los sueños de Blanca son, mejorar las instalaciones de su cafetín y ampliarlo para vender más comida y pupusas todos los días de la semana.
texts.en:
Blanca, who is 38 years old, works around the house and sells fast food like tacos and hot dogs in a small cafe. She is married and lives with her husband and two children, who study at the school in their community. She studied up to the ninth grade.
Blanca has been selling fast food at her little cafe for the last 8 years in the park in their town. She learned to run the business thanks to her grandmother, who worked in this way her whole life. It was her that taught Blanca good ideas and principles to be able to get ahead and meet the needs of her home.
The money from this loan will be used to buy sausages, sauces, bread and a griddle to make pupusas, because the one she has is dilapidated. Another part of the money will be used to buy agricultural products, because her husband works as a farmer and needs supplies to sow.
Blanca's dreams are to improve the facilities at her little cafe and to make it bigger to sell more food and pupusas every day of the week.

loans.use: to buy sausages, sauces, bread and a griddle to make pupusas.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 30-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house, which regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours per day. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad took a USD loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Claro

texts.en:
Claro is from Baybay, Leyte. He is a 50-year-old married man with nine children. Out of his nine children, he only has a twelve-year-old child that is still attending school.

He is engaged in raising pigs to earn a living. Claro wants to improve his business to upturn their livelihood. For this, he is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy feed for his pigs. He has been doing this business for one year.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
In her late 50s, Eng, who is a married woman from Battambang province, has four children, one of whom (a daughter) is still in school.

To tackle the family’s business, she grows cassava and paddy rice for the main source of income. She is also working as a paid worker to supplement income. The challenge to this family’s business is lacking working capital for the cassava farming business.

This will be her second cycle requesting a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was paid back completely and has had a positive impact on her family as she could provide family members with a hygienic living.

Now forming a group of two members, Eng will use her loan to support cassava farming through paying for plowing fee and purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizer. She hopes to earn more income to achieve her dream of building a proper house for her family to live.

loans.use: to support cassava farming through paying for plowing fee and purchasing rice seeds and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: Doña Balbina es una mujer muy esforzada que ofrece a sus clientes variedad de comidas y bebidas. Ella solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ( $2,100), para la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar mejoras en infraestructura y ampliar su puesto de venta de comidas.
texts.en:
Balbina is a very strong woman who offers customers various meals and drinks.

She is applying for a loan for $2100 in order to buy building materials to improve infrastructure and expand her food stall.

loans.use: to buy building materials to improve infrastructure.

loans.name: Zarik

texts.en:
Zarik from the village of Varser in the Gegharkunik region, thanks you for her first Kiva loan, that she used for her farm cattle number enlargement. She hopes that for the second time she will manage to have profitable and pleasant partnership with Kiva and Nor Horizon.

ZaRik lives in this village with her husband, her retired mother, and a daughter who school-aged. She is busy with her farm works all day along where she has cows, calves, a bull, a piglet, lambs, seven sheep, and chickens. So she sells her farm’s products such as cheese made of both from cow and sheep milk, and also milk, butter, and macun (national dairy-product). She also sells her land’s potatoes, which she cultivates with the help of her husband. This time Zarik asks this loan as her farm cattle has lack of fodder and with this loan amount she will buy a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman and staying together with her husband and one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a fuel/petrol business. She sells from a retail shop. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of fuel for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fuel for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy hens and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides for her crops to enhance quality and improved yields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Khalifan

texts.en:
Khalifan is a married man and has been blessed with four kids ,three of whom attend school. He lives at his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
Khalifan has  operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over five years. He mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.Khalifan dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future
With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own in a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of theft in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and staying together with her husband and seven children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is food . 

For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 50 years old with six children. Among them, three are still dependents ages 10, 12 and 17. Sonia help her husband in their fishing business. She usually prepare what he needs since he is doing fishing mostly at night time. She is asking a loan to buy engine, floaters, fishing weights and fishing nets.

These are necessary so they can catch more fish consistently and without any delays. She is optimistic that through this business, she can buy her family healthy food and continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy engine, floaters, fishing weights and fishing nets

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 26 years old; he is a single hardworking man and he is an Employee of UOB.  He is studying at the University Of Kigali (UK), which is a private institution. With the loan, he would like to pay his tuition fees. He started his studies in 2015 and he plans to graduate in 2017. After paying school fees he plans to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees at the University of Kigali in Rwanda

loans.name: Dainess

texts.en:
Dainess is one of seven children and is 28 years old. Dainess is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that she will be providing a service that allows people in her community to access financial services. She will earn a commission for every transaction that she makes. Dainess is determined to make her business a success. She explains that once she starts earning a reasonable profit, she would like to help her father, who is as pastor to educate her siblings.

When Dainess gets this loan, she will be able to pay for her set-up costs such as buying a trading trolley from which to operate her business, an internet-enabled phone, and other equipment that she needs in order to serve her customers. The loan will also be used as float: Float is money that Dainess will use to serve customers who come to her shop to send and receive money. Dainess sends a big thank you to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her set-up costs such as buying a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone, a cash box, and funds to serve customers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a single woman. She doesnt have children but she lives with her parents and she helps them with the expenses The house is their property.

Gina is going to college and she needs a loan to pay her college tuition Gina is working as a messenger for a private company but she doesnt have medical insurance and her parents are retired people so they can't help her with the payments to the university. She hopes you can help her. Gina is at her house in the picture and as you can see the place is humble

loans.use: to pay her college tuition.

loans.name: Bunthon's Group

texts.en: 32-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Bunthon is a married woman who has two children who rely on her and need her supports. She has been growing paddy rice for 14 years for the main source of family’s income. The crops grew in unhealthy way and produced low outputs; these are the challenge to the business. She is the second-cycled borrower to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner); the past loan has enabled her to buy proper clothes for family members. As a representative of three-member group, she will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee and to buy organic fertilizers to enhance the farmland. She hopes she can earn more income so as to improve the living condition better.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy organic fertilizers to enhance the farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Sanit's Group

texts.en:
Sanit is 44 years old and she is a married mother blessed with a child who depends on her and still in school. She resides in Kampong Thom province where she has been growing rice and working as a teacher to get the main source of family’s income for twenty years. The main challenge to this family’s business is that the crops produced lower-than-expected outputs and this enabled her to earn only about 16,300 KHR a day and save around 7,800 KHR a day for financial needs in the future.

This will be her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which she paid back the past loan completely. Based on the past loan she got, she has managed it to support family’s basic needs timely. Now, leading a group of three members, Sanit, who wants family members to live in hygiene environment, will use her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that all family members are prevented from infectious diseases. Moreover, she wants to improve the living condition for her family.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que tiene como meta poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores de pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Silvina, una mujer muy luchadora y emprendedora.
Silvina es una mujer muy sacrificada que día a día desde muy temprano empieza su trabajo que es la venta de ropas, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Ella se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia, y darles una vida sin privaciones.
La Sra. Silvina solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas para niños, adolescentes y adultos, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is in the Poverty Elimination Program with the goal of improving the living conditions of the members through the survey of the 50 indicators of poverty. One of the members is Silvina, a very determined and enterprising woman.

Silvina is a self-sacrificing person who gets up very early every day to begin her work selling clothing and works until late into the night. She strives to help her family and to give them a life without deprivation.

Silvina is requesting this loan to buy clothing for children, teens, and adults. The loan will help her to fulfill her business plan, which, in turn, will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell for children, teens, and adults.

loans.name: Shafiu

texts.en: Shafiu  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magajin Gari Village. Shafiu  joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Shafiu suffered from poor yields that crippled hisability to pay for my children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Shafiu  has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 35 bags of maize this year, Shafiu  can now ensure that his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en: Sophal’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sophal makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lumbani

texts.en:
Lumbani is a hardworking 29-year-old mother of one. She is married and her husband works as a shop manager. She lives in Mzimba, a town located in the Northern region of Malawi, where he is going to set up her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. Her business will provide financial services to people who need it most.

Lumbani is requesting her first Kiva loan to start running her own business in Mzimba, Malawi. She will set up her business outside of one of the busiest and well-known supermarkets in Mzimba. Her main customers will be people who are unbanked and need to move their monies safely. 

Lumbani has requested a Kiva loan so that she can pay for her set up costs. This loan will be used to serve customers by providing her with float. Float is the money that Lumbani will use in her business on a daily basis to serve customers. The loan will also be used to purchase a small trading Trolley, which she will place outside of one of the agriculture shops to serve her customers. She will also purchase a mobile phone, which she will use to make the actual transactions. Lumbani will also use the loan to purchase a cashbox. 

Lumbani is excited to start running her own business. She currently does not have an income and depends on her husband to provide for her basic needs. She thanks the Kiva lenders and promises to work hard and make her business successful. Lumbani’s biggest dream is to grow his business so that he can one day provide employment to her fellow youths.

loans.use: To purchase a trading Trolley, a mobile phone, and a cash box as well as provide the funds needed for her to start running her own Zoona money transfer business in Mzimba, Malawi.

loans.name: Howard

texts.en:
Howard is 25 years old. He comes from a family of four and lives with his extended family. Howard has successfully completed a training with Zoona to start running his own business as a mobile money transfer agent in Nkhata Bay, Malawi. His business will provide financial services to the large unbanked population in his community. Howard says his life will change once he starts running his own Zoona mobile money transfer business, as he will be able to provide for his basic needs and render financial assistance to his mother and siblings.

He says his community will also benefit, as they will have access to easy and safe financial transactions that will enable them to move their monies without having to wait for days to access services.

Howard is requesting a loan to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Nkhata Bay. With this loan, he will be able to purchase a Zoona branded trolley, a mobile phone and a cashbox. The loan will also ensure that Howard has money to serve his customers. The Trolley will be used to serve customers in Nkhata Bay, as a large number of people still do not have bank accounts or access to any financial institution. Zoona has done market research and has determined that the location for this Trolley is ideal. Lawrence will be one of the main operators of Zoona mobile money transfers in town, and a large number of families will be using his service.

Howard is excited for this opportunity and thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to set up his business so that he can provide financial services to people in Nkhata Bay, Malawi.

loans.name: Khimleng's Group

texts.en: Khimleng’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Khimleng makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Combining 2 businesses has proven to be increasing the income for the family. Its happened in the Sarwa Wiguna group. They used their last loan to improve their businesses in pigs and other businesses such as agricultural, trading and services. Now they can set aside the profit as savings.
After they made their full payment to MUK, the group agree to continue the loan in order to expand their businesses. Ni Ketut use her loan to buy more superior piglets and more merchandise to sell in her canteen in school. Ni Ketut dreams to renovate her house and make wider cage for her piglets. Others member use their portion of loan to increasing the population of pigs and as capital for their other businesses. They very greatfull for receiving the loan and training support. They promise to use the loan wisely.
One member not pictured because of illness.

loans.use: to buy more superior piglets and more merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is 54 years old, widow and has two children. She is a vendor and sustain her children's education through income in selling grocery items to her neighbors. Her child is a college student and wants to finish her degree, that is why she is asking educational loan of P5,000 to pay tuition fees. She will be happy to see her child become successful in her chosen career someday.

loans.use: to pay college tuition fees of her daughter

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 21 years old and has one child.

Grace is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Grace has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell feeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of feeds to sell for her buy and sell feeds business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en: Chanthorn’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Chanthorn makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as officer and factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good materials for making dresses and men's suits.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a bright woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1992. She is single and lives with her parents. She is one of the participants of startup training provided by IMON to his clients. She gets necessary information and knowledge to how to start a new business and make it more efficient.

She decided to do business in agriculture, because they have good conditions to keep livestock and feed them well. The animal market in their area is famous with its variety of livestock. There are gathering from all over the region to buy a good livestock. She appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy livestock. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a business.

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is responsible mother of two children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for seven years. Her husband needs to do maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Bashiran has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Bashiran's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Bashiran also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Bashiran is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is a 48-year-old mother of seven children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady.

Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.
Her son is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools.
Therefore, Rasheeda has requested a loan for her son so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.
She hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to help her son fix his lathe machine and for purchasing cutting tools to work over the lathe machine.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en:
The Nyuh Gading group consist of 6 women who have similar business as a farmer and breeder. To support their families income, they breed pigs or cows and also work in their field. As a farmer, they are planting chillies, cassava, nuts and any other crops. The loan use as capital for both of their businesses. After one loan period, they can harvest and sold for a satisfactory profit. Kadek, as the head, had a sow and 2 months ago it gave birth to 10 healthy piglets. Kadek feels very happy. Now, after keep them for 2 month, Kadek had sold them all.

To expand the businesses, the Nyuh Gading group continue the loan. They will use the loan to buy piglets, seeds and fertilizer. Kadek use her portion of loan to buy feed, renovate the pigpens and fertilizer for her garden. She plans to plant chilli. Now the price for 1 kg chilli almost 50.000 IDR.

Kadek hopes both of her businesses bring a maximum result and she can earn more profit. Kadek has a dream to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy feed, renovate the pig pens and fertilizer for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

loans.name: Anarissa

texts.en:
Anarissa works hard to support her family. Anarissa is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Anarissa has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Anarissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en: Ra, who is a villager from a rural area of Mondulkiri province, is in the age of 51 years and a mother of three children, two of whom are too young to attend school. The main source of this family’s income is from cassava growing and she has been in this business for 12 years. Sometimes, she is working as a paid worker to earn supplemental income. The crop has been destroyed by pests and diseases, which are the challenge to her cassava farming business. Ra decides to form a group of two to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to save the business. In her first cycle, Ra, the group leader, will spend her loan on purchasing organic weedicide for the farmland. She hopes to earn more income to support family’s needs and improve the standard of living.

loans.use: to spend on purchasing organic weedicide for the farmland.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita works hard to support her family. Estelita is married and has a buy and sell cashew nuts business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 37 years old and with three children, two of whom in school, Jovelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items like candies, biscuits, chips, milk, can goods, etc. to sell .

Jovelyn has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future Jovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like candies, biscuits, chips, milk, can goods, etc. to sell

loans.name: Pon's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Battambang province, named Pon, is in her 53 years of age. She is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice and cassava, which she has been involved in for 12 years. Working for others for a fee has been the supplemental business to earn extra income. Due to lacking of working capital for cassava and rice growing, Pon leads a group member to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which will be her fifth cycle. The past loan was paid back successfully and enabled her to sustain family’s living and provide family with comfortable life. Pon, the group leader, will use her loan to support both cassava and rice farming by purchasing seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer. Her hope is to earn more income in order to expand business and build a new decent house for her family to live.

loans.use: To support both cassava and rice farming by purchasing seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ibraheem

texts.en:
Ibraheem is a 30-year-old single man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his wife and two children in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Because he is not able to save enough money, Ibraheem took a USD murabaha loan from FATEN.  With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.  Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient.  This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: Evelyn Marinela

texts.es:
Evelyn, de 24 años, estudio hasta séptimo grado, debido a que sus padres no poseían la capacidad económica para ayudarle a seguir estudiando, actualmente está soltera y hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún hijo, su mamÁ y su papá son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Evelyn, se dedica a vender tortillas desde hace 8 años, su mamá fue quien le enseño a ganarse la vida de esa manera, porque ella tenía un negocio de tortillas también; ahora ella tiene su propio negocio, con el cual se gana la vida honradamente y es la única fuente de ingresos que ella posee, su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa y vende tortillas en la mediodía y en la tarde.

Evelyn, necesita el préstamo para comprar maíz, porque al comprar en grandes cantidades lo compra mucho más barato, ella espera mejorar su negocio y así obtener ingresos mucho más elevados para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.

Evelyn, sueña con tener su propio hogar y tener una plancha para hacer tortillas, con el préstamo espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su negocio y así tener satisfechos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 24 years old, went to school up to the seventh grade, due to her parents not having the economic capability to help her continue her education. Currently, she is single and up to now has not had any children. Her mom and dad are the only ones dependent on her.

Evelyn has worked selling tortillas for the past 8 years. Her mom was the one who taught her to earn her living in this way because she had a tortilla business, too. Now, she has her own business, with which she earns her living honestly and it is the only source of income that she has. She has her business in her own house and sells tortillas at midday and in the afternoon.

Evelyn needs the loan to purchase corn because when purchasing in large quantities, it is bought much more cheaply. She hopes to improve her business and, in this way, have a much higher income to improve her living conditions and those of her family.

Evelyn dreams of having her own home and having a griddle to make tortillas. With the loan, she hopes to improve the conditions of her business and, so, have satisfied customers.

loans.use: to purchase corn.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like fabric conditioner, laundry soap, shampoo, etc. to.

Gina has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like fabric conditioner, laundry soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and gravel to cement the floor and avoid respiratory illnesses in his daughters.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: Doña María, es una madre de 3 hijos con 56 años de edad que vive con su esposo y un nieto en una aldea del Municipio de Puerto Cortés. Durante 25 años ella se ha dedicado a la venta de chocolate en polvo, harina para pinol, cremas de arroz  y atoles. Este producto lo vende con sus vecinos y en el  mercado de su localidad los fines de semana, con lo que ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y darle bienestar a su familia. Ella esta solicitando un tercer prestamo a ODEF el cual es por 4,000 Lempiras para poder invertir en una cantidad mayor de productos como ser cacao, maíz, arroz, especies, canela y otros para preparar el chocolate y sus productos que vende, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y su clientela. Ella sueña hacer crecer su negocio y seguir ayudando a toda su familia a conseguir una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en: María is the mother of 3 children, who is 56 years old and lives with her husband and a grandchild in a village in the municipality of Puerto Cortés. For 25 yeas, she has worked selling powdered chocolate, flour to make pinol, rice creams, and atoles [cornflour drinks]. She sells these products to her neighbors in the local market on the weekends. With that, she has managed to get her children ahead and give her family well-being. She is asking ODEF for her third loan which is for 4,000 lempiras to be able to invest in a larger quantity of products such as cocoa, corn, rice, spices, cinnamon and more to prepare chocolate and the products she sells, with the end of increasing her sales and her customer base. She dreams of growing her business and continuing to help her whole family to get a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa, corn, rice, spices, cinnamon, and more to prepare the products which she sells such as powdered chocolate, pilol [roasted cornmeal], creams, etc.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama La Union hace la fuerza, ya que todas las integrantes se unieron para poder mejorar sus vidas con la ayuda de las unas con las otras. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien vende productos variados de manera ambulante, tiene todo tipo de productos que ofrece a los distintos clientes que siempre le hacen todo tipo de pedidos. Zulma se hizo muy conocida en el barrio, y por medio de ese pequeño trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados, prendas, artículos de bazar, y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a sus seres queridos a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
This group, called La Union, makes itself strong since all of the members got together to be able to improve their lives with the help of each other. They are in the poverty elimination program, working hard to improve each day.

One of the members is Zulma, who sells a variety of products as a street vendor. She has all sorts of products that she offers the different customers who always place all sorts of orders. Zulma has made herself very well-known in the neighborhood, and through this small business has the means to be able to help her family.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase shoes, clothing, small inexpensive items, and more, to be able to continue with her sales and, in this way, be able to continue helping her loved ones through her work.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, small inexpensive items and more.

loans.name: Frontera San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El grupo Frontera San Miguel está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde las 16 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
Maribel integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, comenta que le está yendo muy bien ya que tiene todo tipo de productos y de esa forma se gana la vida de una manera muy sacrificada y trabajadora. Comenta que empezó con muy poco, y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Maribel pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otras prendas para poder seguir con sus ventas y de esa forma seguir ganándose la vida de una manera honrada.
texts.en:
The Frontera San Miguel group is in its 4th loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is located in the city of Caacupé, where the 16 members of the committee make a lot of effort to be able to get ahead with their families.

Maribel is a member of this group. She works selling clothing and says that it is going very well since she has all sorts of products and, in this way, earns her living in a very self-sacrificing and hard-working way. She says that she began with very little and now she has a very good customer base.

Maribel asks for this loan to be able to purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other clothing to be able to continue with her sales and in this way be able to earn her living in an honest way.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other clothing.

loans.name: Km 14 Monday Group

texts.es:
Km 14 Monday es un grupo nuevo, que tiene como meta poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras que quieren salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta, quien tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, se gana la vida a través de su trabajo y con ello ayuda a su familia. Mirta esta entusiasmada de poder capacitarse a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Mirta pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, frutas, carne, panificados, lácteos y otros productos en general, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Km 14 Monday is a new group, which has as its goal to improve their living conditions through the poverty elimination program. They are determined women who want to get ahead.

One of the members is Mirta, who has a store in which she works every day from the very early hours of the morning. She earns her living through her work and, with it, helps her family. Mirta is excited to be able to get training through the poverty elimination program.

Mirta asks for this loan to be able to purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, dairy products, and other products in general, since in this way she will be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, dairy goods and other products to stock her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Unidas está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, todas trabajan y se pusieron como meta poder crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, luchando por mejorar.
Entre las integrantes se destaca la Sra. Liliana, quien se encarga de hacer ella misma ricas empanadas y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante. Liliana es una persona muy trabajadora, que poco a poco y por medio de las capacitaciones quiere poder crecer y mejorar por sus seres queridos.
Liliana pide este préstamo para poder comprar carnes, verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is in its 3rd loan cycle in the women's committee program; all of them work and have made their goal being able to grow not only economically but also as people. They are completing the poverty elimination tool, struggling to improve.

Among the members, Liliana stands out; she works making delicious empanadas herself and then going out to sell them as a street vendor. Liliana is a very hard-working person who, little by little and through the training, wants to be able to grow and improve for her loved ones.

Liliana asks for this loan to be able to purchase meats, vegetables, seasonings, and other supplies to be able to continue with her sales, struggling to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to make empanadas such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, and other supplies.

loans.name: Renacientes De Riobamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RENACIENTES DE RIOBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Yanatile, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Margot ella es conviviente y tiene 37 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva plátanos, café, mandarinas y naranjas, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar su terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the Renacientes de Riobamba communal bank group. This bank is located in Yanatile district, which belongs to Calca province, Cusco department.

The borrower is Luz Margot. She is partnered, 37 years old, and has 1 child. She works in her business growing fruits; the borrower has a plot of land where she grows plantains, coffee, mandarins and oranges. She works from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. The borrower has been in this business for some years already and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the cultivated land. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

The other borrowers work at a business selling animals, a business selling clothing, a grocery store business, and a business selling food.

The borrower is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Allin Muju Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 70:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Las socias que esta pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto, porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de pollos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de confección de ropa, negocio de carpintería y negocio de construcción.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the Allin Muju communal bank group. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department.

The borrower is Luisa. She is married, 44 years old, and has 3 children. The borrower works with her grocery store business. The borrower sells basic products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. The borrower already has been in this business for 10 years and it is going very well for her. The borrower, through this business, wants to get her family ahead. The borrower's dream is to expand her grocery store business. The borrower asks for the loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The borrower is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.

The borrowers who are attached to the group photo took the photo after because they asked permission due to work reasons.

The other borrowers work at a business selling chickens, a grocery store business, a business making clothing, a carpentry business and a construction business.

The borrower is grateful to those who are part of this dream through this platform and promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of water. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store more water to sell. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a water tank to store more water to sell.

loans.name: Zuriani Sadai

texts.es: Zuriani labora en su propio proyecto el cual consiste en ofrecer servicio de hospedaje a sus clientes. Ella solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ( $2,100 ), dinero que usará para la compra de muebles y reparación de la instalación eléctrica del lugar, esto con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio e incrementar los ingresos generados por esta actividad.
texts.en: Zuriani works in her own project which consists of offering hospitality services to her customers. She asks for a loan of two thousand one hundred dollars ($2,100 ), money which she will use to purchase furniture and repair the place's electrical system. This is with the end of offering better service and increasing the income generated by this activity.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and repair the electrical system.

loans.name: Mae Susaine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mae Susaine works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice retailing. Mae Susaine is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc for her general store.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mae Susaine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beans, plantains, cornflour, cabbage, sweet sauce, tomatoes, oil, etc. to be able to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipes, faucets, cement, sand, and electric cables to install potable water and finish installing electricity.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years now.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Aida would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria, de 19 años de edad, es madre de un niño de 1 año de edad, está acompañada y su pareja es jornalero y agricultor. 

Gloria, se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y a los cultivos agrícolas, a ella le enseñaron desde muy joven a ser independiente y a trabajar los cultivos; porque sus padres eran muy pobres y no le podían ayudar a superarse profesionalmente.- Ahora ella tiene su negocio en su vivienda y su pareja le ayuda cuando tiene tiempos libres.

Gloria, necesita el crédito para ampliar más la galera y comprara más pollos de engorde y concentrado, con esto espera poder obtener una mejor ganancia y poder dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Gloria, sueña con poder tener una casa más grande, porque donde actualmente vive es muy pequeño; también sueña con ver a su hijo convertido en profesional y además espera poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Gloria, 19 years old, is the mother of a 1-year-old son, is partnered and her partner is a day laborer and farmer.

Gloria works raising poultry and in agriculture. They taught her when she was very young to be independent and work with the crops because her parents were very poor and they couldn't help her improve herself professionally. Now she has her business at her home and her partner helps her when he has free time.

Gloria needs the loan to expand the chicken coop more and to purchase more chickens to fatten and concentrated feed. With this, she hopes to be able to get better earnings and be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Gloria dreams of being able to have a larger house because where she is currently living is very small. She also dreams of seeing her son become a professional and, in addition, she hopes to be able to continue her education.

loans.use: to expand the chicken coop more and purchase more chickens to fatten, and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, vive con sus padres, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo que estudia primer grado.

Carmen, vende lociones de diferentes marcas por catalogo desde hace 6 años y decidió dedicarse a esta venta porque es una forma de poder ganar dinero para mantener a su hijo y ocupar el tiempo libre que le queda después de su trabajo en una pupuseria; en las tardes cuando ella sale de trabajar es acompañada por su hijo cuando anda ofreciendo sus lociones.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar más lociones de marcas reconocidas, para tener otra variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y así podrá obtener mayores ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Carmen, sueña con poder darle a su hijo lo necesario y para que se gradue de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Carmen, 26 years old, went to school through secondary, lives with her parents, is a single mother, and has 1 son who is in first grade.

Carmen has sold lotions of different brands from catalogs for 6 years and decided to work in these sales because it is a way to be able to earn money to support her son and to occupy the free time that she has after her work in a pupusa business. In the afternoons, she leaves work and she is accompanied by her son when she goes out selling her lotions.

The loan will be used to purchase more lotions of well-known brands, to have another variety of products to offer her customers and, so, be able to get more income to improve her quality of life.

Carmen dreams of giving her son what he needs and that he graduates with a university degree.

loans.use: to invest in lotions from well-known brands.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 45-year-old woman who is married with two daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For many years, Sajida’s husband has been running a crockery store where he sells utensils and he is solely responsible to feed the entire family. Her husband is a trained utensil-maker who uses marble stones to create grinding utensils for herbs, spices, and other uses. He buys raw marble stone and, by using his machinery, manufactures marble utensils. People like his marble utensils a lot and his current business is running well and increasing day by day. 

Sajida is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more stock of raw marble to manufacture utensils. She will use her loan to increase her husband’s business and help him to meet customer demand. Sajida’s husband will use the profit from her loan to save for future needs as well. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase marble to make utensils and crockery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in repairing his cart, fruit, syrups, milk, and ice to be able to continue selling his delicious shaved ice.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a Kiva borrower with three children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. For the past eight years, Jane has been a farmer who grows maize and other cereals. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. Jane’s biggest business challenge is the lack of rain. 

Jane is requesting a 10,000 KES loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. This will be her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Jane hopes that in the future she will have more cereals to sell.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio is a 39-year-old man from Baybay, Leyte. He is married with six teenage children. His oldest child is 17 years old while his youngest child is nine years old. To earn a living, Eugenio buys and sells “tuba,” known as coconut wine. He has been doing this for nineteen years. Aside from this business, he also raises hogs.

Eugenio is requesting a loan to buy piglets, feed, and tuba to sell. He will use his loan to increase his family’s earnings. Eugenio dreams of improving his livelihood to provide for the needs of his family. He especially hopes to have all of his children finish studies in college.

loans.use: to buy piglets, pig feed, and tuba

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 59 years old and widowed with four children. For the past four years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Elsa works very hard to provide for her family.

Elsa is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase household goods to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, de 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su único hijo que está estudiando y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Rigoberto, se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente siembra maíz, frijol y a veces también arroz, siempre se ha dedicado a este trabajo y de esa manera ha podido salir adelante.

Rigoberto, necesita el crédito para poder comprar insumos como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar frijoles y así poder sacar su cosecha al final del año.

Sus sueños son poder ver a su hijo convertido en un hombre de bien, con buena educación y también  ver a su esposa feliz y tener una vida plena en su vejez.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 35 years old, lives with his wife and his only son, who is a student and his wife takes care of the household tasks.

Rigoberto works in agriculture, specifically growing corn, beans, and sometimes rice; he has always done this work and in this way has been able to get ahead.

Rigoberto needs the loan to be able to purchase supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to plant beans, and so to be able to get his harvest at the end of the year.

His dreams are to be able to see his son become a good man, with good manners and also to see his wife happy and to have a full life in his old age.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as manure, pesticides and herbicides to plant beans.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is 30 years old and is a local farmer from Kampong Thom province. She is a married mother blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school. Her other child is too young. For the past ten years, Chanthy has been a rice farmer to support her family. This is the main source of her family’s income but she sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Chanthy’s major business challenge is low output; she can earn about 15,700 KHR daily. She manages to save only around 8,000 KHR for future needs. 

Chanthy is the leader of a three-person group loan request. She will use her portion of the loan to build a decent latrine for her family. This will be her second loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund. She repaid her prior loan and was able to uplift her lifestyle and buy school supplies. Chanthy hopes that her new latrine will enable her family members to live in a hygienic environment and prevent illness.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in vitamins of all brands and women's clothing such as blouses, skirts, and children's suits because she hopes to be able to meet demand for these products.

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 70 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Puerto Cortes junto a una nieta. Hace más de 6 años que doña María, decidió vender mercadería para obtener sus propios ingresos, vende ropa como jeans, short,  toallas, ropa de cama, cortinas, productos de acero como aretes, cadenas, anillos, pulseras etc. y tambien vende lociones, pero su mayor venta es de ropa. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y sale a vender o a entregar pedidos. Ha solicitado varios prestamos a ODEF, para mantener su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 20,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más producto para vender como ser ropa (jeans, blusas, short) y lociones. Ella considera que con el préstamo va aumentar su clientela y con los ingresos va ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 70 years old. She is a single mother of five children who lives in a small town in the municipality of Puerto Cortes with her grandchild. Over six years ago, María decided to sell merchandise to earn her own income. She sells clothing like jeans and shorts, towels, pajamas, curtains, steel products like earrings, chains, rings, purses, etc. She also sells lotions but her biggest seller is clothing. She runs her business out of her home and also goes out to sell or deliver orders.
María has requested loans from ODEF to maintain her business. Currently, she is requesting another loan for 20,000 Lempiras, with which she will buy more products to sell such as clothing (jeans, tops, shorts) and lotions. With this loan, she will increase her customer base and help her family with the profits.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell such as clothing (jeans, tops, shorts) and lotions.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. Nancy has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Nancy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Joy Marie

texts.en:
Joy Marie is 44 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are currently in school.

Joy Marie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Joy Marie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Joy Marie has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Joy Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rita Elena

texts.es:
Rita, de 47 años de edad, vive con su madre y con sus hijos, ella trabaja para mantenerlos y ayudarle a su madre económicamente también.

Rita, se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como granos básicos, aceite, azúcar y café, tiene varios años de tener su tienda y gracias a este negocio ha podido salir adelante, anteriormente trabajaba en un hospital pero se quedo sin trabajo, anteriormente también vendia joyas enchapadas.

Rita, necesita el crédito para surtir su tienda con más productos alimenticios, porque sus clientes le están solicitando que venda más productos y que tenga más variedad, es por eso que quiere ampliar más su tienda.
