Rita, desea que su hijo estudie y sea una buena persona, también desea tener una tienda más grande.
texts.en:
Rita, age 47, lives with her mother and her children. She works in order to support them and to also help her mother financially. Rita sells food products like basic grains, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee. She has had her store for several years. Thanks to this business she has been able to get ahead. She previously worked at a hospital, but she was left without a job. She also previously sold plated jewelry.

Rita needs to loan to stock her store with more food products. This is because her customers are asking her to sell more products and to have a greater variety. This is why she wants to expand her store.

Rita wishes for he son to go to school and to become a good person. She also wishes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to stock her store with more food products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Susan is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy gasoline, fish nets, and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, fish nets, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Noemie

texts.en:
Noemie is a 28-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has four children ages three to ten. For many years now, Noemie and her husband have been engaged in fishing to support their children. She is asking for a loan to buy a new set of fishing nets. It is her wish that this will be instrumental in providing a more comfortable life for her and her family. The income generated will keep her children healthy and in school.

In the future, Noemie dreams of seeing her children become successful in their studies and for her family to live in abundance.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy boxed perfume, creams, and cosmetics on sale to resell.

loans.name: Rocelyn

texts.en:
Rocelyn is 40 years old and has nine children. Rocelyn is married and four of her children are in school.

Rocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Rocelyn has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Glenda Yazmin

texts.es:
Glenda, es madre de 2 hijos que están estudiando, está acompañada, su pareja es empleado en una empresa que vende agua embotellada, actualmente solo vive su pareja y sus dos hijos. 

Glenda, se dedica a la venta de ropa interior para dama y caballero, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace 6 años y sus padres le enseñaron desde muy joven, a ser independiente y responsable, ella comercializa su producto en los alrededores de su comunidad y se desplaza a pie por una distancia aproximada de 3 kilómetros y regularmente sale a trabajar por las mañanas. 

Glenda, utilizara el crédito para comprar más mercaderia como brasieres, broxer, blumer, etc. porque últimamente su negocio ha ido mejorando y quiere vender más para poder dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. 

Glenda, sueña con poder darle a sus hijos toda la preparación académica que ella no pudo lograr, además planea ampliar más su negocio y a futuro poner un local estable donde pueda vender su ropa, también sueña con poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Glenda has two children who are in school. She is married. Her husband works in a business that sells bottled water. Currently, she lives along with her husband and their two children.

Glenda earns a living selling men's and women's underwear. She has worked in this trade for 6 years. Her parents taught her to be independent and responsible when she was very young. Glenda sells her products in the surrounding community. She does this on foot, traveling about 3 kilometers, leaving regularly in the morning for work.

Glenda will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as bras, boxers, panties, etc. because lately her business has been growing and improving. She wants to sell more so that she will be able to give her children a better quality of life.

Glenda dreams of being able to provide her children with the academic preparation that she could not have. She also plans to expand her business and obtain a stall from which to sell her products. She also wants to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as bras, boxers, panties, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, wood, coconuts, etc.

loans.name: Toung's Group

texts.en:
Toung, 52, is a mother of six children, three of whom count on her and the other one is too young to attend school. She lives in Battambang province where she has been growing paddy rice as the main source of family’s income. She sometimes works for others for a fee to supplement income. These two businesses earn her about 41,600 KHR per day and she can save about 23,000 KHR for future needs. Lacking of working capital is the main challenge to her farming business.

Thus, she decided to apply for a loan to better support the business and this will be the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Toung will spend her entire loan on buying organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to provide her children with enough healthy food and send them to school.

loans.use: to spend on buying organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the farmland.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 37-year-old married father of three children, who lives a a Palestinian refugees camp with his beloved family members since he was born.
As a Palestinian refugee living in Lebanon their are few limited businesses they are allowed to practice.
That's why Ali had to finish his intermediate studies and join his brother who used to work in construction specialized in pasting floor tiles and take the necessary requested experience to start his own business in 2000.

Today, Ali his is managing his own business properly, although his acquired income is barely enough to cover his family's increasing living needs. But, his ambitions can't be stopped. Thus for this reason he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy new updated business tools necessary for his business development.

This is Ali's seventh loan cycle acquired from Al Majmoua, his previous acquired loans helped him in developing his business properly and renewing most of his used business tools in addition to buying necessary raw materials requested.
Ali is working hard to improve and increasing his family's income and living.

loans.use: To buy new updated business tools necessary for his business development

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in sugar, wheat flour, leavening, lard, butter and jellies and, in this manner, augment her business's production.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 21-years-old single young man from Dier El balah. One year ago, Ali started his own business which is a a barn for raising poultry. It is a very good business and provide a very good income. Ali always thinks how to improve his business and expand it.

Ali requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more chicks and ducks for his barn to raise. This will increase his productivity and also his income.
Ali appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks for his barn to raise.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a married man who has no children. He lives at his own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.

With the loan, he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and married with eight children, one of whom in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, milk, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Helen would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sardines, milk, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn, aged 56, is a farmer from a remote area of Battambang province. He is married and has six children. Two of three dependent children are under age of school and need support. Growing rice, corn and cassava is the main source of this family’s income; Sorn along with his wife has been involved in these businesses for 10 years. To make more income, he plows the fields for others for a fee.

Now, cassava growing business faces a challenge of lacking of working capital; thus, he leads a three-member group to request for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The past loan which was paid back completely had a positive impact on his family; in fact, he could renovate his house much more comfortable. As the group leader, he will spend his portion of loan on paying for the plowing fee and purchasing cassava seeds. He hopes to earn more income in order to buy an additional plot of farmland to enlarge the business.

loans.use: To pay for the plowing fee and purchase cassava seeds.

loans.name: Beja

texts.en:
Beja is a married man with six children, four of whom attend school and the other two are still too young for schooling. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

He has operated a butcher shop business for the past three years, selling goat meat . He faces a major challenge of transportation in his business.
With the loan, he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana , age 30 years, is a married lady. She is shown in the photo with her husband who has been successfully running a small general store. He offers a variety of daily use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, her husband  needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. She has availed Murabaha loan of PKR 30000 for her husband to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc. to consistently meet the increasing demand of customers and make better earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices etc to consistently meet the increasing demand of customers and make better earnings.

loans.name: Mab's Group

texts.en: Mab’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mab makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chern's Group

texts.en: Chern’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kubiyakhon

texts.en:
Kubiyakhon was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is married and has four children. She is willing to start a new business in agriculture, as she participated at a three day training provided by IMON to startup clients. She had decided that demand for agricultural business is stable and she would have efficient business. They have garden and pastures near their house where she can easy feed her livestock.

She is asking financial support to buy a livestock and start a new business. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness. She wishes to have a good business to help her husband to ensure their family.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a new business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 49 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Jennifer works very hard to provide for them.

Jennifer runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like beverages, bread, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries.

Jennifer has been in this business for 4 years. 

In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like beverages, bread, junk foods, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Tiwonge

texts.en:
Tiwonge is 21 years old. She would like to be in college and do what people her age do, but she can’t because she did not have the money to pay college tuition. Tiwonge lost both her parents at a young age and she and her five siblings grew up with their grandfather. Tiwonge has not given up hope of ever going to college.

She has gone through an intensive training to start running her own business with Zoona as a Mobile money transfer agent in Mzuzu.
Tiwonge’s biggest dream is to expand her business beyond her home town. She intends to work extra hard so that she can open more outlets and have more profits. However, Tiwonge faces the challenge of accessing working capital to start running her own business.

She is requesting for a Kiva loan in order to start her own business. When she gets the loan, she will be able to purchase a trading trolley, a web enabled phone and a cashbox. This is necessary in order to serve her customers. Tiwonge will also use the loan to have the funds needed to serve her customers.
Tiwonge is convinced that her business is going to help her community because many do not know how to read and write and her money transfers will not require complicated paperwork and they will be helped. She says her life will also change because she will be able to provide for her brother and sister’s basic needs and hopefully save up enough money to go back to college.

loans.use: to start running her own Zoona business so that she can empower herself and faciltate money transfers within her community.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Poch's Group

texts.en:
Poch is 54 years old and she is a widow who lives in Pursat province. To make a living, she is growing rice as the main source of income and sometimes she works for others for a fee to supplement income. She has been in her rice farming business for years. The crop was unhealthy because of there is not enough water to irrigate to the farmland, and this is the main challenge to her business.

Poch, who is the fourth-cycled borrower of VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), paid back the past loan completely. The past loan has enabled her to improve the living condition and buy fertilizer for the cash crops. In a group of two, she is a leader and she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for the rice farming business. She hopes that this loan will help her to generate more income so as to uplift the standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 55 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Amalia has been in this business for 29 years.

In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.en:
Eulalia is 57 years old and married with one child in school, Eulalia works very hard to provide for them.

Eulalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Eulalia has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Eulalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like condiments, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Robelita

texts.en:
Robelita is 31 years old and has six children. Robelita is married and has three children who are in school.

Robelita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Robelita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Robelita has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Robelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 44 years old and married.

Violeta is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Violeta has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Chantha’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Chantha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokhy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Thom province, Sokhy is 26 years of age. She is married and has a dependent child under the age of schooling. For about two years, growing rice and cassava has been the main business to her family, while working for others for a fee is an additional source of income. Those businesses earn her around 25,000 KHR per day and enable her to save only around 18,000 KHR a day for future needs.

The crops, which is expected to produce good yields, is threatened by pests and floods; this is the main challenge to her business. Now, Sokhy forms a group of two members to apply for a new loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the second loan cycle of her. The previous loan was repaid successfully and enabled her to support her family’s needs. As the group leader, Sokhy will use her loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that the new latrine will enable her to live safely and will prevent illness.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to protect them from illness

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en: Channy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Channy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a shoe maker and very expert in his profession. He has been sewing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession. He sews shoes made of leather and rexine through sewing machine, after that attached its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way he is generating income for his family. But his current income is insufficient to cherish whole family.

He has been making shoes at home, now he set up a shop to turn his business on wide level so he can generate additional income. But he does not have cash in hand to buy initial raw material for making shoes.

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan for her husband so he can set up shop by purchasing a sewing machine and initial raw materials such as rexene, leather, thread, nails and rubber soles for making shoes.
ZARINA thanks to Kiva, Lender and field partner BRAC Pakistan over this support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and initial raw materials for her husband so he can set up a shop for shoe making.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, es madre soltera de 3 hijos que están estudiando y le ayudan con los oficios del hogar. 

Reyna, se dedica a la agricultura, ella cultiva maíz y frijoles con ayuda de mozos, siembra para consumo familiar y para vender y poder comprar lo necesario para el hogar.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como pesticidas y abonos para sembrar frijoles y obtener la cosecha al final del año.

Los sueños de Reyna, son vivir más dignamente y poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
46-year-old Reyna is a woman very devoted to her family. She is a single mother of 3 children who are studying and help her with household chores.

Reyna is in agriculture. She grows corn and beans with help from assistants. She plants for family consumption and to sell and be able to buy what is needed for the home. She needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides and manure to plant beans and harvest the crops at the end of the year.

Reyna's dreams are to live more decently and be able to give a better future to her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as pesticides and manure to plant beans.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-years-old married man from Khan Younis. Three years ago, Mahmoud started his own business which is a a barn for raising doves and chicken. It is a very good business and provide a very good income. Mahmoud always thinks how to improve his business and expand it.

Mahmoud requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more doves and chicks for his barn to raise. This will increase his productivity and also his income.
Mahmoud appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more doves and chicks for his barn to raise.

loans.name: Nia Njema Group

texts.en:
Kamilius, who is in his early 40s is married with two children who are still at school. He has been a tailor for six years now. He works from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy a sewing machine, an interlocking machine, sewing products and has paid back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loan appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. He used the profit to pay school fees, built his house, bought a TV set, a radio, to pay loan and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the up to date materials for making the latest styles and meet his customers' requirements. He dreams of making his business to international level.

Kamilius will share this loan with his loan group Nia Njema which consists of four people who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the up to date materials for making the latest fashion styles and meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa is a hardworking, ambitious single lady who works hard as a tutor from her house to develop her business in a well managed way, so that in the future she can establish her own tutoring center.
Wafaa is 20 years old single Palestinian refugee, who has been running her home based business since 2012. She lives in a Palestinian refugees camp since she was born, and is working hard to develop her living and covering her increasing needs.
Wafaa had the chance to finish her secondary studies and couldn't attend university. She hopes that she can provide her children the best education and hopes she can see them attending reputable universities in the future.

Working inside the camp is very hard according to the residents low income and low prices set for services and products provided according to the acquired income.
Since Wafaa is working hard to develop her business, she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, which will be invested in buying a laptop necessary for his visual teaching development services.
Through this loan she can help her students have better visual explanations and handouts to help them understand their subjects easily.

loans.use: to buy a laptop necessary for her visual teaching development services.  This will improve her home based tutoring business.

loans.name: Aliet

texts.en: Aliet is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as self-driven. She operates a farm where she keeps pigs. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes. 20,000 loan to buy more piglets. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more piglets.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline 30 years, is married and blessed with two school going children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan from Visionfund Kenya of KES25,000 to buy a dairy cow so as to improve her dairy farming activity and milk production for more income gain.

She plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. She hopes to improve her family living standards in future.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to improve her dairy farming activity and milk production for more income gain.

loans.name: Yonathan Segundo

texts.es:
Yonathan tiene 27 años de edad, casado,tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en este mismo distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa norte de perú.

Yonathan se dedica a brindar los servicios de jornalería-fumigación, contando con herramientas propias, como mochila de fumigar, palana, pico y oz; con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio esta ubicado en su mismo domicilio, solicita préstamo para arreglos y mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas; él piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona, aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yonathan is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his family in this same district of Oyotun in a rural zone, pertaining to Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's north coast.

Yonathan offers his services as a day laborer-fumigator, counting on his own equipment, such as a fumigation back pack [shown above], and other farming tools, including a pick, and a scythe. He has over 20 years experience in the business, which is located in his home.

Yonathan is requesting a loan for maintenance and repairs on his equipment and tools that will improve their condition. He wants to boost his services and productivity and, thus, be able to fulfill the diverse needs of his customers in the zone, augment his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs and perform maintenance on his equipment and work tools.

loans.name: Ma. Anna

texts.en:
Ma. Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional fruits to sell for her fruit vending business.

Ma. Ana  has been in this business for 7 years. Ma. Ana earns more income from meat vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ma. Ana  has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits to sell.

loans.name: Ludjean

texts.en:
Ludjean is 26 years old and married with two children, two of whom in school, Ludjean works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like can goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

Ludjean has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Ludjean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Roxana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Roxana, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que están estudiando y su esposo trabaja en la tierra cultivando maíz y frijol.

Roxana, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también tiene una tienda en su casa, en donde vende productos alimenticios, golosinas, sodas y otros productos.

Roxana, necesita el crédito para surtir su tienda con arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, café y otros productos.

Ella desea que sus hijos estudien y se superen academicamente.
texts.en:
Roxana is 31 years old and very hard working. She lives with her husband and their 3 children. The children go to school, and her husband works on the land growing corn and beans.

Roxana spends her time tending to her home, but she also has a store in her house, where she sells food items, candies, sodas and other things.

Roxana needs a loan to stock her store with rice, beans sugar, bread, coffee and other things. She wants her children to study and to succeed academically.

loans.use: to stock her store with rice, beans, sugar, bread, coffee and other products.

loans.name: Sreyden

texts.en: A resident of Kampong Cham province, Sreyden is 34 years old and the mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and the remaining one under school-age. She has been growing cassava as the main source of family’s income for years, as growing cassava is an additional business for the family. The cassava crop was destroyed by pests and grew unhealthily; this is the challenge to the business. Since she wants to save the business, she decided to apply for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which will be her second. Sreyden has been able to buy household appliances and enhance the agribusiness because of the previous loan she obtained. She will use most of her loan to purchase organic fertilizer for rice and cassava farming and the rest will be used to purchase school supplies for her school-aged children. She hopes she can earn more income to expand the business so as to keep sending her children to school and improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer for rice and cassava farming.

loans.name: Chay's Group

texts.en:
Chay who is a 63-year-old farmer resides with his three children in Battambang province where he and his wife have been growing cassava for the main source of income for 12 years. In addition to family’s income, he sometimes works for others for a fee. He can earn about 45,000 KHR a day and approximately save about 22,800 KHR a day for financial needs in the future.

This is his second time applying for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) which he repaid his past loan completely. His house and living condition have been improving, based on the past loan he obtained. Chay, the group leader, will use his loan to purchase cassava seeds and to pay for the plowing fee. He hopes to generate more income to buy an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase cassava seeds and to pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, cooking oil ,eggs, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes. 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, eggs, rice and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, soap, cooking oil, eggs, rice and other items.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a hardworking mother from Tagbilaran City, Bohol. She earns a living by peddling vegetables like squash, beans, ampalaya (biter melon), upo (bottle gourd) and sweet potato tops to the locals. She has three dependents ages nine, seven and six months old respectively. It has been eight years now that Ana has engaged in her vegetable vending business.
She needs additional funds to continue her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional vegetables, cellophane and a weighing scale. These will enable Ana to sell variety of vegetables and cater to the needs of her customers. With these, her income will augment and she will be able to settle her finances. In these way, she can provide her children with nutritious meals and other basic necessities including a quality education.

Ana will do her best to improve her source of income to support the needs of her children for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables, cellophane and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has two children. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the Kes. 70,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. This will enable him do dairy farming and sell milk to increase his income. His business goal is to be a prominent dairy farmer within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ndegwa

texts.en:
Ndegwa is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. He faces a major challenge of transportation in his business.

With the loan, he is requesting he wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Nadzua

texts.en:
Nadzua is a married woman and staying together with her husband and children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Chausiku

texts.en:
Chausiku is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a Khanga ( women wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.In addition she also operates a business of selling charcoal and firewood that earns her another source of income.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has three children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six  years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She decided to join yehu to access loan an improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more used shoes for sale.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, porque su familia no tenía los recursos necesarios para poder darle el estudio, está casada y su esposo es motorista de un bus, tiene siete hijos, cuatro de ellos ya están casados y viven aparte y los otros tres viven con ellos y están estudiando. 

Ana, tiene un pequeño comedor en donde vende comida típica desde hace muchos años, este negocio lo aprendió gracias a su mamá.  

Ana, necesita el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio, porque en esta temporada se encuentra de fiesta su pueblo y llegan muchas personas, es por eso que quiere estar preparada porque en esos días tiene más demanda.

Ana, espera que estas fiestas le dejen buenas ganancias en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 44 years old. She studied up to Grade 4 as her family didn't have the resources needed to provide her with more studies. She is married and her husband is a bus driver. She has seven children. Four of them are married and live elsewhere and three of them live at home and are studying.

Ana has a small eatery where she has sold traditional foods for many years. She learned this business from her mother.

Ana needs the money from the loan to buy merchandise for her business as during this season her community has it's festivals and many people arrive. So she wants to be prepared as there is higher demand in these days. Ana hopes that the festivals provide her with good profits from her business.



Ana, espera que estas fiestas le dejen buenas ganancias en su negocio.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food business.

loans.name: Fizwell

texts.en:
Fizwell 38, is a teacher who lives in Chibombo District, Zambia with his family of sixteen. He is asking for a Kiva loan to buy a maize milling machine so that he can provide a milling service to over 600 families in his community. The maize milling machine takes raw maize (corn) and creates a maize flour which is the staple food in Zambia. Most rural families in Chibombo District grow maize on their small farms and store it and use it as their primary supply of food for the year. After the kernels are removed from the cob, they then have to be milled to create flour, which can then be boiled to make what is locally called Nshima.

Rent-to-Own has done market research in Fizwell's community and has determined that the location for this equipment is ideal. The closest maize mill is about 7 km away, This means most potential customers have to travel more about 7 km, and since most will walk or use their bicycles to travel to the maize mill, it is certain they will prefer to use this maize mill rather than traveling a longer distance.

Unfortunately, the upfront costs of such a maize mill are very prohibitive. Once he secures a loan, Fizwell will be able to get a maize mill from Rent-to-Own, which will deliver the equipment, as well as provide training on how to use and maintain it. This loan will help Fizwell on the path to building up a viable business that can provide for his community throughout the year. It is for this reason Fizwell is asking Kiva lenders to help him with the loan so that he can secure a maize mill as soon as possible.

loans.use: to obtain a maize milling machine for the benefit of his surrounding farmer community

loans.name: Pashk

texts.en:
Pashk is behind with the water bills and he needs your understanding and financial help to pay the arrears. Kindly note that many people in the rural area were overcharged due to system errors and unfortunately some mistakes in operations. This resulted in some people being overcharged, some never receiving their dues and some being forced to leave their work until they paid the responsibilities.
Pashk is a father of seven and his oldest child, who was hired by some provincial services, was kicked out of work because his family could not pay the water arrears. Pashk works as a mechanic for a monthly pay of $410 and his wife makes $119/month.

loans.use: to pay his family's water bill; the water has been cut off in their house until they pay.

loans.name: Rukui Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Teresiah, thirty seven years old married and a mother of four children. She has undergone the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training which has enabled her start her own enterprise. She does dairy farming and also operates a milk bar to earn her living and she is borrowing Kiva to buy more milk to add to her stock. She hopes to get better returns to enable her pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their borrowers for their support.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of milk for sale thus earn more income to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Rene Wilberto

texts.es: René, es un hombre de 37 años de edad que vive con su esposa e hijo en una aldea del Municipio de la Arada, Santa Bárbara.  Que durante 20 años se ha dedicado al cultivo de café para el sostén de su vivienda y bienestar familiar. Esta producción de café la vende en el mercado de la zona o sus intermediarios.  Ha decidido  solicitar un préstamo de 4,000 Lempiras para poder invertir en la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para darle asistencia a su pequeña finca de café, para aumentar la calidad y cantidad de su producto. Su  meta  para un futuro es ampliar el cultivo en otra parcela de terreno y aumentar sus ingresos a fin de brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
René is 37 years old and lives with his wife and son in a village in the municipality of Arada, Santa Bárbara. For 20 years he has worked growing coffee to support his home and the well-being of his family. He sells his coffee production in the local market or to middlemen.

He has decided to seek a loan of 4,000 Lempiras so that he can invest in the purchase of fertilizers and supplies to help him with his small coffee farm, in order to increase the quality and quantity of his product.

His goal for the future is to expand his crop to another parcel of land and to increase his income in order to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies to help him with his small coffee farm.

loans.name: Rowayda

texts.en:
Rowayda is a 31-years-old divorced woman from Nablus city. She is a mother to three sons and two daughters. A few years ago, Rowayda started her own business, a barn for raising chicken. It is a very good business and provides a very good income. Rowayda always thinks of how to improve her business and expand it.
Rowayda requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more chicks to raise in her barn. This will increase her productivity and also her income.
Rowayda appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise in her barn.

loans.name: Yaqueline Harabeli

texts.es:
Yaqueline tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su conyuge y sus hijos en una zona rural del distrito de Nueva Arica que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Yaqueline se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Yaqueline espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yaqueline is 33 years old. She is in a realtionship and lives with her spouse and children in a rural part of the district of Nueva Arica which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Yaqueline works raising and selling small animals like chickens, chicks, ducks and turkeys amongst others. Her business is located at her house. She has 10 years experience in this business and very good personal and work references from the district.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as buying balanced feed for them. Doing this Yaqueline hopes to offer a better product to her clients which will allow her to generate more money and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals as well as buying balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida, who is in her mid-40s, is married with four children who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 12 am to 4 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Saida’s tenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a deep freezer for selling cold soft drinks, a machine for mixing baking flour and an increase in mamalishe stock. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay for school fees, loan repayment, a new plot of land and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in her food stock. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Saida will make sure she pays her loan within the loan's scheduled time.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in her food stock.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is engaged in a food selling business. She has sold barbecue in her place for a year. Jocelyn is a 31-year-old woman with three children ages ten, nine and two years old. Aside from selling barbecue, she is also engaged in raising hogs. She buys piglets and feed for her hog-raising business.  She is asking for a loan to buy chicken meat (legs, liver, wings, and intestines), pork and hotdogs. Jocelyn dreams to uplift her business to increase her livelihood. She wishes to have a comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat (legs, liver, wings, and intestines), pork and hotdogs.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 30 years old. He lives with his wife and their 10-month old baby Gladys in Karonga, Malawi. His wife sells groceries to help take care of the family. Godwin completed his education and has worked as a volunteer most of his life. He enjoys doing voluntary work and has a passion for community work.

Godwin is excited to start running his own business as it will help him provide basic needs for his young family. He explains that right now he is dependent on the meal and transport allowances which he gets from his voluntary work in the community. The prospect of providing people in his community with a convenient way to send and receive money also excited him.

Godwin is requesting for a Kiva loan in order to purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and have the funds needed to serve customers once he starts operating his Mobile money transfer business in Karonga. Godwin thanks the Kiva lenders for their support and promises to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase a trading trolley, a web-enabled phone and have the funds needed to serve customers once he starts operating his Zoona mobile money transfer business in Karonga.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en: Dahiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. Dahiru joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Dahiru suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dahiru will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dahiru now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Herberth Tulio

texts.es: Herberth es un hombre trabajador de 36 años de edad que se siente feliz ya que vive junto a sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando con su apoyo. Herberth se gana la vida desde hace 10 años con su taller de estructuras metálicas, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con este pequeño negocio y de esta manera sacar adelante a su familia. Herberth hace algunos años inicio la construcción de su vivienda, ya que actualmente alquila, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines, pines, puertas y ventanas para terminar su vivienda y ofrecer a sus hijos un lugar propio en el cual vivir, el espera poder contar con este apoyo y de esta manera mejorarla calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Herberth is a hard working man who is 36 years old. He is happy living with his two children who are in school with his support. For the past 10 years Herbert has made a living with his metal-working shop. He is happy to be able to count on that small business to move his family forward.

A few years ago Herbert began building his home, since he currently rents. For that reason he has decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, beams, fasteners, doors and windows in order to finish his house and provide a place of their own for his children to live in. He hopes to be able to count on this support in order to improve the quality of life of his children.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, beams, fasteners, doors and windows to finish his house and provide a place of their own for his children.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Her name is Mildred, 40 years old, resident of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Ramon, a driver with whom she has children. Life maybe hard in a third world country but God is faithful to allow Mildred to have multiple business to provide for her family.

Mildred helps her husband make a living by having a small general store as she is shown on her photo. She also has a boarding house and a jeepney as transportation service which her husband drives to augment their income. Her jeepney needs to have regular maintenance to ensure safe and efficient service.

She is requesting a Php 20000 loan which she will use to buy new tires for her jeepney. She is hoping and is thanking God and you in advance for your positive response to assist her in her livelihood. She is thankful that her earnings from her three businesses helps a lot in sending her children to school and fund their household needs.

Mildred hopes to build additional boarding house and grow her businesses so she could save up for her children's College Education. She prays for the safety of her husband and passengers in their everyday trips. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for her jeepeny's new tires.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna lives at Solana. She is a widow and had three grown-up children. She is managing a store for income. Aside from the store, she also raise hogs to sell upon achieving the desired weight. She wanted to continue improving her sales in the store but had insufficient fund that is why she is asking for a loan of P20,000 to invest in her businesses. She will buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles and soap to sell. She will save additional revenue to further develop her sales. She will pay back her loan in full.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, soft-drinks and noodles to sell

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 61 years old and married with seven children. With one child in school, Prima works very hard to provide for them.

Prima runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional item to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Prima has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Prima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional item to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Oun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Ismael

texts.es:
Ismael, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casado, tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos estudian y el otro trabaja para ayudar en los gastos de la casa.  

Ismael, es carpintero, aprendió el oficio desde muy pequeño, tuvo que dejar la escuela para trabajar con su papá con los gastos del hogar y tiene un carro en el cual entrega sus muebles y hace viajes. 

Ismael, necesita el crédito para reparar su vehículo, porque se le ha dañado y tiene problemas para entregar sus muebles. 

Ismael, anhela poder reparar su carro y de esa manera poder brindar un mejor servicio y tener cada día más clientes.
texts.en:
Ismael is 45 years old and studied up to Grade 3. He is married and has four children. Three of them study and the other works to help with the household expenses.

Ismael is a carpenter. He learned this trade when he was young as he had to quit school to work with his father to help with the household expenses. He has a vehicle with which he delivers his furniture and travels.

Ismael needs the loan to repair his vehicle as it is damaged and he has problems delivering his furniture.

Ismael hopes to be able to repair his truck and in this way provide better service and have more clients each day.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle as it is damaged and he has problems delivering his furniture.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en: Thavy’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Thavy makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bupeang's Group

texts.en: Bupeang’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Bupeang makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en:
A married and 29-year-old woman, Theng has four dependent children, three of whom are in school and the remaining one is under the age of school. She lives with her family in Mondulkiri province where the cassava has been growing to earn the main source of family’s income for years. In leisure time, she is working for others for a fee to supplement income. Pests and diseases affect the crop heavily, which causes her to have not enough working capital to do farming for this season.
Theng is now leading a group of three members to request for a new loan, which will be her second time, from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has enabled her to improve the standard of living. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on purchasing organic pesticide for the farming. She hopefully wants to get more crop yields so as to sell it at good price.

loans.use: to spend on purchasing organic pesticide for the farming.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 57-year-old Palestinian refugee, a married father, who lives and works in a Palestinian refugees camp. Thirty years ago, Kamel started working in scrap and used clothes business to make his living and cover his family's increasing living expenses.
He kept developing his business in order to cover his children increasing living needs. Until he opened and developed through his previously acquired Al Majmoua loan, a special washing machines and refrigerators selling sector, and it was impressive to manage.

Today, and since the diversified businesses helps Kamel to financially support his family easily, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase his electronic business merchandise through buying special good quality used items that will attract customers' attention and increase his selling.
Despite the difficult living circumstances to improve his work, he was capable through the previously acquired loans from Al-Majmoua to move his work to a better location inside the camp and develop it properly.

This loan will help Kamel expand his business, increase his income, and provide his beloved family with better social and financial living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his electronic business merchandise through buying special good quality used items that will attract customers' attention.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in pants, skirts, blouses, and shirts, among other things, to increase his sales.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Running her business at its early stage became very challenging to Belinda, since she didn’t have enough capital to support it. When she heard that Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help new entrepreneurs she didn’t hesitate to enroll to the program. Because nowadays, perseverance and determination is not enough, but monetary capability is very important to make the business grow. When her previous loan was granted, it became the start of a big change on her business. Aside from running a variety store, she's now focused on selling personal products like soap, shampoo, make up, perfumes, and others. She attracted additional number of patrons in her new business.

Belinda wants to thank lenders for donating certain amounts that supported her business. She’ll include them in prayer as God will return abundance to those who considered her story. Now, she is requesting for another loan of P20,000 as she needs to add stocks on display of personal products. She aims to have more items to get more customers and bigger sales.

Belinda spares time attending the weekly CCT group fellowship consisting of 10-15 individuals where she can gain spiritual strength and where she can reflect on God's Word and testimonies from other CCT partners. She can also build social relationship with other fellowship members and pay Micro Finance loans during this fellowship meeting.

loans.use: to add stocks on display of personal and home care products.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita tiene 35 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con sus hijos y su conyuge quien es jornalero agricola, en una zona rural del distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Anita se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Anita espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Anita is 35 years old.  She is in a live-in relationship.  She lives with her partner and her children.  Her partner is a farm laborer.  They live in a rural area in the Zaña district, located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The people in this area work mainly in agriculture, ranching, and trade.

Anita works raising and selling barnyard animals such as chicks, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others.  Her business is located in her home.  She has many years of experience in this business and has very good personal and work references from the local area.  

She will use the loan she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and chicks, among others.  She will also buy balanced feed for them.  In this way, Anita hopes to offer a better product to her customers, which will allow her to generate a better income and, in the end, increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy animals as well as animal feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is very hard working mother of three young children. She earns a living by raising hogs. She grows and sells hogs, to support her family. She is forty-five years old married woman. She resides in the town of Panglao, Bohol.  Aside from hog raising, she also grows chicken. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter.  

Severa has requested a loan to buy feeds for the chicken and pigs, and purchase hens and chicks. She could continue raise healthy hogs and  poultry as well. These will improve her income and able to  provide nutritious foods to the whole family. Thus, she could continue send her children to school, in preparation for their bright future.

She is determined to improve her both livelihood to be productive and also to have better living condition as well.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the chicken and pigs, and purchase hens and chicks

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom in school, Christine works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, sugar, etc.

Christine has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as buy and sell ready to wear.

In the future Christine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, chips, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three sons and three daughters.
Her husband is a very hard working and honest person; he owns a small restaurant in which he offers many types of delicious foods. He offers breakfast and lunch to his customers. He has been running this restaurant for many years and earning an insufficient profit due to the ugly condition of his restaurant. He cooks delicious food for the restaurant, and the people like to eat from his restaurant.
The condition of his restaurant is not good- scratched walls, low sitting arrangements, dark room and there are no electricity supplies available. The customer has to face problems and feels hesitant to come inside the restaurant. He does not want to disappoint his dear customers because due to these customers he earns his income.

He wants to establish his restaurant by redecorating his restaurant. He wants to paint the walls, provide an electricity supply, and buy new furniture and new crockery.
Therefore, Shenaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can maintain his restaurant in well manners so that it can look attractive.
She thanks Kiva and appreciates the warm support by everybody.

loans.use: to help her husband in redecorating his restaurant by painting the walls, provide an electricity supply, and buy new furniture and new crockery.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, meet Rebeca! She is a mother who has been practicing agriculture for the last 10 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has about farming, she commands a lot of respect among other farmers, and she is viewed as a mentor in her village.

She lives with her family in the Kitale area of Kenya, which is known for maize plantations for export production. Rebeca’s primary income sources are eggs, milk, and some personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. Generating an income through selling her harvest is the part of farming she enjoys most. She also keeps a dairy cow.

Availability of labor is a major challenge for Rebeca. Before joining Juhudi, Rebeca could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high-risk client. She mobilized marginalized farmers and created the group Weyeta traders. Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also got to learn about Kiva.

Rebeca is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. With your loan, Rebeca will purchase more effective, modern tools that will make her farm activities much easier. This will boost her income and enable her to pay school fees for her children.

Rebeca awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 42-year-old married woman who has six children. She lives in a populated area, and her husband knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers.

Farzana's husband chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts.

She applied for a loan so her husband can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit for her husband's fruits selling business.

loans.name: Kawakeb

texts.en:
Kawakeb is a 50-year-old married mother of four children, who has been working as a tailor from her house since 2007, to support her husband in covering their increasing living needs.
She is a hard working lady, who is developing her business as much as she can through available resources to make sure she can compete with the available tailor residents.
Kawakeb's income is good enough combined with her husband's who works as a teacher with a limited monthly salary to cover their family's needs.

But, still any unexpected additional living need can't be done without an external financial support. Thus, for this reason Kawakeb is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary living room furniture for her house to make sure she can develop her family's living properly.
She hopes to stay capable of developing both her business and family's living as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy necessary living room furniture for her house to make sure she can develop her family's living properly.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, beans,  sorghum, wheat and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. 

Her business is located in an area with high demand for the products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of the products during dry season. 

She will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be the owner of a big cereals store and supply to other outlets within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be a leading role model in business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
Sophia who is in her late 40s is married with two kids,one of them is grown up and one is still at school. She has been selling pebbles for six years now.. She works from 08a.m to 06.pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sophia’s 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increas her stock through buying of more pebbles and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land, reinvest in business and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to extending her business. She dreams of being an international business woman and to get more developments.

Sophia's will share this loan with her loan group Wazo tegeta which consist of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her sale of pebbles.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 47 years old, married and had eight children. Five of whom attends school and needs educational assistance. She is engaged in vegetable vending business. She was able to save profits from her daily income. She is borrowing loan of P8,000 so she can increase her sales and gain good profits too. She will buy cabbages, eggplant and tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 6 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs and labor costs for rice farming.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and labor costs for rice farming

loans.name: Romel

texts.en:
On the first years of managing the sari-sari store business, Rommel thought that it’ll be difficult for him considering the market competition and customers' demands. However, he’s grateful that with the help of the Lord and by using the lenders, Kiva and Center for Community Transformation (CCT), the prior loan of P20,000 was approved and became a great help for his business to step up. Rommel once again wants to express his gratitude. 

Like any businesses, competition of the same industry line is one of the prime challenges. That’s why Rommel is always focused on handling the business and marketing schemes on how to attract customers. With the help of the Lord, he’s greatest foundation, the business is able to survive on a daily basis. This time, Rommel applied for P26,000 loan that he can use to purchase more grocery items for his sari-sari store. Part of it will be used to buy refills of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG).

Rommel regularly meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Merene

texts.en:
When speaking of Merene, it can't be avoided noting that she is a farmer from birth, raised and educated with lovely rural values such as humility, honesty and hard work. Despite personal challenges, her passion is to support her children and siblings.

The living conditions in the Kitale area are very tough, and you need to have a tough skin in order to survive. Merene has always shown the resilience necessary to beat all the odds. Because of the hardcore poverty in her village, Merene started practicing mixed farming 10 years ago. Her sources of income are vegetables, milk, and egg sales. However, these products are highly perishable and require timely delivery to the market. The Kitale area has a poor road network and poor feeder roads, which really hampers timely delivery of products to the market. That is why Merene is kindly seeking a loan to buy a motorbike. With the motorbike, She will deliver products to the market on time and reap more profits, because the products will still be fresh.

Merene is very determined to succeed. Because she is very disciplined with her finances, she believes she will be able to provide a secure future for herself and for her children through her accumulated profits.

Merene's dream is to provide a secure future for her siblings by paying tuition fees for them. You will help her realize her dream through your loan

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to deliver her perishable products to the market in a timely manner.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Girlie works hard to support her family.

She has a native bag making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock. Girlie is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase more raw materials for her native bag making business.

Girlie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing for her own clothes selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy basic food items like basic grains, lard, sugar, meats and cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Aun's Group

texts.en:
A 52-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Aun is a widow who has five children, two of whom depend on her and only one of them is in school. To make a living, she is growing rice and working as a construction worker for the main source of family’s income. To make additional income, she sells some grocery items in her community. She has been involved in rice farming business for over three decades. The challenge is to harvest low outputs from rice crop which has been destroyed by pests and diseases.

Now she is applying for a loan, which is the first time, from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan to purchase some construction materials such as bricks, steel, stones and cement to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house to happily live in as others do.

loans.use: to purchase some construction materials such as bricks, steel, stones and cement to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wood, paint, seeds and other products to improve her business and increase sales.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is from Baybay, Leyte. She has been running a hog raising business for five years. Aside from this business, she is also engaged in buying and selling charcoal.
