She is asking for a loan of PHP 3,000 to buy a pig. Thirty-nine-year-old Lolita wishes to have a piggery in the future in order to increase her earnings. She works hard for her four children, aged eleven, eight (twins), and seven years old.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh is 51 years old and she is married with 4 children. She works in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. Because the income from her business is not high so it is very hard for her to built a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filter system.

In 2011, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
In the future, Minh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to improver her life standard.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet and bathroom and water filter system.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
She hails in the town of Panglao, Bohol. Her name is Vicenta, a fifty year old, is married with four children . Her youngest child is 15 and still attending school. She raises and sells hogs.
Aside from hog raising business, she engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to the locals in the community.
She has been engaged in both livelihoods for more than 10 years.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed and purchase assorted fish to re sell. With the availability of these resources, it enables Vicenta to continue raises quality hogs and also sold more volume of fresh fish daily. Thus, it makes her earnings increase and able to pay her obligations.


She would like to expand her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and purchase assorted fish to re sell

loans.name: Art

texts.en: Art, a widowed woman, is 40 years old and she lives in Kampong Cham province where she has been working for others for a fee for the only main source of family income. Earning about 26,700KHR per day, she can save about 20,000KHR after deducting the daily expenses. This is the first time for her applying a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to work. She hopes that this motorcycle will reduce traveling time so that she can earn more income than ever before.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute from home to work.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair, service and maintain his motorcycle in a very modern way to attract and serve customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a married woman with 3 children.

Ann operates a retail business where she sells utensils, plastic containers, clothes and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds.

Ann will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy a 10,000 litre water tank to store water for domestic use.

Her business goal is to have her own business premises within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a 10,000 litre water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Tartisio

texts.en:
Tartisio is a married man with one child.

He operates a retail business where he sells flour, sugar, soft drinks, rice, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have his own business premises within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his child.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en:
Taj is a 41 year old, married woman, shown in the photo with her husband. He has been successfully running a small general store with his son. Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and he makes enough to meet the expenses of their three children.

Currently, she is requesting a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR for her son to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to a maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income.

Taj is positive about their earnings and aspires to save money for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to the maximum number of customers to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Jibrin

texts.en:
Jibrin is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sona Village.

Jibrin joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Jibrin suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Jibrin will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Jibrin now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Urukundo Group

texts.en:
Urukundo is a group led by Beatha who is 30 years old. The group's name means “love” in English. The group members sell different items but have the same desire to change their life.

Beatha is married and has 4 children between the ages of 6 and 18. All of them go to school. She sells fruits and has been doing this business for the past 5 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more oranges and mangoes to sell.

The profits from her business will be used to improve her standard of living and generate savings.

loans.use: to buy more oranges and mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Kevin Ernesto

texts.es: Kevin es un hombre trabajador de 21 años de edad que desde hace 1 año decidió invertir en su pequeño negocio de venta de pupusas, actividad que le permite apoyar a sus padres con la economía de su hogar, sobre todo porque él es muy responsable y siempre trata de apoyarles. Kevin habita en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con un lugar adecuado en el cual vivir. Kevin desea mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, por lo que ha decidido aumentar sus ventas por medio de mejoras en su negocio, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, frijol, chicharrón, sillas y mesas para mejorar su negocio de venta de pupusas.
texts.en:
Kevin is a hardworking 21 year old man who decided a year ago to invest in a small business selling pupusas (local dish made from corn dough). This activity allows him to support his parents with household expenses. Above all he does so because he is very responsible and always tries to support them.

Kevin has lived in his own home for three years and feels very happy to have an adequate home in which to live. Kevin hopes to improve his standard of living, as well as that of his family. For this reason he has decided to increase sales by improving his business. He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, beans, pork rinds, chairs, and tables to improve his pupusa business.

loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, pork rinds, chairs, and tables to improve his pupusa (local dish made from corn dough) business.

loans.name: Abaharanirabukungu Sub Group A

texts.en:
Bernadette is a group leader; aged 32 years. She is married with 1 child who has 3 years. The group is called Abaharanirubukungu which means “Target for economy” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change their future for the better.

Bernadette has a shop and has been running a business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay medical insurance and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en: Mussarat  is a 53-year-old married woman with three children; one of her sons is also shown in the photo.  Her husband is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Mussarat has taken out a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van, so he can provide better facilities for his customers. Mussarat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new van engine to provide better facilities for customers.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with four children. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a boda boda(motorcycle) transport business, where her potential customers are town dwellers and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality especially during rainy season it becomes hard to operate. Her dream is to purchase another motorcycle in the near future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to add to her savings and  purchase new motorbike for her business. She decided to join Yehu because of affordable interest rates so that she can boost her business.

loans.use: purchase new motorbike for her business

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi  is married and has four children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither  has electricity nor  piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five  years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Mai Anguwa

texts.en:
Mai Anguwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sona Village.

Mai Anguwa joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mai Anguwa will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mai Anguwa now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields.

loans.name: Enoch Kwadwo

texts.en:
Enoch is a very hardworking young man. He is married and has a three month old daughter. He sells sachet and bottled water at the Takoradi station at Kaneshie and also sells phone accessories. 

Enoch wants to use this loan to expand his sachet and bottled water business to increase his income and manage his home. He believes that in five years time he will open two additional water sales points.

loans.use: to expand his sachet and bottled water business

loans.name: Hatem

texts.en:
Hatem is a 27-years-old married man from Jabalia. Recently, Hatem started his own business which is a barn for raising doves and chicken. It is a very good business and provide a very good income. Hatem always thinks how to improve his business and expand it.

Hatem requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more doves and chicks for his barn to raise. This will increase his productivity and also his income.
Hatem appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more doves and chicks for his barn to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in wholesale rice, beans and corn so that he can increase sales at his business.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a resident in the town of Panglao, Bohol. She engages in fish vending business. She  sold fresh fish to the local. She is sixty-six year old married woman with four grown children. She has been selling fish for more than 10 years now. She avail a loan to finance her livelihood.

She  is asking for a loan to purchase more stocks of fish and foam (fish storage).  These are very essential tools to augment her current source of income. Florita could now able to purchase and sold variety of fish.
Thus, her earnings will improve and able to handle her finances. She could now start to expand her business and also set aside some savings in preparation of the old age.

Florita is hoping that in the long run, she could handle her fish vending business properly to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish and foam (fish storage)

loans.name: Saul Alexander

texts.es:
Saul tiene 39 años de edad,conviviente, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Nueva Arica, en una zona rural ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

Saul se dedica a la venta de producto agrícolas, agroquímicos y fertilizantes, cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en este rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de mercadería para incrementar el stock de productos de su negocio, lo que tendrá gran influencia en el negocio, con esto el espera poder atender los diversos requerimientos de los clientes de la zona lo que le permitirá incrementar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, he has 3 children, and lives with his family in the district of Nueva Arica, in a rural area located in the province of Chiclayo, which is in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Perú. The people of this district make their living mainly through agriculture and raising livestock.

Saul is engaged in the sale of agricultural products, argochemicals and fertilizers, and has over 5 years of experience in this field. He is applying for a loan to purchase a larger quantity of goods to increase the stock of products for his business, which will have a great effect on the business. With this loan he hopes to be able to meet the diverse requirements of the customers in the area, allowing him to increase his income and thus improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of goods to increase the stock of products for his business.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia started her business, Essentially Coconut, after the birth of her youngest son three years ago when she needed something to take her mind off the chaos of raising four children. As a hobby, she started grinding coconut at home and began experimenting with different blends of nuts and sweeteners.

When Sophia began selling her products at local farmers' markets, she knew she was in business. Sophia’s product was a hit. Everyone loved her coconut butter! Essentially Coconut naturally and instantly became a passion of Sophia's, regardless of the challenges that came with both running a business while raising a family of four.

Sophia is currently seeking a loan to rent additional kitchen hours so that she can partner with a local social service agency for the purpose of bringing on interns from their culinary program. The loan will also allow her to purchase necessary equipment for interns and potential employees.

Sophia’s vision for the future is to see Essentially Coconut grow as a business that promotes health and wellness, while also helping people from marginalized populations find employment with her company to better their lives.

loans.use: to rent additional kitchen hours and purchase necessary equipment for interns and potential employees.

loans.name: Optimistic Life - T8Đhảitgia Group

texts.en:
Mrs Côi is 51 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 8 years. Côi lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region, so she can not run her business easily.

The main hardship that Côi faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more items for her grocery store and resell to increase the income.
This is Côi first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could help her improver her life standard.
Côi is the leader of T8ĐHảiTGia, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Côi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her grocery store and resell to increase the income.

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en:
Evelia is 59 years old and widowed with four children. With one child in school, Evelia works very hard to provide for them.

Evelia runs a general store  in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Evelia has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Evelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy low-cost, manually operated farm implements.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 21 years old. He is the last born in a family of three and comes from Mzimba, Malawi. Frank is asking for a loan in order to start running his own business. He has completed training with Zoona to set up his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent.

This means that Frank will be offering the service of mobile money to his community and earning a profit for each transaction that he makes. He is grateful for the opportunity to start running his own business. He explains that he has always wanted to run a business of his own, as he currently does not have a source of income and depends on his parents for his day to day needs.

With this loan, Frank will be able to serve his customers by providing the float needed for him to make transactions. The loan will also enable him to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone and cashbox. All these are necessary items for him to successfully get his business off the ground. Frank would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders for their support. He is hopeful that once he starts running his own business, he can begin to contribute the household and take care of his own basic needs like clothes and food.

loans.use: to purchase a Zoona branded trading Trolley, a mobile phone, and a cashbox. It will also enable him to serve people in the community who need to access financial services.

loans.name: Sern's Group

texts.en: Sern’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saluon's Group

texts.en: A 23-year-old woman who lives in Siem Reap province, Saluon is married and has two dependent children. To overcome the hardship in the family, she is growing rice for the main source of income while her husband is working as a blacksmith to supplement income. Together, they earn about 29,000KHR per day. The crop is not healthy enough to produce good outputs; this is the challenge to her business. Now, Saluon is applying for a loan, which is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Based on the past loan which was fully repaid, she has managed it well to provide her children with sufficient foods. As the leader of two member group, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve the farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to expand her business so as to upgrade the living condition.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve the farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Banteay Srey Distrcit

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en: Theary’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Theary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36 year old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She is a mother of four children.

Some years ago she started her own business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market.

She aspires to save money to provide a prosperous future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en:
Hanifan is 40 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and two sons.

Hanifan has been running a silver crockery store for many years and is responsible for feeding the entire family. Hanifan is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, because she has to purchase different types of silver crockery e.g. jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets etc. This loan will help her to purchase these items for expanding her business, so that she can earn maximum profits and increase her daily sales. She can also use the profit as savings to fulfill her future needs.

Hanifan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of silver crockery e.g. jugs, glasses, plates, dinner sets etc to expand her business.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in village with her family. She is divorced and is hardworking, responsible, capable and light-hearted person. She works hard and tries to ensure her children do well. The standard of their living is poor.

She has not money to be treated at hospital. Recently she is sick and needs healing. She appealed to IMON and Kiva lenders asking financial support to be treated at hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase furniture for the reception area and have enough funds to set up payroll.

loans.name: Marselina

texts.en:
Marselina is a 45 year old woman who is married to Lendalinus, a 46 years old handyman. From their marriage, they have been blessed with 3 children.

To support her husband in fulfilling their family needs, she has been working as a vegetable seller in the market for 6 years. By utilizing capital amounting of IDR 50.000, she started her business by selling vegetables in small amounts. As time goes by, her business shows good progress. But due to the increasing of vegetables price and lack of capital she could not afford to buy in bulk. That situation resulted reduction of business income and the generated income is not enough anymore for fulfill the whole family needs.

She thought that to get out from this situation, she has to gets a loan as an additional capital to expand her business by purchasing more vegetables in bulk such as; tomatoes, chili, cabbages, water spinach, spinach, eggplants, etc. To make her dream can be materialized, she joined with the existing group in TLM, and then requested an individual loan totaling of IDR 3.000.000. She hopes that through this loan, her business can run well and survive so the income can be increased.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables in huge amounts such as; tomato, chili, cabbage, water spinach, spinach, eggplant, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline  hails in the town of Panglao, Bohol.  A mother of 2-year old daughter. She sells fresh fish to the neighboring towns. Almost 3 years now that she has been engaged in fish vending business. Her husband has also an income that would help defray the family's daily expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted fish, and supplies like cellophane, styro foam( fish storage) and ice. These will boost the daily income of Jacqueline. She could sold variety of fish and able to support the family's daily needs.

Thus, she could now able to handle her finances and able to afford  to buy good food that is essential for her child's  growth .

Jacqueline is determined that she could manage her business well to be successful in the future to come.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish, and supplies like cellophane, styro foam( for fish storage) and ice.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is grateful that the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) has partnered with Kiva to help new entrepreneurs with their business. The previous loan that she applied for was utilized for her businesses. She was able to buy stock of personal products for her buy and sell business. She also bought a new engine for her Jeepney. It is one of the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. She's indeed very thankful for lenders who helped with her previous loan.

After 10 years of running these businesses, she earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month. She thanks God for continuously sending customers who help increase her daily sales. However, aside from putting her daily earnings into the business, some are used for her family's daily expenses, since she has two children who are still studying. She again applied for a PHP 15,000 loan as supplementary capital to pay for her vehicle maintenance, and to buy stock of personal products for her buy and sell business.

Marlyn is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she can gain spiritual strength from members' life-changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay microfinance loans, and hear the message of God's word.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be responsible. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, soap,cooking fat,salt and other items. His primary customers are locals. He describes his family challenge to be shortage of water during dry season. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable financially. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells mobile phone accessories. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the area of Kitale.
She was unable to study to get a professional career because of the economic situation that her family faced. However, she never gave up and she has been practicing farming for the past 10 years. Florence always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of how much she likes farming she has even nicknamed one of her cows, which makes her a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows. Through her dairy cow, she is able to get between 10 and 15 liters a day, and this helps her support her family.

Florence also practices crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Florence is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Florence believes that through the loan, she will turn around her family life and be able to give her children a solid educational background. This loan will be Florence’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements such as fertilizers,pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Gladis Lucia

texts.es:
Gladis es una mujer solidaria de 42 años de edad que busca a través del Micro-crédito una solución para tener una mejor entrada de dinero suficiente para sostenerse y poder vivir bien junto a su familia.

Tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende ropa y productos de uso personal para todo tipo de clientes a traves de catálogos, atiende a sus clientes siempre con un excelente servicio pues sabe que de estos depende la sostenibilidad de su negocio.
Trabaja todos los días a la semana durante 8 horas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de ropa para dama y caballero, productos como desodorantes, lociones, cremas, entre otros; los cuales le permitirán abastecerse y crecer.
texts.en:
Gladis is a caring woman of 42 years, who is looking forward to having a solution through microcredit to earn a better income, sufficient to sustain herself and to live well with her family.

She has a small business where she sells clothing and personal care products for all types of customers through catalogs; she always attends to her customers with excellent service, knowing that the sustainability of her business depends on it.

She works every day of the week for 8 hours.

She is asking for a loan to purchase assorted clothing for men and women and products like deodorants, lotions, and creams, among others; which will allow her to stock up her business and grow.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing for men and women and products like deodorants, lotions, and creams, among others; which will allow her to stock up her business and grow.

loans.name: Zione

texts.en:
Growing up in poverty has made Zione a self-driven woman determined to be successful at what she does. Zione is 23 years old and lives with her parents and her three sisters and one brother in Mzuzu, Malawi. Her mother sales second hand clothes to provide for her and her siblings.
Zione is excited to start running her own business. She completed high school in 2014 and started a short course in Business Administration, but she had to drop out of the college due to lack of financing. Zione then started helping out her mother at the market selling second hand clothes. Through working with her mother, Zione learnt how to talk to customers as she had to convince them to buy clothes. The challenge that Zione faces is that her mother’s profits from selling second hand clothes is not enough to provide for the whole family. Zione wants to contribute positively to the family by being able to contribute financially.

Zione has successfully completed training with Zoona in order to start running her own business as a Zoona Mobile money transfer agent. This means that Zione will set up her business in Nkhata-Bay and people in the community will be able to go to her trolley to send and receive money.
Zione is requesting for a Kiva loan in order to start her business. With the loan, she will be able to purchase a trading trolley where she will conduct her business. She will also purchase a web-enabled phone and a cashbox. This loan will also equip Zione with the funds needed for her to serve customers on a daily basis. This loan will help Zione start her own business so that she can have an income to help support her family and reduce the poverty levels.

loans.use: to start running her Zoona business so that she can be able to support her family financially.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a 27-year-old humble and hardworking woman from Falakata. She lives there with her husband Banshi, who works in a potato cold-storage. They both are uneducated, but can sign their names only. They have no kids now.

Shyamali’s husband's income is insufficient to provide a better living, so Shyamali has been engaged in cattle breeding for the last five years. She started her business with the purchase of one cow. She supplies milk to her neighbors and earns for her family. She also sells cow dung, which is used as manure in the farmland.

Now this business is a strong financial support to the family. As the prices of essential commodities are increasing by leaps and bounds, she has to work hard so that she can be able to generate more income. She has decided to purchase one more cow and expand her business.

For this reason, she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to be able to purchase a dairy cow, which will help her in more milk production for the expansion of her business, as well as earn more profit. With the increased profit, she hopes to build a concrete house in the future and save for her family’s well being.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her existing milk-selling business.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 39 years old lady and a mother of 5 children. The man shown in the photo is Shakeela ’s husband who is providing services of vehicle repairing for many years. By this time he has established good clients and makes enough to meet the household expenses. However, due to lack of availability of funds he is unable to meet with the daily demands of his customers.

For this reason Shakeela has availed Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. In this way her husband would be able to purchase more equipment such as screws, nails and spare parts to provide better services to his customers. Shakeela is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment such as screws, nails and spare parts for her husband to provide better services to his customers.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 46 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, one of them is still attending school. She is a housewife taking care of her adored family and her husband is the main income source in family, in addition to her children contributions.

With her loan requested from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, she will pay her children’s educational fees. She insist that she will be a permanent customer as her only goal is to guarantee an excellent educational path for her children in a friendly environment.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en: Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
As a parent of four children, Lalaine works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell flowers business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Lalaine is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy variety of flowers to sell for her buy and sell flowers business.

Lalaine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of flowers to sell

loans.name: Vun's Group

texts.en: A 30-year-old woman who resides in Battambang province, Vun is married and has four dependent children. Two children under age of school and a school-aged child are in need of her support. Vun and her husband have been growing cassava and paddy rice for the main source of income for thirty years. To earn extra income, she and husband spend their spare time on working for others for a fee. Now, she lacks of working capital to support businesses, so she has formed a group of two members to request for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which was completely repaid enabled her to provide healthier lives to family members. As the group leader, Vun will use her loan to support cassava farming business through paying for plowing fee and buying organic fertilizer. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so that she can build a proper house for family to live.

loans.use: To support cassava farming business through paying for plowing fee and buying organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a humble mother who wakes up every morning at 5 o’clock to work on her farm. She is fully dedicated to her farm work and thinks only of progressing. Regina resides in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which is a remote town with harsh living conditions because of the bad terrain in the region. She is happily married and, together with her husband, has a lovely family. Regina’s primary sources of income are milk and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. Regina has managed to take care of her family with her income from selling different varieties of food crops. The Nkubu area has conditions that favor crop farming.

Regina has always wanted to start banana farming, but the lack of capital has prevented her. She is seeking a loan to buy seeds and start banana farming. With this loan she will be able to harvest more bananas and, hence, satisfy the ready market in her region. Demand for bananas in the Nkubu area is high, but the supply is low. Through this loan, Regina is going to comfortably meet the demand.

Her increased income will allow Regina to provide a secure future for her school-going children by paying their tuition fees. She believes that education is the gateway to success. Her vision is to be a leading supplier of bananas to major hotels and households in her region. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy seeds and start banana farming.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en:
Ayat a 25 years old married future mother to be, works in preparing Mouneh and as a tutor from her house for a year now.
She is a hard working woman who supports her husband in developing their living to make sure that they can provide their future family members and good standard living.
Ayat is expecting her baby soon, thus her acquired businesses income isn't enough to cover unexpected baby delivery needs. Thus for this reason she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for the necessary expected baby delivery expenses and requested needs.
She hopes that in the future she can find the suitable business which fits with her graduated field of study.

loans.use: to pay for the necessary expected baby delivery expenses and requested needs.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en: Cora lives in the municipality of Getafe in the province of Bohol. She is 36 years old, married and with four children ages eight to fifteen. She is engaged in a Sari-sari (convenience) store business for two years now.  She sell rice, noodles, coffee, canned food, eggs, spices and soft drinks.  She is asking for a loan to buy canned food, chips, candies, beverages, fertilizer and to be used for labor payment on the hired help. It is her dream to be able to send her children to school and see them have a degree.

loans.use: to buy  canned food, chips, candies, beverages, fertilizer and to be used for labor payment on the hired help

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 23-year-old, single lady from Deir -Albalah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. Hir father works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but she wants to make her family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
So, Alaa' took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable her to buy a solar system for heating water for her family house. By taking this loan, she will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Alaa’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water at her family house.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 28-year-old married woman from Yatta, a village near the city of Hebron. She is the mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a construction worker, earning a low and unstable income. Ahlam has a sewing workshop in her house. She works to help her husband cover some of the family's expenses.

Ahlam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy textile and yarn for her sewing workshop. This will help her to increase her productivity and also her income.

loans.use: to buy textile and yarn for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers for top dressing her crops to improve production for more income gain.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be joyful. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals and vegetables

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a single woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cups, plates, spoons, handbags, towels and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils, towels, handbags and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of utensils, towels, handbags and other items

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She considers CCT as God’s extension of a blessing since her previous loan of 18,000 PHP that she applied for was granted. She is very grateful that the amount helped her buy additional products for her sari-sari business. Sari-sari is a Filipino word which means “variety” where customers can select from a wide variety of choices sold at a cheaper price compared to supermarkets and other convenience stores. She also wants to thank lenders who read her story and lent certain amounts to help her buy necessary items for her business.

Bebelyn aims to step up every year in her business. In the past six months, she witnessed the growth of her business with God as her greatest provider. This year she wants to expand the business even more by adding additional products and stock so that customers will have a variety of choices. She wants her sari-sari to become a one-stop shop for customers. With this, Bebelyn applied for another loan of 20,000 PHP to buy stock of grocery items, sacks of rice, eggs and school supplies.

Bebelyn is consistent in attending a weekly fellowship group for CCT partners. The group consists of 15 to 30 members where she can gain spiritual strength from members' life changing testimonies, share her own experience of God’s love, pay microfinance loans and hear God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy stock of grocery items, sacks of rice, eggs and school supplies.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a  parent of five children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy clothes and other materials use for her tailoring business.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy clothes and other materials used for dress making

loans.name: Narath's Group

texts.en:
Narath, 27, is the farmer living in Battambang province. Being a mother of a dependent child, she together with her husband is working hard on cassava growing to earn the main source of income. Sometimes, she is working for others for a fee to supplement income. Lacking of working capital is the main challenge for this family’s business. She is now leading a group which comprises of three members to apply for a loan; this is the first time for her.

As the group leader, she will use her loan to enhance the cassava farming business through paying for the plowing fee and purchasing the organic fertilizer. She hopes she can get more income from her business so as to buy an additional plot of farmland to expand the business.

loans.use: To enhance the cassava farming business through paying for the plowing fee and purchasing the organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en:
Charito engages in buko (young) coconut vending business. She sold young coconut juice to the local in her place. She is 39 years old married woman with three young dependents ages ages 9, 5 and 2 years old respectively. Her husband earns a living by being a carpenter.


Charito has requested a loan in the amount of 4,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of young coconut fruit, and supplies like straws and disposable glass. With the availability of these resources, she could continue operate her livelihood and enables her to improve her daily earnings. Thus, Charito could pay her obligations and start to balance her finances.

She is determined to manage her main source of income to be improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of young coconuts and supplies like straws and disposable glasses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cabbages and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Jay-Ann

texts.en:
Jay-Ann works hard to support her family. Jay-Ann is married and has a selling used clothes business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of used clothes to sell.

Jay-Ann has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Jay-Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Zithenie

texts.en:
Zithenie is 22 years old. She is one of three children and she has had to grow up quickly due to the death of both her parents. Zithenie is requesting for her first Kiva loan in order to empower herself so that she can start running her own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent.

Zithenie completed her high school education in 2010. She is excited to start running her own business so that she can help to provide financially for her household. Through running her own business Zithenie is hopeful that she will also be able to provide employment for her elder sister who is currently not in employment.

Zithenie is requesting for a Kiva loan so that she can have the funds needed to start running her own business. She has undergone an intensive training with Zoona. In the training, she learnt business and money management skills and how to serve her customers. Zithenie is positioned to succeed in her business as most people in her community do not have bank accounts and will go to her trolley to access financial services such as sending and receiving of money as well as paying their bills.

With this loan, Zithenie will be able to purchase a Zoona branded trading trolley where she will serve her customers from. She will also buy a web-enables cell phone and a cashbox. The loan will also help her have the funds needed for her to serve her customers. Zithenie thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to start running her own business by purchasing a trolley, a web-enabled phone, a cash box and have the funds to serve people who need to access Zoona financial services.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en:
Aliyu is a Babban Gona farmer from Magajin Gari Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Aliyu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to improve my farming skills.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see increase him increase his income considerably. This season Aliyu has ambitious plans to harvest 25 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Aliyu now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Phoeun is a 63-year-old widow who has six children, one of whom depends on her. To support family’s living, she has been growing paddy rice for 45 years for the main source of income. Additionally, she spends her spare time on reaping the rice for others for a fee. The rice crop grows unhealthily, which results in producing low outputs, is the main challenge to the business. This will be the third time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which she paid back the past loan completely. For the past loan she got, it has enabled her to improve the standard of living. Now, as the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields. She hopes she can earn more income so as to achieve her dream of purchasing a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock for her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Silvia Vanesa

texts.es: Silvia es una mujer de 24 años de edad que cada día brinda todo su esfuerzo para mejorar sus ventas cada día, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, desde hace 2 años. Silvia habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su padre y su hija de 3 años de edad, por lo que se siente feliz de poder apoyarle en lo que puede. Silvia desea mejorar su negocio, ya que actualmente no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos que le solicitan, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisetas, entre otros productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia is a 24-year-old woman who every day dedicates all her efforts to improving her sales as she has made a living selling clothing as a street vendor for 2 years. Silvia lives in her own house together with her father and her daughter who is three years old, so she feels happy to be able to support her how she can.

Silvia wants to improve her business as she currently isn't able to meet the demand for products requested from her. That's why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to invest in pants, blouses, skirts and shirts, among other products, to stock her business.

loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts and shirts, among other products, to stock her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers  and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for restaurant use. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for business use

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet 30 years, is married and supports two children. She is a small scale farmer earning an income of KES 10,000 per month. 


She has applied for her first loan from Visionfund Kenya of KES25,000 to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest. 


She plans to use the gained profits to expand her farming activity and educate her children. she hopes to improve her family living standards .

loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

loans.name: Vivol's Group

texts.en: Vivol’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Vivol works as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rarn's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Pursat province, Rarn is 31 years old and single. The main source of family’s income comes from rice growing and in order to add more income, she is selling grocery items in her community. She has been involved in her rice farming business for years, earning about 21,400KRH per day and save approximately about 3,600KHR after deducting daily expenses. This is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In this group of two, Rarn, who is the leader, will use her loan to purchase organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to support the farmland. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve the standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to support the farmland.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza es un grupo nuevo que se formo con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las unas a las otras y poder mejorar sus vidas a través del trabajo unido. Estan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Juana, integra este grupo, ella tiene una despensa, en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana, y con su negocio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, bebidas, lácteos y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas y procurarse los medios para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
La Esperanza is a new group that was formed with the hope of being able to help each other and be able to improve their lives through work together. They are in the poverty elimination program, working hard to be able to improve their life situations.

Juana is a member of this group. She has a store where every day she works from very early in the morning and with her business she has the means to be able to support her family and give them everything that she couldn't have. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve her life situation.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fruits, vegetables, drinks, dairy products, and more, to be able to continue with her sales and procure the means to be able to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, drinks, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: San Francsico Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Francisco está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona rural, aun en crecimiento y de difícil acceso, donde los pobladores luchan por poder mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Margarita es una de las integrantes, ella tiene una despensa que con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar y que hoy día ya tiene muchos clientes que siempre se acercan hasta su negocio para poder comprar lo que ella ofrecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser frutas, carne, bebidas, panificados y otros variados, para que de esa forma pueda seguir esforzándose y luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group San Francisco is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. It is from the city of Curuguaty, a rural zone, still in development and with difficult access, where the people struggle to be able to improve each day.

Margarita is one of the members. She has a store that, with a lot of effort, she was able to establish and that today has many customers who always come to her business to be able to purchase what she offers.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase a variety of supplies for her store, such as fruits, meat, drinks, baked goods, and a variety of other products, so that in this way to be able to continue working hard and struggling to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, meat, drinks, baked goods and a variety of other things.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
El grupo Los Angeles se formó en la ciudad de Concepción, una zona aun en crecimiento y de difícil acceso, las integrantes se pusieron como meta poder mejorar sus vidas y la zona donde viven.
La Sra.  Emilce es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde tiene su local de artesanías, ella trabaja haciendo todo tipo de artesanías en barro, como planteras, santos, alcancías, recuerdos, etc. Desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya vaya mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de barro en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con la elaboración de sus artesanías como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Los Angeles was formed in the city of Concepción, a zone still in development and with difficult access. The members established their goal as improving their lives and the zone where they live.

Emilce is one of the members. She is from a zone with is far from the center of the city, where she has a crafts shop. She works making all sorts of clay crafts, such as flower pots, saints, piggy banks, souvenirs, etc. She wants, as time passes, and through the help of Fundación Paraguaya, to improve.

She asks for this loan to purchase clay in bulk, so that in this way she can continue with making her crafts as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase clay in bulk to make crafts.

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 32-years-old married man where he lives in Dier El Balah. He is a father of two sons and one daughter and works as a plumber sometimes. It is a good business but the income is not stable.

Jehad decided to start a new business which is transferring goods using a rickshaw.
Jehad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for his business. This will inable him to increase his income and improve the family living conditions.
Jehad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for his business.

loans.name: Maricela Ivana

texts.es: Maricela de 28 años de edad se dedica desde hace 1 año  a la venta de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante, por lo que ha logrado hacerse de una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Ella es madre soltera y vive junto a sus dos hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad en casa de sus padres. Maricela desea continuar mejorando su negocio y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, blusas, faldas, camisetas, vestidos entre otros productos que sus clientes solicitan.
texts.en: Maricela, 28 years old, has worked for 1 year selling clothing, work that she does as a street vendor, so she has managed to get a large number of customers who ask for her products. She is a single mother and lives with her two children, ages 1 and 7, in her parents' house. Maricela wants to continue improving her business and for this she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, dresses and other products that her customers request.

loans.use: to invest in pants, blouses, skirts, shirts, dresses, and other products that her customers request.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora Aty  está trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas son mujeres muy unidas que quieren ir superándose para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Ruth quien tiene una cantina en una escuela, tiene todo tipo de productos para poder cumplir con sus clientes,  comenta que a través de su trabajo se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta.
Ruth pide este préstamo para comprar comestibles, bebidas, galletitas y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y luchar por mejorar.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora Aty group is working within the poverty elimination program. They are very close-knit women who want to improve themselves to be able to grow and improve their life situations.

One of the members of the group is Ruth who has a snack bar at a school where she has all sorts of products to be able to satisfy her customers. She says that through her work, she earns a living in a dignified and honest way.

Ruth asks for this loan to purchase food products, drinks, cookies, and more, to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing, and to struggle to improve.

loans.use: to purchase food products, drinks, cookies, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to spray her crops for more harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to spray his crops for a better harvest.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is 31 yeas old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She is been in work of machine embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her bright future and desires to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for its embellishment; will allow her to cater to more customers consistently.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 46 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Gina has been raising pigs for 8 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rawhaida

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rawhaida works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Rawhaida is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, spices, egg, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.

Rawhaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, egg, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, wood, etc

loans.name: Saleka

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Saleka lives in a small village called Nabanagar in Falakata of West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two sons. Her sons are studying in grade 6 and 5 respectively.

Saleka’s husband runs an animal husbandry. After managing all the household work, she also helps her husband in this work. They purchase goat kids and after rearing them to maturity, they then sell them to the local meat shops at a profitable price. The demand for goat meat is very high in her locality in festive seasons and for various occasions.

To meet this demand, Saleka needs to expand her husband’s animal trading business, but the main barrier is lack of capital. So, Saleka applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more goat kids for the expansion of her husband’s business.

She hopes this investment will return her good revenue as well as a better profit, so she will be able to develop her family’s financial status to provide good education to her children.

She is very thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy more goat kids for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Ya'u

texts.en: Ya'u is a Babban Gona farmer from Magajin Gari Vilage. Ya'u joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ya'u will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Ya'u would like to use his extra earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
Diana está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, comenta que está a un año de poder terminar sus estudios, y es por ello que está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder lograrlo.
Ella proviene de una familia que lucha y se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Diana is studying for a degree in accounting. She says that she has one year left to be able to finish her studies, and for this she is putting her best effort into being able to achieve it.

She comes from a family that struggles and works hard to be able to get ahead and be someone in life.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in paying the tuition for her program, and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli tiene 20 años y está siguiendo dos carreras; para ser Nutricionista y Cocinera Profesional (cheff), sus metas son la de poder terminar las dos carreras que está estudiando y su mayor aspiración es trabajar independientemente en las carreras que sigue.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Araceli is 20 years old and is studying two majors, to be a nutritionist and a professional cook (chef). Her goal is to be able to finish both majors that she is studying and her greatest aspiration is to work independently in the fields she is following.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the tuition for her program, and in this way be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en: Jerusha is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. Her business goal is to expand business to other towns within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a big store. This is her fourth loan with  SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rebecca is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rebecca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. and materials to use for her food vending business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 16 years. Rebecca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingriedients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. and materials to use for her food vending business

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportationto her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no  piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married and has five children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in number of clients hence perishable of goods leading to losses.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Frecil

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Frecil works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Frecil is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Frecil has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of fishing nets.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a 27-year-old woman. She lives in a village of Falakata in West Bengal with her husband and three daughters. Two of them are studying in grades seven and two respectively, and the other is below school-going age. Her husband Abdul is 35 years old and a farmer by profession.

To bear the family expenses, Abdul has been involved with paddy cultivation, and he has been selling the harvest product to distributors for the past ten years. He also supplies the crops to the rice dealers in the nearby market. With the growing increase in prices of the essential commodities, they are facing problems to cope with their small savings. In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, he wants to grow more paddies. To help her husband, Merina is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS, which she will use to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to cover operational costs for paddy cultivation.

Her goal is to increase the business activity. She is sure that this line of work has great economic potential. She is very thankful to Kiva and BJS for this great help and support.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to cover other costs for cultivation of paddies.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Joyce thirty two years old, married and a mother of two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 where she has been trained on enterprise management and record keeping. This has enabled her view her farming as a business.
She rears dairy cattle to earn a living and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy a calf in order to increase her milk production in the near future. She hopes to get better returns to enable her pay school fees for her children.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To buy a calf and therefore increase milk production in the near future for higher incomes

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon Layi Village. he joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Musa no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to provide healthcare for my family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see increase him increase his income considerably.  This season Musa has ambitious plans to harvest 20 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Musa now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of my community through my farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Nazia  is 36 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Nazia  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she has availed Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothing of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay exam fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase drinks, meat, baked goods, dairy products, and more.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es:
La Señora Ingrid tiene 31 años de edad, está casada, tiene una hija, ella se encuentra trabajando en un Banco hace más de 4 años y al mismo tiempo está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ingrid es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere crecer y salir adelante.
