Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 31 years old, married and has a daughter. Ingrid has been working at a bank for more than four years and, at the same time, is studying for a degree in accounting in order to be able to help her family.

Ingrid is very hard-working and plucky; she wants to grow and move forward.

Ingrid is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees and continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que su meta es terminar la carrera de administración de empresas y luego poder ejercerla y a la vez poder especializarse más, tener un local propio y poder administrar.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
Eugenia is from the city of Coronel Oviedo and says that her goal is to finish her degree in business management and then practise her profession. She would also like to specialise further and have her own business to manage.

Eugenia is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees, continue with her studies and move forward in life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 30s is married with three children who are still at school. She has been selling charcoal for two years now. She works from 07am to 08pm daily and is able to make very good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the charcoal stock and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, bought a radio, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group DDC which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his program tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 3 sacks of local rice and add more various ones of vegetables.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda offers soft drinks, ice candy and ice within her local community. She has doing this kind of business for two years. She is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. Currently, two of her children attends to school while the other two are already working.

Rosalinda would like to help her husband in generating income that's the reason why she would like to borrow a loan of PHP5,000. She will use this amount in buying cases of soft drinks and plastic for ice candy and ice. Rosalinda hopes continuous growth of her business involvement.

loans.use: to buy cases of soft drinks and plastics for ice candy and ice to sell.

loans.name: Meri

texts.en:
Meri 45 years old married woman from Batumi district. She lives with her husband and 2 children. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow mandarin and nut trees. Meri and her family work hard to insure a good harvest which is sold locally.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables Meri to get a loan. With the received credit Meri will purchase a car and her husband will serve locals as a taxi driver. This will give them a chance to generate stable income and improve their living conditions. Meri awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car so that her husband will serve people as a taxi driver and make a stable income for the family

loans.name: Yong's Group

texts.en: Yong is a 43-year-old widowed woman who is blessed with two dependent children, one of whom is in school, living in Kampong Cham province. Main income of this family is from rice growing and supplemental income is from corn and soybean growing. She has been in these businesses for 25 years. Drought is the major obstacle to her family’s business. Now, she forms a group of three members to take out a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first time for her. As the group leader, she will use her loan to purchase fuel for pumping machine, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield. She hopes she can earn more income from her business in order to upgrade the standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for pumping machine, organic pesticide and organic fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ratanbala

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Ratanbala is a hardworking housewife and a lovely mother of four children (three daughters and a son). She does her household jobs and takes care of her children. Her two daughters are married; only her son is engaged in agricultural activities, and her youngest daughter is a student of grade 12 whose education is the greatest priority of Ratanbala. Her husband Ranjit is a farmer. Ratanbala lives at Ramthenga village in Falakata with her husband, son, and daughter.

Ratanbala's daughter, 20-year-old Aloka, reads in grade 12 at Kushiarbari Haleswar High School. She is a sincere and hardworking girl. She says that her ambitious quality will let her reach her goal to achieve an M.A. degree (Master of Arts). At present, she is focusing on her Higher Secondary Board exam, for which she is striving hard. She thinks proper educational help from her parents' side will give her an opportunity to successfully complete her Board exam. She embraces loyalty, and will study loyally until she reaches her goal.

So, her mother Ratanbala is requesting an education loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to help continue her daughter's education without any worry and anxiety. Her mother will purchase relevant study materials and pay for her exam fees, private tuition fees, and school fees with the loan amount, so that her daughter's dreams come true.

Ratanbala and her daughter Aloka are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's educational expenses.

loans.name: Sakeeda

texts.en: Sakeeda  is 49 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has availed Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Mithu lives in a small village of Falakata in the district of Alipurduar in West Bengal. She is married to Ratan, who is engaged in a potato business. They are blessed with two sons. One of them is studying in grade three, and the other is below school-going age.

Being a homemaker, Mithu runs a small milk-selling business. Her small-scale business forms the core support for her family. With just limited monthly savings, her family is constantly at risk of falling into financial strain. Realizing that she must do something to increase her savings for the future, Mithu is eager to expand her small-scale business. She needs to purchase more cows to quickly scale up the size of her business. So, Mithu is seeking financial help from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

The loan will help Mithu to increase milk production as well as scale up her business quickly. Simultaneously, she can enhance the financial sustenance for her family’s well-being.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro esta estudiando para poder ser un buen policía, espera que al terminar sus estudios pueda ser un buen profesional que ayude y este al servicio de las personas que necesiten su ayuda- Pedro esta esforzándose para poder ser alguien en la vida y poder también ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de sus estudios, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Pedro is studying to be a good police officer. He hopes that, when he finishes his studies, he can be a good professional who helps and is at the service of those who need his help. Pedro is working hard in order to be able to be somebody in life, and also to be able to help his loved ones.

Pedro is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees and thereby continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es un profesional que lucha por poder crecer y mejorar cada día, está estudiando la carrera de bioquímica clínica
Su objetivo es seguir mejorando sus ingresos obteniendo un título para una mejorar su vida, y con ello poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Marcos is a professional who works hard to grow and improve every day. He is studying for a degree in clinical biochemistry,

Marcos' aim is to continue improving his income by obtaining a degree to make his life better. He can thus help his family and loved ones.

Marcos is applying for this loan in order to pay tuition fees and thereby continue with his studies. Marcos is grateful for this opportunity to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: La Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Familia” está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de las señoras está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Rosa, una de las integrantes solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales para su confección de sábanas y manteles, como ser telas, hilos y gomas, lo que le ayudará  a poder seguir con sus negocios de confecciones.
Rosa es una mujer muy sacrificada que se gana la vida por medio de su trabajo, y con ello ayuda a su familia, a darles una vida digna.
texts.en:
The group “La Familia” is in its second loan cycle with the women's committee program, they are in the poverty elimination program, where each one of the ladies is putting forth her best effort to be able to improve her life situation.

Rosa, one of the members, asks for this loan to purchase materials to make sheets and tablecloths, such as fabric, thread and elastics, which will help her to be able to continue with her sewing business.

Rosa is a very self-sacrificing woman who earns her living through her work and, with it, helps her family to give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread and elastics.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo tiene 18 integrantes, todas ellas se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una está luchando para poder crecer y mejorar y también poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Por medio de las capacitaciones que están recibiendo luchan por poder salir adelante, entre ellas se destaca la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a vender comidas que ella misma hace, y también vende bebidas variadas, a través de las cuales ella tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y otros seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para sus comidas, como carne, condimentos, hortalizas y otros, y también bebidas para la venta. Ella está contenta por formar parte del programa de comités, que le será de mucha ayuda en mejorar su vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This group has 18 members, all of whom have come together to help each other through their work. They are part of the poverty elimination programme where each one is working hard to grow and improve, and to be able to help their loved ones.

Through training, the members are fighting to move forward. One member is Juana, who makes a living selling meals that she herself prepares. She also sells beverages. Through this work, she has the means to be able to help her family and other loved ones.

Juana is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies to make meals, such as meat, condiments, vegetables and more, and to buy beverages.. She is happy to be part of the committee programme, which will be of great help in improving her and her loved ones' lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make meals, such as meat, condiments, vegetables and more, and to buy beverages.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas De Mbajue Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso, son 17 mujeres que luchan para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo unido y también a través de las capacitaciones de la fundación paraguaya. El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una persona de este grupo que se destaca por ser una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora es la Sra. Esperanza, quien se dedica a hacer comidas ella misma, y después sale a vender de manera ambulante por su barrio. Comenta que ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella las ricas comidas que hace.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the city of Mariano Roque Alsonso. They are 17 women who struggle to be able to help their loved ones through their work together and also through the training from Fundación Paraguaya. The group is in the poverty elimination program where each one is improving her life situation.

One person in this group who stands out as a very self-sacrificing and determined woman is Esperanza, who works making food herself, and then goes out to sell it as a street vendor in her neighborhood. She says that she already has a well-established customer base which always buys the rich food she makes from her.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies to be able to make her food such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, baked goods, and more, so as to be able to continue with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase meat, seasonings, vegetables, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 21-year-old single man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day regularly. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs.

Because he is not able to save enough money, Muhammad Took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en: Victor is a single man. He has 1 child. He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy a water tank to store more water for sell. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business..

loans.use: buy a water tank to store more water for sell

loans.name: Dario

texts.en:
Dario is a farmer living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is a 58-year-old married man with six grown children. He engages in vegetable farming. He grows vegetables such as squash, eggplant, and bottle gourds, and he grows rice for additional income.

Dario is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. These are important to achieve high yields. With the fertilizers and farm supplies, he can sell more vegetables and rice to his customers. Dario dreams of having healthy crops so can sell more and improve his livelihood, giving him a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Mampi

texts.en:
Mampi is a young lady of 18 years old. She is married to Jagadish. She attended school up to grade ten. Now she is blessed with one son. They live in a remote region of Falakata in Alipurduar district in their own small mud and straw-made house.

Mampi's husband is 28 years old and a farmer by profession. He mainly grows vegetables like potatoes, gourds, ladies fingers, beans, etc. on his farmland. He grows quality products and sells them to the market. So, the numbers of customers are increasing gradually. Mampi also assists her husband in farming in her leisure hours. Now they want to cultivate teasel gourd, as this is the perfect season to grow this crop.

Thus, Mampi is requesting a loan to buy teasel gourd seeds, pesticide, fertilizer, etc. to grow teasel gourd. Mampi and her husband hope that they will have a good harvest with the help of this loan. With the profit from this business, they can secure their lives in terms of food and good health.

Mampi dreams to purchase a piece of land to expand the business with the profit in the future. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for teasel gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a Babban Gona farmer from Gwani Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining, Thomas no longer has to worry about having an inadequate income to feed his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will help him increase his income considerably.

This season Thomas has ambitious plans to harvest 25 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Thomas now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Abashyizehamwe Sub Group B

texts.en: Mary is a group leader; aged 30 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 5 years. The group is called ABASHYIZEHAMWE means “Solidarity” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 3 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, maize flour and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, maize flour and bananas for sale.

loans.name: Mamman

texts.en: Mamman is a Babban Gona farmer from Sabon Layi Vilage. Mamman joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mamman will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Mamman would like to use his extra earnings to build a house/ renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en:
Shanaz is 52 years old and married woman. She is shown in the photo with her nephew who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses as they live together in a joint family system. Now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine.

For this reason, Shanaz has availed Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR, for her nephew. He wants to replace auto body along with new tires.

loans.use: to replace auto body along with new tires.

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat is a bright boy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1997. He is single and lives in a village with his parents. Azamat is a student at a university. He is an active, responsible, communicative, and honest person. He wants to study hard and graduate with excellence. He is willing to work for social change.

Azamat is asking a loan from Kiva lenders to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be outgoing. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a hotel within 5 years.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as ambitious. Neema operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as the rainy season, which affects business.

Neema will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ready to wear like shoes, pants, blouses, etc. to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ready to wear like shoes, pants, blouses, etc. to sell

loans.name: Johnson

texts.en:
Johnson used the previous loan to to buy layers and broilers for his poultry farm. He is a farmer growing food crops like tomatoes, cabbages, and maize. In addition to that, he earns a monthly salary and supplements it with his wife's salary plus poultry farming.

He is faced with challenges of bad weather and low market prices, which all contribute to low profits and delayed growth. In addition, he and his wife also complain of low and delayed salary payments from the government.

However, Johnson has a vision of boosting his yields in the coming season to earn more income. He has asked for a loan to buy agriculture inputs like tomato seeds, cabbage seeds, and maize to plant.

loans.use: to buy agriculture inputs like tomato seeds, cabbage seeds, and maize to plant.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is a 39-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruit selling business. He owns a fruit selling business in a nearby fruit market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow the business also.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruit in bulk. She wants to save the profit amount so that she can face any sudden incidents or for medical treatment for her children.

She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Nasira is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits in bulk for her husband fruits selling business.

loans.name: Srorng

texts.en:
Aged 36, Srorng lives in Kratie province, and she is married. She has four dependent children, three of whom are being educated in school and need support.

She is growing paddy rice, which is the main family business, to support her family’s needs. In addition to her income, she grows soybeans. She has been involved in her businesses for 18 years.

She failed to irrigate sufficient water to the farmland, and the crop produced lower than expected yields. As she is in need of working capital, she is now applying for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which will be her first time. She will use her loan to pay for the plowing fee and to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yields. She hopes this loan will help her enlarge her business so as to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to purchase rice seeds and organic fertilizer to increase the productivity of her crop yields.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
A local farmer who is from Kratie province, Ken is 29 years old. He is divorced and has two dependent children to look after, one of whom attends school and the other one is too young for schooling.

This breadwinner has been growing rice for years to support the family. In order to earn additional income, he sells grocery items in his village. The rice farming has been threatened by drought; thus, he is applying for a loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which is the first time for him. Ken will use some of his loan to buy organic fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice farming business and the remaining will be used to buy some grocery items to resell. He hopes to generate more income so as to upgrade his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and rice seeds for his rice farming business.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en: Mathew  is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gwani Village. Mathew joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mathewwill have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mathew now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Stepping Mothers Group

texts.en:
Lucia is 32 years in age, married and she has been blessed with four children. She is a member of Stepping Mothers group, consisting of 4 single-minded individuals who are keen to break the cycle of poverty. Their group name is pregnant with meaning, as they are stepping towards financial breakthrough from the various businesses they operate.  She finds herself in a thorny state of affairs occasionally because some of her clients pay later than they have agreed and that brings a glitch in her business cycle. However despite the challenges she faces she continues to make ends meet.
 
She is from a newly constructed suburb of Stone Ridge located in the heart of Harare, Zimbabwe. Due to the fact that she operates in a new neighbourhood this gives her an advantage since there is not much competition to talk about. She operates an eye-catching flea market in that area. 
Shoes and clothes are the most common part of her stock since their cycle is short hence they are a cash cow in her business. Most of her wares she restocks them from across the boundary of Zimbabwe, in Botswana and South Africa.

loans.use: To acquire more goods for resale.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is a first-year student at Kepler. Her parents have a small farm in western Rwanda, and she grew up dreaming about being the first in her family to attend university. Because of Claudine's impressive academic credentials, she was accepted to Kepler from over 6,000 applicants this year. Claudine chose to attend Kepler because of its focus on providing the skills she'll need to compete in a competitive labor market.
 
Claudine plans to major in Communications with a Concentration in Business, and will graduate Kepler with a BA from an accredited US university. She considers her greatest strength to be her ability to collaborate and share ideas with her peers. Outside of class, she stays fit by doing yoga and swimming.

loans.use: To pay for a laptop required for a US college degree

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 50-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has six children. Two of these children are still attending school.

Her husband is a carpenter, and she is engaged in a hog raising business. She has been doing this for two years. To continue her livelihood, she is asking a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy feed for her pigs. In the future, Lolita wishes to expand her business to have sustainable earnings.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina proviene de una familia de escasos recursos, desde muy joven empezó a trabajar para poder así costear sus estudios. 
Está estudiando la carrera de ciencias contables, es una persona muy emprendedora que lucha por poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Romina comes from a family with few resources and so she began working when she was very young in order to pay for her studies.

She is currently studying accounting sciences. She is an enterprising young woman who works hard to become someone successful.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay university fees so she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una persona muy luchadora, a la vez que estudia también trabaja en su negocio de la despensa. Está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y por medio de su profesión quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella es una persona que quiere ser alguien en la vida y por medio de sus estudios abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia has a tenacious personality. She is currently studying and working at the same time at a grocery store. She is studying psychology and she wants to use her degree to help others.

She wants to be someone one day and she believes her studies will open the door for her to be successful.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay university fees and to continue in her studies.

loans.use: pay university fees.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Sixty-one-year-old Visitacion makes and sells tableya, a Filipino hot chocolate drink in various sizes and forms. She is married with three grown children. She has been selling tableya for almost 15 years. In addition, she also sells ready-to-wear clothing like slippers, sandals, dresses, shorts, pants and ladies' jeans.

She is asking for a loan to buy cacao seeds and ready-to-wear clothing like slippers, dresses, pants, shorts and sandals. With this loan, she will be able to prepare more tableya to sell to her customers. Thus, she will be able to roll-out her capital and settle her finances. She will also be able to afford healthy food, which is essential for her day-to-day livelihood activities.

Visitacion hopes that both her sources of income will prosper and with this, she will be able to lend a hand to those who are less fortunate.

loans.use: to buy cacao seeds and ready-to-wear clohtes like slippers, dresses, pants, shorts and sandals.
